title: Simple BPA-free food grade sensory toy with entertainment value; rated for 18 months & older
text:
This is a great BPA-free food grade sensory toy for toddlers. It is rated for toddlers 18 months and older. It looks like an airplane with tentacles. The tentacles are silicone and can be pulled through the body of the "aircraft." There are some others like this that have fidget circles and buttons but this one does not. It is a basic unit.

I really like this but it is important to supervise the child when using this. Also, be careful because it can be thrown easily by grabbing onto the tentacles.

The current price of $7.19 ($11.99 minus 40%) is excellent for this. For those interested in units with buttons but a little more expensive, then take a look at this [[ASIN:B0B62KX3F9 one]].

title: Great BPA-free food grade sensory toy with entertainment value; rated for 18 months & older
text:
This is a great BPA-free food grade sensory toy for toddlers. It is rated for toddlers 18 months and older. It looks like a spaceship with tentacles. The tentacles are silicone and can be pulled through the "spaceship." There are three fidget circles on one side of the perimeter. On the other side, there is one button that, when pressed, moves from hole to hole.

I really like this but it is important to supervise the child when using this. Also, be careful because it can be thrown easily by grabbing onto the tentacles.

The current price of $13.59 ($16.99 minus 20%) is on the high side of competitively priced for this as a similar one can be currently purchased [[ASIN:B0B62KX3F9 here]] for $10.79 or [[ASIN:B0B31NPBYZ here]] for $12.99.

title: Great BPA-free food grade sensory toy with entertainment value; rated for 18 months & older
text:
This is a great BPA-free food grade sensory toy for toddlers. It is rated for toddlers 18 months and older. It looks like a spaceship with tentacles. The tentacles are silicone and can be pulled through the "spaceship." There are three fidget circles on one side of the perimeter. On the other side, there is one button that, when pressed, moves from hole to hole.

I really like this but it is important to supervise the child when using this. Also, be careful because it can be thrown easily by grabbing onto the tentacles.

The current price of $9.59 ($11.99 minus 20%) is reasonable for this. NOTE that the paper insert that comes with this says this presents a choking hazard and is not for children under 3 years, yet the other side of the insert and the box says for 18 months or older. I believe what the box and other side of insert says.

title: Lovely set of eight rattles with one cloth clothing clip
text:
This set is absolutely lovely. There are eight rattles, one cloth clothing clip, and one plastic storage/carry pouch.

They are very engaging and make noises babies love. They can be hung from strollers or even a mobile. They can also be attached via the clothing clip to a baby's clothing.

As is typical, always supervise when the baby is playing with them. There are tiny balls in the rattles that could present a choking hazard if broken.

The current price of $16.99 for 8 rattles comes to $2.12 each if I consider the clothing clip a freebie.

title: Five strong teethers made of soft silicone with one clothing clip; love the musical instruments
text:
There are five strong teethers made of soft BPA-free silicone in this package with one strap for attaching a musical instrument to the baby's clothing.

I consider these teethers engaging. They are easy to hold on to and have no sharp edges and nothing that will fall off or come apart. However, supervision should always be required. I would hate for the baby to throw this and hit themselves or another child. For the most part, these are perfect teethers and each is one solid piece and super soft.

This is BPA free and it is also made in China. The current price of $9.95 comes to $1.99 per teether if I consider the strap a freebie.

title: This hangs low on the headrest; it has to be rigged to sit up higher; otherwise okay - SEE UPDATE
text:
This is designed (see Amazon video) to hang on the back of a headrest and face the baby in the car seat. The yellow hooks hook onto the rods in the headrest. However, the Velcro straps are just so long that I had to wrap the strap around the headrest as well (see photo).

There is a mirror and some hanging toys at the bottom. This offers some entertainment value but since there is no crinkly item and the toys hang a bit low, it is not as good as it could be. Also, the current price of $22.99 is a bit pricey for this.

UPDATE: I got this for my upstairs neighbor who has a baby. The parents also think this is just okay but not great. It is really not good for their headrest. However, they rigged it to the baby's carriage but the child is only mildly interested. I'd actually pass on this as it is okay but not great.

UPDATE Sept 8, 2022 - I lowered my ranking from 3 to 2 stars. My neighbor said that his baby is not interested in this. He said that he likes the toys only, so they detached them so that he could play with those. I definitely cannot recommend this, especially at this price. It has very limited value and interest to an infant.

title: This puff book is simple but has some entertainment value for an infant due to the crinkle
text:
This soft crinkle book has a toy attached to it and a mirror. It is crinkly, which is what a baby loves.

There isn't really a story in this cloth book but pages with different images. The mirror, toy, and crinkle of the book should keep a baby interested. I ordered this for my upstairs neighbor and her baby loves it.

The current price of $16.99 is on the high side of competitively priced for this.

UPDATE: Leo, my neighbor's infant, loves this. He is particularly enchanted with the crinkle.

title: An absolute nightmare to put together; one screw missing; otherwise OK but supervise due to heft
text:
At the current price of $62.99 ($69.99 minus 10%), this should have all working sides and no screws should be missing. It also should be easier to put together as it took me about one full hour. There are eight parts plus lots of screws and dowels, etc. In addition, there are four loose toy pieces to fit in the holes on the front for play. It took me three Philipps screwdrivers and one flat screwdriver to put this together. Sometimes I had to use two at the same time to create tension on one side as I was screwing in the other side. The picture instructions are somewhat understandable but I really had to pay attention to the details. It is easy to leave out dowels, which I accidentally did.

Unfortunately, there were only seven E screws provided and not eight, so I could not secure the faceplate at all points. It is on the unit strongly, but I really hate that one screw was left out.

The side with the clock is just for show. None of the knobs move and neither does the clock. This unit does wheel like a carriage and the other side does have a star that moves in its track. The front has a mirror and a numbered section (2,3,4) that moves around but that is pretty much it. There are those four separate pieces that fit in the holes on the front. The back has a place for storage of toys.

My recommendation is to ALWAYS supervise the child when he or she is using this because it is so heavy that they can turn this over on themselves and get hurt. Also, make sure they are old enough to play with this and not try to swallow those loose pieces that go in the front.

If this were easier to assemble, had all the parts, and had both sides with movable pieces, then this would have received 4.5 to 5 stars from me. In its current condition, it is not as interactive as I expected and the difficult assembly and missing screw has me only recommending this with caution.

title: Not very engaging; Velcro bag won't last; a bit overpriced as a girl's playmat
text:
This playmat is just okay. There are nine soft plush toys. All have faces on the front. Three are in the shape of a car and crinkle. Three are half of a square and barely rattle. Three look like a tiny loaf of bread and barely squeaks unless I squeeze hard and find the misplaced squeaker among the plushness.

The playmat is actually a bag Velcroed together that has to be pulled apart to lay down. It can be used to store the toys in the shape  of a bag.

Overall, I'm not too impressed with this set and the current price of $19.99 is too expensive. These are more like dog toys that dogs will rip up in a few minutes.

title: Nice set of 34 toys but blocks do not lock well – 3.5 stars
text:
There are 34 (not 31) individual pieces in this set that include 12 different colored blocks, 6 soft stacking rings with mouse on top, 8 stacking cups with shark on top, and 6 squishy and sensory toy balls.

The blocks, rings, mouse, shark, and balls are soft. The cups are plastic. The only negative is that the blocks do not interlock appropriately, so they cannot be stacked. However, a young child would not care about this.

The current price of $24.99 is on the high side of competitively priced for this.

title: Cute little elephant w/knotted trunk & tail; soft but not super soft
text:
This elephant is larger than typical for a baby--about double the size of what I expected. It is very cute and squishy. The trunk and tail are knotted as shown in the photos. The body is soft but not super soft or cuddly soft like the title indicates. The material is more quilted than anything else. A baby or child will love this. There are no parts like eyes that will come off. My only recommendation is to remove the plastic hanging loop on top and the paper tag that comes with it.

This is currently not priced but I would expect this to be priced at $10 or less.

title: More like wafer-thin popcorn bags; 24 bags in 3 designs
text:
This set comes with 24 bags (8 of 3 different styles--santa, tree, and snowman). The bags are wafer-thin and remind me of the type used to hold light popcorn at a fair. They can hold three small boxes of tea but they would bust with anything heavier.

These are definitely for treats like popcorn or bagged cotton candy and not much else. The current price of $14.79 comes to $.62 cents per bag which is outrageously priced for being so thin.

title: Cute lightweight Halloween treat bags in 5 designs; each bag fits one small Delicata winter squash
text:
There are 50 lunch-sized Halloween paper bags with no handles in this set in 5 different Halloween designs (10 styles each design) and they are lovely. Also included are 50 non-matching but fun stickers.

These bags can fit a brownie, a small sandwich, candy, cookies, or other equivalently sized tiny gifts. I was able to get my small Delicata winter squash in the bag standing up and had room to fold it over and seal it.

The current price of $9.98 for 12 comes to $.20 cents per bag which is competitively priced. These are perfect for classroom Halloween activities or just giving away treats on that day.

Note that there is a slight odor to the bags and I suspect that is because of the ink (i.e. the colorful designs on the bags).

title: Small medium-weight bags; holds one pound of dried apricots; perfect for a boy's birthday party
text:
There are 24 small bags in this set in a space design. These bags are festive and fun but are geared more toward a boy's birthday party since there is an image of a boy in a spacesuit orbiting in the galaxy.

Each bag comfortably holds a one-pound bag of dried apricots or the equivalent.

The current price of $13.99 comes to $.58 cents per bag which is slightly pricey for such a small size.

title: Lovely tiny Halloween bags made of a nice non-woven material
text:
These bags are much better than I expected but also half as small as I expected. I thought these were plastic bags and thankfully they are not. They are made of the same material that those reusable supermarket $.99 cent bags are made of.

There are 12 bags in four lovely Halloween designs. Each bag holds the equivalent of a one pound pouch of dried apricots (see photo). These will not fit much candy if going on a long trick or treat event but they are great little treat pouches. They can also be used by adults to carry any small item or items during the holiday. I love them.

The current price of $9.99 comes to $.83 per reusable bag.

title: These are excellent spinning toys and interactive
text:
[[VIDEOID:5931ba61275638540775ef3573b27f70]] There are three bathtub toys in this set. Each one has different animal figures on them. They are interactive in the sense that the main "fan" part of the toy can spin and the circular balls in the middle can be moved.

These can be stuck to a bathtub, mirror, glass, etc. For instance, why not put this on the inside window of a vehicle to entertain a child during travel. They also stick well.

At the current price of $10.39 ($12.99 minus 20%), this is a good buy. They are definitely high quality.

title: Easy to disinfect; silicone is a safer alternative to blocks
text:
This is BPA free and made of silicone. Each "block" feels slightly weighty but sturdy. This is rated for 6 months and above. The instructions say to boil for 5 minutes to disinfect before 1st use. It should also be washed in warm soapy water daily after use.

A toddler will love stacking these hearts. There are ridges/grooves underneath (see photo) to enable stacking. I always recommend supervision with younger children. These do, however, seem like a nice set that will hold up to lots of use.

title: Nice birthday colors but too much assembly and too expensive; balloons are nice
text:
I love the purple, white, and yellow theme of these decorations. However, the items are on the small side and there is absolutely too much assembly. I was frustrated just assembling one flower. I had to peel each layer apart like I did when creating flowers as a kid with tissues. Also, the ribbon that holds the flowers together frays easily as can be seen in my photo.

I do like the light yellow balloons with the purple sparkles inside as well as the other balloons. However, at the current price of $13.59 ($15.99 minus 15%), I just feel there are easier and larger decorations to be had.

title: Nice stickers for sealing my envelopes; I love the glittery look
text:
These hearts in glitter red are very attractive and vibrant. Note that the hearts do not actually have glitter on them but it has the appearance of having glitter on them. I had to be careful removing the hearts from the paper as it can be a delicate process. I actually ripped one of the hearts because I pulled it off too fast.

Overall, these work perfectly to add to the seal of any envelopes I am mailing out. They are also perfect for affixing one to a card. Since they are about 1.5 inches across, any more than one or two in a card would probably not look good.  

The current price of $9.99 comes to almost $.2 cents per heart.

title: Simple educational alphabet set for young children; however, supervise during play
text:
This is a very simple alphabet set made of "wood." There are 26 colorful letters on a flat board with color-coded indentations for each letter. There is color and letter shape association that enhances observation and memory skills. The letters are small. In my opinion, no child of three or four years old should play with this unless they know not to put the letters in their mouth. I think a five-year old would be okay unsupervised but I doubt some three-year olds would be. So be very careful with this set. I cannot stress that enough.

There is nothing holding the letters in place except for gravity when on a horizontal surface.

Per the note on the back, it is made of non-toxic paint. This is made in China and the description on the back is not written in very good English. At the current price of $13.99, I do feel it is a tad expensive for what this is. I personally would give a child alphabet blocks because they are more sturdy; however, this board acts like a puzzle and provides a slight challenge.

title: Incredibly adorable posable and miniscule cat critters
text:
These "Persian" cat figurines are super adorable. They are also posable in the sense that the arms, legs, head, and tail move. They are definitely miniscule and come with a Calico Critters tiny paper storybook with even tinier lettering. I could see these in a doll house. The tallest stands about 3-1/4 inches and the smallest at 3 inches. They are perfect any place one wants a decoration or even as a gift in an Easter basket.

The current price of $24.99 is a bit pricey but still competitive.

title: Gorgeous doll but it does not stand up on its own & hair net has to be cut out
text:
I am not into dolls but I ordered this for me because I think she is beautiful and just had to have her. She comes with winter boots that have to be put on and a shopping bag.

She is packaged very well except her head is scrunched to the side in the box. There are only two issues I see that stopped me from rating this gorgeous doll five stars. 

First, the hair net holding her curls in place had to be cut out. It was all tangled in Sienna's hair and there is a tie in front that can be clipped but it was totally tangled and knotted in her hair in the back. I actually had to cut a few strands of her curly hair off to remove it (see photo).

Second, Sienna does not stand up on her own. I kept tweaking the position of her limbs and arms and she still fell down. Since I am leaning her up against a wall, this does not matter much to me, but for some others who want a stand-up doll, this is a deal breaker.

Other than this, Sienna is beautiful both for show or play and she is not just for little girls. She is just an ordinary doll (meaning no bells and whistles) with a backstory (see photo of Sienna card). Anyone who plays with her should use their imagination as to her musicality.

Since I am not a doll person, I am going to assume the current cost of $59.99 is competitively priced. She is also backed by a 30-day guarantee. Sienna is definitely a keeper to me and she looks great where I placed her.

title: Sphere-shaped thin balloons made of plastic and not foil; pkg is mislabeled
text:
The package is labeled wedding balloons yet there are four birthday balloons on the inside. They are supposed to be self-sealing and foil. These seem to be plastic and not foil. I am unsure if they are self-sealing.

I took two of them to my local party/dollar store and it costs $2 two have two of them blown up. The vendor had trouble getting the helium in the balloons through the opening on the bottom. He had to try about three times and then was successful.

The balloons feel soft unlike foil balloons which feel stronger and more puffed. These are also very thin, so I have to be gentle with them. Overall, they do the job but are nothing spectacular. I think the current price of $10.99 is a bit costly for these.

title: A fun game that is a bit cheaply made; assembly is required; 4 AA batteries needed
text:
[[VIDEOID:bbaf4d1bfbb902ad4d45dea5fc990884]] My boyfriend and I enjoy playing this game. It was relatively easy to assemble except a Phillips screwdriver is needed to install four AA batteries (not included). The cardboard background is flimsy but it is only there to stop the balls from escaping.

There are seven cups and seven balls. I put the five-point cup in the center and then I put the other cups in increasing score order around the perimeter of the turntable. There is an on/off switch on the side along with a white button to start the game.

The object of the game is to bounce the ball off the purple platform (see video and instructions attached) and get them into each cup for the 30 seconds the game continues. Once time is up (when lights go out), count up the score and the highest scorer wins. If two balls land in the same cup (which they will), count that score twice.

Overall, this is a fun game whose quality is good enough but not great.

title: Soft, cute, cuddly bunny with orthopedic malalignment
text: This bunny comes wrapped in a ball (photo 1). Once unpackaged, it is cute, soft, and cuddly. The ears have wire in them but they do not do anything to hold them up or mold them. I assume the wire is there just to keep the ears from collapsing in on themselves. Even though this is a lovely bunny, I cannot give it 5 stars because it looks a bit sickly in the sense that it has an orthopedic malalignment in the neck and hip area and does not look as symmetrical as the Amazon photo shows. In every other way, it is lovely. Since children do not care about how symmetrical this looks, they will love cuddling with this rabbit.

title: Quality and fun dominoes game in a wooden box
text:
I have come to love Melissa and Doug toys and plush animals for their excellent quality. Very rarely do I get an inferior product from them and when I do, I found that they stand behind their item.

This dominoes game is not only fun but it is colorful. The game consists of 28 domino tiles with a lidded wooden storage box. Included are game instructions with three other game variations besides the basic play. I personally prefer just the basic game.

This is perfect for a child or adult and it is a quality dominoes set for the price.

title: Colorful, well-constructed wooden game board & pieces even with minor imperfections; 4.5 stars
text:
I have come to expect nothing but quality from Melissa an Doug and this definitely meets those standards. There is a minor imperfection or lump on my board (see last photo lower left interior) but that is so small that it does not take away from the beauty of this board.

This game board is suited for a child (or adult). It is lightweight, colorful, and attractive. I love that it has two channels which store the 5 O's and 5 X's. It does require some effort to extract the tiles and is best if one has nails. I also love that this board can be hung on the wall as art when not in use. See the fourth photo to see the slit where it can be hung with the screw and disc provided (photo 2).

This Tic-Tac-Toe Board is rated for children 4 years old and up. Nevertheless, since there are small squares, I would still supervise a young child during play.

The current price of $14.99 is a good value for this set especially since it is all wood. Overall, I am highly impressed with this light-weight board that is designed well for children and adults who are young at heart. It is both functional and a work of art when hung on the wall.

title: There are 5 beginner cubes that I like to use as fidgeters but they are decent puzzle toys too
text:
There are five beginner puzzle cubes in this package each with different possible combinations as per the pamphlets enclosed. I personally like to use these as fidgeters to give my hands something to do when watching a movie. There is nothing complex about these but they would be fun for the beginner.

Note that one box I received was ripped. If giving as a gift that would be disappointing.

title: Colorful, well-constructed wooden game board & pieces BUT they need to correct their age warning
text:
This game set is rated for children 6 years old and up; however, they need to correct the warning label on their box. The box says 3 years and up. Due to the small pieces, the game tokens can present a choking hazard for younger children.

I have come to expect nothing but quality from Melissa an Doug and this definitely meets those standards. The double-sided game board is suited for a child (or adult). It is lightweight, colorful, attractive, and comes with felt-bottomed pieces that protects the board from scratches. I am surprised they did not turn this into three games and include checkers for use on the chess board.

The current price of $24.99 is a good value for this set especially since it is all wood. I love that the board can be hung on the wall as art when not in use. See the sixth photo to see the slit (which exists on both sides of the game board) where it can be hung with the screw and disc provided. This also comes with a storage pouch that can be cinched with the attached Velcro strip.

Overall, I am highly impressed with this light-weight set that is designed well for children and adults who are young at heart. It is both functional and a work of art when hung on the wall.

title: Adorable, soft, floppy eared bunny perfect for hugging or displaying
text:
I love Melissa and Doug stuffed plush animals and add new ones to my collection from time to time. Their quality is usually exceptional to good. I had only one substandard plush dinosaur in the past but they stick by their product and sent me a replacement product. When I decide to buy stuffed animals, this is the company I choose.

This jumbo bunny rabbit looks better in person than on the Amazon website. It is adorable and super soft. This floppy eared hare is perfect for hugging or displaying. I absolutely love it. With this addition, I now have a collection of seven Melissa and Doug animals as follows below and I name all of them.

- [[ASIN:B07PHQDPQT Jumbo Bunny Rabbit]] - Daisey (5 stars - this item)
- [[ASIN:B016ZM2612 Giant Owl]] - Screech (5 stars)
- [[ASIN:B00009YEGL Giant Giraffe]] - Sofie (variation on Sophie) (5 stars)
- [[ASIN:B0007POHAW Giant Cheetah]] - Luxxy (4 stars)
- [[ASIN:B06VXZW97D Lemur]] - Flint (5 stars)
- [[ASIN:B0000YGM3K Giant Dalmatian]] - Sally (5 stars)
- [[ASIN:B06WGLG34S Llama]] - Sasha (4 stars)

In summary, this jumbo bunny rabbit is another good plush toy from Melissa and Doug. It is a wonderful gift for a child or for someone like me who loves to collect (and name) their lifelike plush animals. I also consider the current price of $39.99 a good deal.

title: Incredibly portable doll crib with carrying case; my 3 "pussycat dolls" love it
text:
This doll crib is rated for ages 3 and above and will tightly fit up to a 20" doll that is not more than 11" wide. Once it is assembled, it is sturdy and spacious as can be seen from the pictures. Also, even though this is NOT for pets, cats will be attracted to this immediately. I have three cats and my 16-pound cat slept comfortably in this. As can be seen in the photos, all three cats have used this. You could say this is more for my pussycat dolls than anything else.

IN THE PACKAGE
- Carrying bag with handle
- Collapsible crib/playpen
- Crib mat
- Mobile arm
- 3 Plush Velcro Clouds

WARNING
- not for real children
- not for pets (NOTE: It is IMPOSSIBLE to keep cats out of this.)
- requires adult assembly and disassembly
- supervision during use is recommended

WHAT I DON'T LIKE

- The white writing on the cardboard tag that is attached to the bag is barely readable.

- The directions were a bit unclear to me on how to lock the crib; it says to twist the connectors but it does not show them and they are hidden under the fabric so I had to go by feel. Once I got it, it was easy to do.

- Also, the directions do not show what to do with the crib mat. It only shows what to do with the crib mat when the unit is collapsed and not how to use it when not collapsed. It might seem self-explanatory, but there is Velcro on the mat, so that has to be attached to itself before laying the mat inside the crib otherwise the tabs are scratchy and stick out and could catch on the doll's or children's clothing.

- I was annoyed by the plastic wrapping peeking out from underneath the mobile arm cover. I actually had to remove the mint cover, rip off the plastic, then I had a very difficult time putting the cover back on. If one does not care about plastic wrapping hanging out, then this does not have to be done. I personally do not like packaging material to be hanging out of my stuff.

- I am not sure why the Amazon website says "pack of 3." There is no "pack of 3" with regard to this crib. It is only one unit or seven pieces altogether as described above.

Overall, this is very nice. I love that it matches my parlor walls and I got this for my "pussycat dolls" even though it is not rated for that. I even put in an extra cushion for them. This is a crib a child would love for their dolls; just make sure to supervise them at play and ensure the crib is properly assembled and dissembled when desired.

title: A little bit monotonous but still a super cute interactive toy
text:
[[VIDEOID:532e1240db265608ae6e9b8cc0530185]] This is for children over five so I ordered it for me (at least temporarily) and to tease my cats. I think this is super cute. There are a variety of babbling sounds emanating from this toy. Petting the head is like a cooing sound, cradling him results in sleepy sounds. Holding him upside down results in silly gibberish. There is even an elephant trumpeting sound but I forget how I got that. Clapping once or twice also results in different sounds. However, what is mostly heard is "ba, ba, ba, ba, pah." I heard that more than anything.

There is supposed to be a record option to record my voice but I was unable to get it to work. There are sensors on the side of each ear. Press both sensors for a silly surprise and press the right side to record your voice. I could not get either sensor to work and I tried several times. I would have rated this 4 stars otherwise.

The four LR44 / AG 13 button cell batteries are already installed. All that has to be done after removing him from the packaging is to turn him on.

title: If it were not for the exorbitant price, I would highly recommend these
text:
At the current price of $63.16, these 9.5" scissors are crazy expensive. I am shocked they are made for kids. As an adult, I would never pay that much. This is the ONLY REASON I rated this 3 stars. Other than this, these scissors are super sharp and excellent. I use them to cut up paper and sometimes boxes or packages that come in hard plastic. I also find the padded handle super comfortable.

I do have cutlery scissors that I used before these and they are as good as these scissors but they cost me under $12. These $63.16 scissors are made of heavy duty stainless steel. I have no idea if my other scissors are such high quality. All I can say is that both cut equally well and are comfortable in my hands and that is the purpose of scissors.

These are great scissors at a not so great price.

title: These exercise dice are an ingenious invention and guaranteed to be fun for the fitness minded
text:
I am tickled pink by these exercise dice. They inject fun into a workout and can be played with a partner or alone.

Included in the package are:
- Two squishy foam dice
- One mesh carry bag with cinch tie
- Safety warning pamphlet

The first die names the exercise and the second die names the activity. Each die has two items repeated twice as is to be expected since the sides are shared. Just combine the throw to get the exercise, such as 90 seconds of jumping jacks, etc., etc.

FIRST DIE OPTIONS:
- crunches
- jumping jacks
- squats
- walking lunges
- wild ignite card (you pick your exercise)
- jumping jacks
- push ups
- walking lunges

SECOND DIE OPTIONS:
- 90 seconds
- 10 reps
- 60 seconds
- 20 reps
- 30 seconds
- 60 seconds
- 30 reps
- 90 seconds

I doubt this cost more than $1 to make but I can tell this will be loads of fun, now I just have to get my boyfriend into competing with me.

title: Fun strategy game for two players ages 4 years and up
text:
This is a fun game. My boyfriend and I played it. It is only a two-player match game like tic-tac-toe or battleship. The youngest player starts and both players get two cards which they keep face down until the end of the game. The first player pushes out a cube in the top left corner of the game grid. The next player then pushes out another cube on the board with that same cube. The play continues with each player pushing out the next cube with the previous cube just played without using the same grid hole. The idea is to match five of the same characters in a row either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. When one player indicates a match, the losing player turns over their cards and if the character on one of the cards matches the winning players match, then that person now wins the game. If there is no match, then the winner keeps his win.

The game is simple, yet fun, and is full of strategy. There are two negatives, however. The game case is difficult to open and it feels like I am going to break off the plastic prongs when I pull it apart. Also, the game wobbles a bit when the outside "wings" are down. Third, it is easy to knock all the cubes out of the game grid. As my boyfriend was playing, he titled the game just a bit to see the characters better and many of the cubes fell out. Other than the lackluster quality of the game parts, the game itself is wonderfully simple and tremendous fun.

title: Absolutely adorable toy station wagon with mom, dad, & dog
text:
This is absolutely adorable and looks like it is from the 1960's, which is when this style was introduced.

In the box is:
- 1 station wagon with removable convertible top
- 3 family figures (mom,dad, dog)

There are four slots for the 3 family figures. The two slots in front do not move. The two in back rotate around and around when the car is pulled by the cord. The tailgate can be moved up or down and the top comes off easily to turn the station wagon into a convertible. In fact it comes off too easily. A string is attached to the front "grill" so that this can be pulled easily. The headlight "eyes" rotate up and down and the wheels cause the back seats to turn as well.

The top is thin plastic but the rest of the parts seem made of a more sturdy plastic. No parts appear as if they could fall off and be swallowed, so that is a plus. I was disappointed that the pull cord is not tied off at the end. I had to tie a knot in the end so the cord would not fray. This is rated for children from 36 months to 15 years (according to the Amazon site).

Overall, this is absolutely wonderful and will be thoroughly enjoyed by small children and adults with a child's heart. This looks so nice that I think it would look great under a tree around a large Christmas village (although it is a bit big for that).

title: Cute lifelike plush Llama; face looks more like a goat because the ears do not stand up
text:
I love Melissa and Doug stuffed plush animals and add new ones to my collection from time to time. Their quality is usually exceptional to good.

This Llama is cute. However, the ears do not stand up on mine (see 1st picture) and the one front right hoof is sewed on off center making her unstable (see 2nd picture). Nevertheless, she is a keeper and as close to lifelike as I am every going to get. The ears as shown makes the Llama look more like a goat. Note that I tried several times to get the ears to stand up but there is no wire or anything that will allow that on the one I received.

With this [[ASIN:B06WGLG34S Llama]] who I named Sasha, I now have a collection of six Melissa and Doug animals. I own their other even more gorgeous lifelike creatures, all of which I named. They are:

- [[ASIN:B016ZM2612 Giant Owl]] - Screech
- [[ASIN:B00009YEGL Giant Giraffe]] - Sofie
- [[ASIN:B0007POHAW Giant Cheetah]] - Luxxy
- [[ASIN:B06VXZW97D Lemur]] - Flint
- [[ASIN:B0000YGM3K Giant Dalmatian]] - Sally

This Llama is another good plush toy from Melissa and Doug. It is a wonderful gift for a child or for someone like me who loves to collect (and name) their lifelike plush animals. However, if you receive one like mine, note that it might tip over easily due to the off-center placement of the hoof.

title: Six multi-colored monster trucks in a nice plastic carrying tote with handle; truck wheels just glide on smooth surfaces
text: These are awesome! There are six multi-colored monster trucks in a nice plastic carrying tote with handle. The wheels glide easily across a floor or table top. My friend's toddler is going to have a blast. Of course, since the truck chassis is made of plastic, they will easily break if stepped on by a teen or adult.  These are rated for 2 years and up. I feel the $9.95 current price is reasonable.

title: A fun & hilarious game designed for 3 or more players as 2 players will always end in a tie unless one changes the rules
text:
This card game is not for two players because if one plays by the rules of the game, the score points will always be a tie. Instead it is for 3-6 players, 8 years to adult. Shame on me for not noticing that before I ordered it. Nevertheless, I just changed the rules a little and still had fun.

In the box are 194 picture cards, 30 letter cards, 1 answer / score pad, and 1 60-second timer. Each person is dealt 5 letter and 5 picture cards and each creates a "secret" word for each letter card to match each of the picture cards. For instance, if the picture card has a dog in it and the person associates a word starting with the letter P (such as puppy), when that pair is in play, the other players have to shout out what they think the secret word is. They have to do this for all five-card pairs (letter and picture card) before the timer is up. The person who gets the answer correct, keeps the associated picture card for scoring and the opponent keeps the winning letter card.

The game is hilarious and is not easy at all. In fact, since my boyfriend and I were the only players, we had to provide hints to each other so that we could guess more cards. Also, for two players, I would change the game to include the picture cards that were not guessed into the score of the non-guessing player.

Overall, this is a lot of fun. My boyfriend said this is a five-star game. I, on the other hand, give it four stars because I would have liked to see game instructions that would be suitable for two players as I suggested above. Also, the game can be a bit frustrating. For instance, my boyfriend could not come up with a name for certain cards. In one case he had an A and some strange looking picture so he chose the word arbitrary which I did not guess. In fact, in many cases one has to think outside the box to play a good game. Also, I would have liked to see every letter of the alphabet represented. Instead there are 2 each of an A, H, I, M, O, S, T, W and absolutely no N, Q, X, or Z.

title: Well made fire engine, with working ladder, and two firemen that rolls easily when pushed and will entertain for hours
text: This is a wonderful toy fire engine. It comes with two firemen. The cab lifts up and seats one. The ladder is "ratcheted" and extends up and out. There's a hole for the other fireman to be positioned on that ladder. The truck rolls easily. It feels well made and high quality for a plastic toy. At the current price of $10.50, I think it is a great deal. My friend's toddler is going to love this as he is just getting into trucks.

title: Extremely realistic recycling truck with sounds and movement that is perfect for hours of imaginative child play
text:
This recycling truck is awesome. It takes two AA batteries (included for demonstration purposes only—meaning they may have to be replaced using a Phillips screwdriver shortly after use). The biggest difficulty I had is in removing this truck from the box because it arrives in the ON condition and started working immediately as I was trying to unpack it. That was a bit annoying.

The on / off button is located underneath the truck under the cab. There are two levels of sound and lights to choose from when turning on.

Once the truck is on, the button in the center of the CAB turns on the ignition sounds and the lights come on.

The lights also come on when pressing down on the tires and moving forward and backward. When moving backward, the backup warning sounds activate.

The recycling truck container opens in back and can store Legos or other small toys. It also tilts back to the rear.

All the sounds of dumping, loading, and idling are realistic. Pressing down on the horns on either side of the cab also generates realistic sounds.

The recycling bucket has a slot that allows for placement into the hitch. Once in place, move the lever handle down to dump (or pretend dump) what is in the pail. The pail can also be stored in the top of the truck's container.

The instructions are useless as it only talks about the batteries. Therefore, it is important to pay attention to the pictures on the box or read the description on Amazon to learn how to fully operate this vehicle. Another option is to learn via trial and error.

To me this is an extremely impressive toy for a reasonable price of $29.99.

title: Decorative heavy dice; PLAY CAUTIOUSLY on carpet or grass to reduce damage to person, property, & dice; FUN, FUN, FUN
text:
These dice are beautifully made of solid pine. Playing games with these are fun but play responsibly. Displaying the dice as works of art is equally as great.

Provided in the package:
- Six die that weigh a combined 4.6 pounds. (See the attached pictures for an idea of size relative to two of my cats and their water fountain.)
- A strong canvas pouch for carrying the dice.
- A folded one-page pamphlet with two game variations and a sample score card for copying.

Each die is beautiful and each "number point" (i.e. dots) on the same die face is painted a rich coffee brown or dark tan. However, the "number points" are various shades of coffee brown on each side of the same die, so there is a slight inconsistency in color there. Nevertheless, this does not take away from their beauty. One should discount the "life-sized" claim. They are large but all of them stacked three high, side-by-side, do not even reach the height of a poised cat as you can see from my photos. When used for play instead of art, the round edge of each die provides for a smooth roll and reduction of injury to property or person. Although this is rated for ages 6 and above, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND children, adults, and pets stay far back when rolling the dice.

My boyfriend and I played the first game on my inside carpet since it was raining outside. I made sure to remove any items that could break around the area we were playing and I had to keep shooing the cats away. I originally thought we had to roll all six die at once (which is impossible). Therefore, when playing the two games in the instructions, roll each die one at a time because they are too large to roll together. The instructions should say that, however, because the first thought I had is "How am I going to roll these six die all at once," when the instructions said "roll the dice"?

My boyfriend loved the dice and the game even though I won. Since each die is heavy, it is extremely important to throw each die gently. I can see unsupervised children or drunk adults throwing these at each other and causing serious damage or death. As long as everyone plays responsibly, hours of fun and friendly competition are awaiting those who play this lawn or carpeted basement "game."

title: This Dalmatian is absolutely stunning and looks incredibly real
text:
This dog takes my breath away. She is absolutely stunning, extremely lifelike, stands up on its own, and has a quizzical look with one cocked ear, and faintly painted eyelashes. I absolutely love her.

With this [[ASIN:B0000YGM3K Dalmatian]] who I named Sally, I now have a collection of five Melissa and Doug animals. I own their other equally gorgeous lifelike creatures, all of which I named. They are:

- [[ASIN:B016ZM2612 Giant Owl]] - Screech
- [[ASIN:B00009YEGL Giant Giraffe]] - Sofie
- [[ASIN:B0007POHAW Giant Cheetah]] - Luxxy
- [[ASIN:B06VXZW97D Lemur]] - Flint

This Dalmatian is another great plush toy from Melissa and Doug. It is a wonderful gift for a child or for someone like me who loves to collect (and name) their lifelike plush animals.

title: This owl is gorgeous and soft and cuddly and makes a great gift for anyone who loves plush lifelike stuffed animals
text: This Giant Owl is soft and cuddly, extremely lifelike, and stands up on its own as long as the tail is placed out behind it. I already own their [[ASIN:B00009YEGL Giant Giraffe]], [[ASIN:B0007POHAW Giant Cheetah]], and [[ASIN:B06VXZW97D Lemur]] which are just beautiful, lifelike, and sturdy and I wanted to add this owl to my growing Melissa and Doug collection.  This is another outstanding product from Melissa and Doug.

title: Gorgeous lifelike lemur that is a nice addition to my collection or great for a child
text:
I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this lemur. It is so lifelike with its long tail. As you can see from the pictures, it is of medium size. From tip to rounded tail it measures 27 inches and stands 18-1/2 inches tall from the floor to the top of its rounded tail. Every limb is proportioned and the lemur is sturdy when standing. One of my three casts warily approached him at first until he realized the lemur was not real. It is perfect for a child or for an adult like me that loves these stuffed animals.

I adore Melissa and Doug plush stuffed animals because they are usually high quality. I own their [[ASIN:B00009YEGL Giant Giraffe]] and their [[ASIN:B0007POHAW Giant Cheetah]] which are just beautiful, lifelike, and sturdy and I wanted to add this to my collection. At the current price of $36.93, I think this is a steal.

title: The stuffed Stegosaurus I received is unpleasing to the eye, unstable, and defective
text:
I usually love Melissa and Doug plush stuffed animals because they are quality. I own their [[ASIN:B00009YEGL Giant Giraffe]] and their [[ASIN:B0007POHAW Giant Cheetah]] which are just beautiful, lifelike, and sturdy. Therefore, I wanted to add this to my collection. However, unlike the very cute photo on Amazon, the face of the Stegosaurus I received looks scary and unappealing. In addition, the animal is very wobbly. The front left foot is off the ground and turned at an odd angle and the front right foot is straight. I attached some pictures. Note that the deformity was not caused by shipping because it shipped in a sizable box that allowed for the full body, except for the tail, to lay flat. It is apparently a defect in the manufacturing.

This is medium sized stuffed dinosaur at about 33 inches from tip to tail and around 17 inches tall. It is not a stuffed toy that I would buy a child because it is so unstable and not cute or cuddly. The plush stuffed Stegosaurus I received is also a step down compared to the high quality of their giraffe and cheetah. This is the one time I am disappointed in their product.

title: Gorgeous Cheetah Stuffed Animal with weak back legs but I still love it!
text:
I found this at Home Goods for $39.99 plus tax and just had to have it. This is a gorgeous cheetah and I got several compliments carrying it out of Home Goods. In fact, one lady said that for 30 seconds she thought it was real. I also own their [[ASIN:B00009YEGL Plush Giraffe]].

I would have rated this five stars if it weren't for the fact that the back legs and paws are not very stable. The Cheetah stays up as a result of the stiff front legs and paws. This means young children cans easily push this over. The tail is fluid (meaning not stiff) and can be easily wrapped around its body. I attached a picture of the Cheetah I named Luxxy.

title: Good game for those who like to be challenged about once per year
text:
This game is rated for 3-6 players ages 14+. However, my boyfriend and I were able to play by just leaving out the head-to-head (challenge cards) for each category.

The object of the game is to be the first one to win a game piece in all four game categories. I love board games and so does my boyfriend, which is why I got this. At the beginning we found playing this game nearly impossible. Neither one of us watch TV (this is based on a TV series) nor have cable. Therefore, it took us a while to even understand what this was about and what many of the game cards were asking us to do. We kept asking ourselves “Are we really that stupid?” However, after playing for almost 2 hours, we were enlightened. Nevertheless, for the uninitiated, this game might be challenging and confusing the first time around. After that not so much because then one remembers how to solve most of the cards and when that happens, this game will have to be “retired” for a while.

Below is a sentence on the box top which provides a good, yet very simple, idea of what “brain games” are all about.
THINK YOU
YOU CAN'T
BE FOOLED?
You just were. Read it again.

If you did not find the double YOU in the phrase on the first try, then you were fooled.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX:
- 192 game cards consisting of 48 cards each in each of the 4 categories (mind & body, language, logic, vision)
- A "box topper" with 4 game slots to hold the cards
- 40 hexagon shaped game tiles (8 tiles for each category, 4 wild, and 4 lose-a-turn)
- 6 pawns (playing pieces)
- 6 score cards
- 1 game board in 4 puzzle pieces
- 1 die that holds numbers 1, 2, & 3 only (two times)

Everything is made of cardboard except for the pawns and die. The score cards and puzzle pieces are easily punched out of the cardboard card provided.

In summary, this game is good for those who like to be challenged or know what the game is about. However, if you play this several times, you'll probably remember the answers and have to put this away for about one year before playing it again.

title: Delightful, cute, gorgeous, plush, and everything I was looking for in a lifesize baby giraffe
text:
I purchased this giraffe at Home Goods for $79.99 plus tax. My boyfriend checked the price on Amazon with his Smartphone and at the time Amazon's price was $82+ and now it's $73.02.

This giraffe stands 54 inches (4-1/2 feet tall) if measuring from the tip of foot to furthest horn. The face is so cute and the angle of the head makes the giraffe look inquisitive. As I was walking around Home Goods with the giraffe in my cart, two different people came up to me telling me how beautiful this plush giraffe is. One lady told me she bought one for her grandchild and it was a hit in the nursery. When I told her I was buying this for me, she was flabbergasted. The other lady said don't think twice about getting this as I'll love it.

This giraffe is gorgeous and I am sure many children would love it. I got this for many reasons including to complement my decor and as a place that one of my cats would love hanging out under as you can see in the attached image.

title: Lots of fun with simple rules for 1-4 players ages 7 to adult; mathematically educational for addition and subtraction
text:
I've always wanted Tri-Ominos because it is a twist on Dominos but uses triangular instead of rectangular tiles and it's lots of fun.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX:
56 triangular tiles
4 plastic tile holders (or racks)
1 instruction sheet

The object of the game is to be the first player to score 400 points with each game consisting of several rounds of play.

For example, with two players, nine tiles are given to each player. The tiles should be face down so that the other player or players don't see them. Each player adds up the numbers on each of their tiles. If a player has a tile with three of the same numbers on the tile, then the player with the highest combination goes first. For example , a player with three 5's (which is equal to 15) would go before a player with three 4's (which is 12) and score the bonus points explained in the instruction card. If no player has a Tri-Omino tile, then the player with the highest numbered tiled goes first but no bonus points would be given.

The idea is for a player to match his or her tile to a tile on the board that has two of the same numbers. They basically get connected the way that it is done with Dominos. The score gets added up for each tile placed. Those that can't make a match pick from the “well” or remaining face down tiles. Each pick from the well cost the player 5 points from their score. If you can't match any Tri-Omino in your hand and the well is empty, ten points are deducted from your score and the play continues.

The first player to play all of his Tri-Ominos wins the round and receives a 25-point bonus plus the total points of all the Tri-Ominos left in the other players' hands. If the game is blocked, then the player with the least amount of tiles wins and gets to add all the points from the left over tiles to their score but there are no bonus points given. This player must also deduct the total number of points that were left in his hand from his score. This method of play gets repeated until a player reaches 400 points to win the game. There are a few other ways to get bonus points in a game as well.

Scoring is done after every play, so from this perspective the game can be tedious. However, it is a lot of fun and for young children, the process of adding up the numbers on the tiles is an education in math. My boyfriend and I really love this game. Playing a full game with two people takes a couple of hours.

title: Electronic Scrabble Twist is SO COOL but the instructions could be better & Hasbro should reduce the packaging
text:
This game is a new "twist" (pun intended) on a classic game of Scrabble. The objective is to form as many 3 to 5 letter words from the same 5 letters in a certain number of seconds depending on the game and level selected.

FACTS:
- This is for ages 8+ for 1-9 players based on the game chosen.
- 3 AA batteries are required and are NOT INCLUDED.
- The battery compartment is secured with a Phillips head screw.
- Two letter words are not allowed; only 3 to 5 letter words can be formed.
- The unit turns on with a twist (in either direction) and goes to sleep after 30 seconds automatically.
- If the unit is turned upside down the letters flip automatically. This is a great feature when passing the game around during play with multiple parties.
- The twist feature is used to scroll through the menus and to score the words you find.
- Play begins by pressing one of the five buttons to select a game, select player numbers, and to tap the words you find (must tap in the order the word is spelled)
- There are 3 types of play (PARTY & TURBO are for 2-8 players; SOLO is for 1 player).
- A reset button on the back of the unit removes the highest stored scores from memory.

At first I didn't understand how to begin playing. It took me about 10 minutes of fussing around to figure out how this worked, even after reading the instructions.

Although the instructions are not written as I'm describing them below, this is actually how the game works. I'm going to use the SOLO play as an example.
- After inserting the battery and peeling off the 5 letter labels covering the LED buttons, twist to start the unit.
- Twist 2 more times to cycle through to the SOLO option.
- Press one of the clear buttons to begin playing immediately. This assumes you accept the default volume and play levels.
- You will be presented with 5 letters. For example, if you are presented with

L M A E D

You would try to form as many words as possible by pressing the letter buttons in the order the word is spelled and then twisting to score the word. In the above example, I might press the letters M A D E and then twist. The letters will be re-ordered as M A D E L. I might then press D A M E and twist. I would continue to form as many words as I could from these letters and twist each time until the time is up. This almost reminds me of a Simon Says game but with letters that I form into words.

If I wanted to change the default play levels and the volume, I'd twist to turn the unit on, and then twist 4 more times to see the volume. To see the volume level, I'd press one of the clear letter buttons and twist, twist, twist to set it to the desired level or mute it. When the desired volume is reached, I'd press one of the clear buttons again to be taken back to the volume and then twist to select the level of play. I'd then press the button to see easy play and then twist to cycle through to mid and pro levels. When done I'd press one of the clear buttons on the front and then keep twisting until I see the game level I want (PARTY, TURBO, or SOLO) and then I'd follow the instructions in the manual or the ones above for playing a SOLO game.

In summary, I've been playing the SOLO game for a couple of days and love it. I selected this for that level of play. I also tried the PARTY game by myself and feel it would be a lot of fun. I do feel that Hasbro Gaming needs to provide an example for each game level of how to play, sort of like I did above with the SOLO game. Although the instructions are good, they are written in a piecemeal fashion describing each individual feature which causes the user to have to read all the instructions just to figure out one of the three games. In addition, I feel they should reduce the packaging this comes in to one quarter the size it is now because all there is to this game is a tiny handheld unit and a folded one page (that turns into four printed sides) instruction pamphlet. Despite this, I love Electronic Scrabble Twist for both the fun and cool factor. I am also thrilled that I can play the game by myself and I'm addicted to it.

UPDATE August 10, 2015 - I had my boyfriend try this and he thinks it's great as well. However, he had the same problem figuring the game out until I showed him. Once you figure how to start the game and work the unit, it is so easy and hard to believe there would have been a problem in the first place. I think this game is really going to be popular. I love it. I just wish the initial paper instructions were better.

title: Hilariously funny and entertaining game for groups of 4 to 8 people
text:
My boyfriend and I never heard of this game and this is their 15th "Appleversary" Edition.

This game is for ages 12+ with 4-8 players. Included in the box are:
- One game instruction sheet
- 441 Black Apple Cards
- 63 White Apple Cards
- 25 Scoring Tokens

After all the like colored cards are combined and shuffled (good luck shuffling 441 cards; I couldn't do it), the cards get stored face-down in the plastic game tray/box they came in along with the tokens.

The game of play is as follows:
- Each of the 4 or more players are dealt 5 black cards each.
- The one player in each round who is the judge picks one white card and chooses one of the two words on the cards. He or she then says the word out loud and places the card face up on the table.
- The remaining players pick a black card from their hand that they think best describes the word being played. They put that card face own in the center and when all the players have submitted their card, the black cards in the center get mixed up.
- The judge then reads each card aloud and the player who submitted that card makes their case to the judge of why their card best exemplifies the word being played.
- The player who won their case with the judge gets a token.
- The play then continues to the left with the card decks and judging responsibility becoming the role of the next player. Each player whose card count is less than 5 black cards is dealt another card.
- The game ends when there is a winner with four tokens.

What makes this game so much fun is the conversation that occurs when convincing the judge. For instance, the judge might pick the word squishy and a player might pick the card about fish and say something like when you're preparing the fish and stretching it out for cooking it becomes all squishy.

My boyfriend and I loved it and found it hilarious. We even found it more challenging because the two other people we planned to play with weren't available. As a result, we wound up playing two hands a piece with one of us playing one hand when we were the judge. That brought another whole level of ridiculousness to the table. It was difficult not to pick our own selections as winners.

This game is only limited by each player's imagination and ability to argue their case. It's perfect for parties or large gatherings with 4 to 8 players.

title: This game couldn't have cost more than 40 cents to make but it is still fun
text:
I purchased the original game of Trouble several years ago for myself since I played the game a few times as a child. After I purchased it, I was extremely disappointed in the game's quality. Despite that, the fun was still there. This game is not much different than what I purchased previously except the board is actually a tiny bit stronger than the cardboard that came with my original game of Trouble. Nevertheless, everything is still low quality and flimsy.

What you get is a "Made in the USA game" (with US and imported parts) that includes:

1 cardboard instructions (under which the game board is hidden)
1 flat piece of cardboard as the game board with a center hole cut out
4 circular foam dots that need to be affixed to the POP-O-MATIC dice roller
1 POP-O-MATIC dice roller that just gets placed in the center hole during play
16 tiny plastic Minion game pieces in 4 different colors (green, orange, blue, and yellow)*
1 tiny plastic Siren Bob Minion*

*Be careful as these small pieces represent a choking hazard.

The object of the game is for each of the 2-4 players to get their 4 Minions onto and around the track toward the stairs that indicate home. If a Minion lands on another Minion while going around the track, that Minion is sent back home. The only time that the Minion is safe on the track is if the team member is protected by Siren Bob as a result of drawing that die with the POP-O-MATIC. In that case, the Minion whose turn it is cannot move (because they cannot land on another Minion who is protected) and their turn is over. This process of play continues until the team member has all their Minions on their steps (one step each). This is just a variation on the standard game of Trouble and developed in support of the upcoming Minions film due out on July 10, 2015.

In summary, I think this game is fun for ages 5 up to adult. "Trouble Game Despicable Me Edition" definitely will not stand up to any abuse. However, after purchasing many board games for myself over the years, I noticed there is a tendency for the "Hasbros" of the world to make things cheaper and cheaper and the quality is just built into games priced under $50. Since lower quality game boards are now typical in today's society, I am giving this 3 stars instead of 2. Just consider this disposable, yet fun.

title: High quality barn sure to delight any young child if only the roof wouldn't fall apart
text:
The Schleich barn is made of wood and is of extremely high quality except for a problem with the clips and pieces of wood that hold the barn roof together.

The barn opens into two separate unattached halves that slide together at right angles like a puzzle. There are latches on either short side of the barn that can be unlatched to display each half. The barn can be left open or closed. When closed it is easy to carry. A cow, chicken, donkey, lamb, hay bale, basket, red and green vegetables, and a pitch fork and broom are the accessories included. The barn doors on the long side of the barn open in both front and back. The color is vibrant and the farm animals are very realistic.

The only negative I found is that the entire barn is held together with clips that come apart. The clips are not its strongest point. The four clips on either side of the barn roof on mine would not hold up the roof and the boards keep falling off. I tried for over 30 minutes to get two of the clips seated correctly but neither side would snap in place. My boyfriend also looked at this barn and he could not get the clips to seat firmly in place either. He did say, however, that this is a well-made toy. According to the side of the box below the Germany label, it says this is made in Slovakia.

The clips and vegetable pieces that come with the barn can present a choking hazard to a small child. If the child is of that age where items are frequently "tasted," then I recommend adult supervision while the child is playing with this barn. The box indicates that this is not for children under 3 years of age and does state that the small parts present a choking hazard. This is typical of many toys with small parts, however.

Other than this, I got this for my friend's son to play with and he's going to love it. However, he'll have to play with the two roof slats off since they will fall off in its current condition. If the unit I received did not have this problem, I would have rated this 5 stars. Since mine does have this problem, I'm rating it 3. Had I purchased this unit and not received it for review, I would have returned it for a replacement. Since the three other reviewers have not complained about this issue, I suspect it is either a new issue introduced in recent manufacturing design or the unit I received is slightly defective. If there are no other recent reviews that complain about the clips and barn roof, then I would consider this a 5-star toy where I was the one exception. Nevertheless, this defect will not detract from my friend's son enjoyment as young children rarely notice those things.

title: My busy barn will keep a toddler busy, engaged, and learning
text:
This busy barn is sturdy and heavy at 10.30 pounds. It sit's flush with the floor. Even though it is heavy, an overactive child may be able to tip or push this over especially if placed on a rug.

This educational toy is rated for 18 months and over and every side has an activity that will appeal to a toddler. There are 5 sides.

- The roof is the counting area from 1-10 with boxes that have those number of items. For example, number 9 has 9 leaves in a box. The pictures are left up to the imagination as numbers 3, 6, 7, 8 (perhaps what is shown is blue and yellow corn), and 10 are not obvious items to me.

- The front side has three doors that reveal various animals.

- The back side has three gears that turn and one of those gears is the sun.

- One side has an alphabet that can be turned to reveal an item that starts with that letter, like A for apple. The alphabet is displayed from left to right side with the last two letters at the bottom center. Since two tiles are left on the left and right of the long alphabet column, they are filled up with various shapes like a triangle, circle, rectangle, etc.

- The other side has a cow, tractor, and chicken that can be moved around on a vertical tract.

I do like that the alphabet side allows for a parent's hands to stick inside for cleaning should a child drop food or sticky items inside during play. This is a big plus to me.

The top appears to be made of plywood or particle board; I can't tell which. I think its plywood because it has several layers. Nevertheless, that is an engineered wood product; so to say this is wood is not a total lie but not a total truth either. I do think the rest of the activity barn is made with wood but it is hard for me to tell.

I do feel this activity barn will keep a young child engaged and learning and his or her motor skills going. Obviously mom or dad will have to point out how to count and what's on the other side of each alphabet and shape cube. I know my friend's boy who is just about 18 months is going to love this.

It's sturdy, heavy, and engaging but at the current price of $66.94 and the fact that it is not all solid wood makes this a bit steep for what this is. I feel it's about $22 overpriced. Other than this, it's perfect for toddlers 18 months and older. I also love that the barn is extremely colorful and I'm sure a toddler will be attracted to this as well.

UPDATE Nov. 13, 2014 - My friend's 15-month old toddler has been enjoying exploring this toy. He mostly likes opening and closing the doors. As he gets older he'll no doubt become interested in playing with the alphabet tiles and the train tracks.

title: Perfect to keep the little tyke occupied
text:
I selected this for review because I wanted something train related to complement the beautiful but bare [[ASIN:B00IWPKCB2 Fisher-Price Thomas Wooden Railway - Up and Around Sodor Adventure Tower]].

This set comes with a train, helicopter, and many building block pieces along with railroad tracks that can be formed into a figure 8 or S shape. The manual is easy to understand and helps with assembling the individual pieces into a couple of towers, cargo, and tower for the flag. Even though this is rated for 2-5 years old my friend's 6-year old will still enjoy this. At least he can use the train with the Thomas Wooden Railway Tower I got him.

When done with play, the pieces can be stored in the plastic carrying case. I do feel $39.99 is a bit steep for what this is and this was the only reason I rated this 4 stars. Otherwise, this Mega Bloks set is entertaining for pre-schoolers and a little beyond that age.

title: Young children can let their imagination run wild with this quality adventure tower but they'll want you to purchase more parts
text:
This adventure tower comes well packaged, as inside the box is a large Styrofoam case containing the 22 pieces that makes up this wooden railway tower. The 22 pieces consist of:

- 2 tower levels
- 1 center support
- 2 other center pieces that slide into the center support
- 8 wooden tracks that fit together like a puzzle creating a circular track at floor level
- 1 wooden train car
- 1 wooden shipping container (this magnetically attaches to either the train or the crane at the top)
- 3 separate pieces that make up the crane at the top. One caveat I have here is that the small red saucer with string that contains the magnet could become a choking hazard if a child dis-assembles it from the crane. Therefore, I would suggest supervising younger children when playing with this piece.
- 4 plastic supports or ledge pieces that fit into the "window holes" below the 1st level. These are used to support the optional curved track pieces that can be purchased separately. I also feel these 4 pieces can be a choking hazard if a child removes them especially when the optional track is not laying on top of them.

What I love is that no tools are required for assembly. Assembly was relatively easy once I understood that I had to release the clips on the underside of the 2nd (and 3rd) levels so that those levels would slip into place. It also took me a few minutes to figure out what the 4 blue pieces were for (plastic supports for the optional track). Even with the slight confusion I had with regard to the instructions, I was still able to assemble this in 30 minutes. Someone who has assembled this tower before, can probably do it in 5 minutes. It also comes apart pretty easily. Also replacement parts are not available from Fisher-Price at this time as per their website.

This tower with crane stands almost 3 feet tall (2 feet 31-1/4 inches) and 2 feet wide at their widest points.

This is a well built tower that definitely will engage young children (especially boys) as they let their imagination run wild as they play with the train on each level. Play is also all manual. The train car has to be pushed around the floor-level wooden track or around the grooved tracks on the second and third levels. The crane magnet can also be lowered and raised manually via a dial that operates the winch. I do feel very strongly that a child will want the additional elevated track and some more train pieces to enhance the play session but these items will have to be purchased separately, thereby increasing the cost associated with this purchase. One train car is definitely not enough especially if the child is playing with a buddy.

I was disappointed that the one page "picture instructions" did not provide a list of additional pieces that could be purchased, such as the elevated tracks and wooden train cars or train engines. I did put their website in the comments section of this review so those who are interested can inquire.

In summary, this is a well-quality adventure tower that will provide hours of entertainment for young children with an active imagination who are in the 3 to 8 year-old age range. The picture on the box indicates this is for children 3+. I do feel this is a bit expensive at the current price of $193.98. Had they included additional accessories like more train cars and the elevated track, I might be more agreeable to the price. I rated this 4 stars only because of this high price (I believe it's worth $125) and my belief that children will want more "accessories." Other than this, it's well-built, entertaining, and artistic (some adult hobbyist might like it too). I can't wait to hear their reaction when my friend's children see and play with this set.

UPDATE Oct 16, 2014 - My friend's 6-year-old son has been enjoying playtime with this tower. I got him the [[ASIN:B00J05NA9Y Mega Bloks Thomas & Friends Rescue Center Heroes]] to enjoy with this because this tower was so sparse.

title: Updated for the 21st Century
text:
Monopoly Revolution has been revised for our current environment with three new twists on the game and some additional changes.

1. There are now sounds and music with the addition of the electronic game unit that takes 3 AAA batteries.
2. The board is broken down into 4 transport zones (walking, cycle, car, and rocket) that allows the players to either take a chance (via the game unit) or force a deal with the properties.
3. The game board is round and 4 utilities instead of 2 have been included.

PROS:
- Instead of paper money, each of the 6 players are now given an ATM card to use with the game unit with a starting balance of 1.5 million.
- The prices of the property, houses, rent, etc. have been raised in line with today's costs.
- The game unit, music, transport zones, and round board are wonderful new twists to the game.

CONS:
- The game unit display (LED) is very hard to read; perhaps a swivel display with a brighter LED is the solution.
- You'll need a screwdriver to install the 3 AAA batteries into the unit.
- Since the dice are clear, they are hard to locate if you drop them on the floor.

My boyfriend and I enjoyed playing this new version and it is certainly more fun with additional players. This version has enough ATM cards for 6 players (older versions of Monopoly allow for 8 players). We also love the new "twists" on the game.

title: Box information is misleading
text:
I purchased the Men are from Mars game for me and my boyfriend. However, I was misled by the packaging. The box says the game is for couples 18 and older. I assumed one couple (2 people) could play. Unfortunately, my assumption was wrong. Other games say for children 3 and up and then say 1-3 players, etc. This box doesn't give you a player count.
Since we don't have another couple to play this game with, I just wasted my money. The manufacturer needs to change their packaging to say for 2 - 4 couples over 18 years. I'm extremely disappointed.
The game board folds in four and looks like it would easily wear out if you used it a lot. However, if I had the appropriate amount of participants, it looks like the game would be good for a few laughs and some healthy fun. I suspect you couldn't play it over and over as eventually you'll have answered all the questions. What you really need is a steady dose of different couples to play the game with so that the game stays interesting.
However, if you don't have the requested participants, you've just wasted your money as the game requires 2-4 couples.

title: Helping me break a lifelong bad habit
text: I've tried lots of fidget toys in attempt to stop picking at my fingernails and cuticles. I've been a lifelong picker. This set is the first that I've used that has ever been able to help me curb my habit. I love how I can dig my nails into the thick silicone and it doesn't break, peel, or crack. These are also super stretchy so I can wrap them around my fingers and hands.

title: TLDR, my favorite. Thoughtful game play, adaptable, HQ.
text: As a strategy game connoisseur, this game has become my absolute favorite that I have ever played. And I would say that even if it didn't have a Harry Potter theme. I'm not even a *huge* HP fan. The game play is super fun and I love that there are 7 levels ("school years") of difficulty. We played from 1 to 7 to start. As avid game players, we like to play year 5 if we want to sit down and play just one game that we're pretty certain we will win. Years 6 and 7 were a challenge to defeat; much is up to luck. I love that the game is so adjustable depending on who you're playing with or even what mood you're in for the night. And truly, the game play elements are really so thoughtful. Also, this game cards and pieces are HIGH QUALITY. This game is more expensive than some but without a doubt worth the money for what you physically receive as well as the different experiences you can have with it. If you're looking for a quick, easy game to play with young kids, this isn't it; particularly the higher levels take a good deal of brain power and strategy.

title: A must-have in your gaming repertoire
text: My spouse and I love this game. We are so happy to have a shorter, strategy-heavy game to add to our game repertoire. This game has aspects of deck-building strategy, so it starts slow and ramps up fast. It has gameplay rules that reminded us of Dominion and Rivals of Catan 2-player. We're so happy we got this.
