title: Great tool for individual learning to count/sort.. group and color coordinate'
text:
Makes learning numbers, grouping, sorting a lot of fun.. these come in x6 colors in groups of x6 each color. Although I do wish these were in sets of 10… these offer up a fun way to make a game about them. Tiny animals can be mixed up and sorted into their bowls which practices grouping. They can be counted in random colors in sets of 10,20,30… these are great to teach the beginning aspects of adding/subtracting but, most of all- they're just a fun “toy” that kids don't even realize their putting any mathematics into play..!!

Easily used in a classroom of playroom.. even the bathtub! We've used this way a few times.. our little one loves to suction stick them everywhere! Then, he uses his “tongs” to remove 1x1.. ha! He's made up his own game and loves to count off as he's doing so- btw, he's only 2.7months.. and he can count them off to 20 (with the exception of a few teen numbers getting skipped!!) Definitely a great way to get ready for preschool.. at a price point of $15- this will be around for any siblings to follow. Could be used in a classroom or daycare- but keep in mind.. the smaller number makes them a bit limited.

Smaller in size.. be sure of these do not make it into mouths of smaller children. Otherwise, a really great learning tool. A great add-on or gift for the preschool age… hoping info helps decision- stay safe, everyone!

title: Perfect learning and reinforcement tool!!
text:
A great learning tool to help prepare a child for school.. even a useful option to aid and help reinforce/practice what is being taught in a current class for a little one.. Fun activities are engaging and pages are sized in a way that book is easy to take anywhere. Each page is created on a stronger pressboard page with a coated laminate.. making them durable to hold up to the wear and tear the younger kiddos can bring! Comes with hole punch and x2 included jump rings to connect into a flip book. The set up offers ability to connect into x1 larger solid book or x2 separate smaller sizes. Easily removed from the jump ring as needed to reach multiple kids at one time- would be ideal for any preschool or daycare setting as well.

Each board/page is clearly marked and color-coded in the right hand corner with a gradual incline in skill level from easier to advanced. Making it very simple to take apart and clip back in order just the same for adults!

Set comes with x4 colored dry erase markers.. with kid proof lids! Could be a helpful, perk or a nuisance.. depending on independence, you're trying to achieve. *I made a simple switch of white board markers so, little one could have satisfaction of completing task on his own- mini whiteboard eraser, easily fits in the hand, and does its job to clear the board.. I do suggest wiping clean of all marking so nothing stains pages or settles- bc, they will!

A solid learning tool that boasts integrity to be used by multiple children, overtime or in a class setting.. If needed, replaceable markers can keep this user-friendly even when markers run dry! Hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone.

title: Perfect pack of playing cards that keeps on giving..!!
text:
Why not!!? If needing a new deck of playing cards and one is offered with multiple playing opportunities.. why not!? Obviously, one can use to play any game where a standard deck necessary.. But, this offers up a few more twists that only add extra fun options along with any regular card game. Riddled with questions or scruples, quirky fantasy pictures and ability to create a “telephone” story (we're each person ads on from the info provided before them..) you've now got a versatile deck of cards- to use as you'd like! Ha.. would be funny to use Phone and record stories as you go!

Yesss!! You can 100% play your game of blackjack, 21, war, up/down river, and so on.. just adding a fun and lively conversation piece if want! Or, just play the cards for questions or story telling all on their own- Great way for a lot of versatility- it's a great replacement option for a standard deck of cards.

Nicely sized and perfectly coated to have substance yet still slide thru the hand as expected. They'll need the expected wear/tear to start to shuffle easier.. but, that's to be expected with any new deck. I find it speaks quality finish!

A great gift for those college kids, any game enthusiast.. or game collector! Great for one who finds joy in unique things- this deck is a great addition! Hoping info helps decision… Stay safe everyone.

title: Perfect price point and product for a universal egg hunt!
text:
A nice alternative to standard primary color candy egg.. these are fun matted pastel colors that are to be filled with a “moshi” toy in leuí of just more candy! Perfect for any recipient.. no worry at all of allergies for a child and bc the shapes are simply Easter themed.. they're unisex for both boy/girl alike. Love these are perfect for a class, church group or neighborhood hunt.. there is no angst in melting chocolate, specific recipient etc. the fun toy can be enjoyed by any age as well..

Keep in mind these are individually wrapped toys- but, must be put into egg by the person ordering.. no worries as it only takes total of 5-10min
of prep time. Majority of eggs stayed sealed- but a few needed a piece of tape/sticker to help the process. Sort of par for the course with Easter Eggs! For the price point- these are ideal! Hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone..

title: A pricy repetitive function 1yr olds love..
text:
This offers a solid performance by repeating the motion and movement each time.. different textured balls in different colors can keep a little one entertained. I like this produces the same results- it's very reliable.. and doesn't fail in the process. title: Want to learn to juggle? 100% for teens/adults.. takes patience and skill!
text:
Having a similar toy with a “U” shape elbow that was a fully enclosed tube with open ends.. I was expecting that same type of needed skill set for this item. For anyone like me who thinks it's comparable to the mentioned toy.. this is far more difficult bc of the open design. I believe this IS for those interested in beginner steps in the process of juggling vs. inclosed style that is about the methodical rhythm + feel received as its end goal. The open tube creates the opposite vibe- with intention to develop a skill that is difficult and will take plenty of patience and practice to pull it off. Something that's not always relaxing-

U shape piece is very sturdy and easy to grip and hold steady. Did not realize it came with x2 U pieces.. One ea. in light/dark blue. To begin one masters moving a ball inside a U and developing ability to have ball roll up one side, actually arch and become airborne then, land and roll back down the opposite side of tube. Eventually, moving to the ability to incorporate one U in each hand.. while completing the ball process ie., just like juggling! This helps create a feel/motion for a user- then it's practice, practice, practice till ready to toss balls without the aid of the device.. and gain the skill of juggling!!

Ball has smooth exterior with a weighted feel similar to a golf ball and approx in size as well.. The weighted component actually makes the juggling process easier to learn. Careful bc these can go rogue while learning.. so, be free and clear of breakable items! Best in a larger space or one you've prepped and removed breakables!

Solidly made for a specific purpose. In theory, it feels capable of aiding user to develop a skill. Best to keep in mind- definitely a fun challenge for those who have interest. Hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone.

title: Clever! simulates adult activity kids love.. A few perks/quirks to know!!
text:
[[VIDEOID:8f7fe309a67a9bfde68a14ae2a4f610d]] Created in likeness of an ATM machine- it functions as a piggy bank or, simply a child's toy! Simulating an adult action most kiddos find super awesome- ie, dreaming to drive car, grocery checkout, make-up, ATM, etc.. Kudos to a clever idea that mimics a few realistic features- it's unlike any other toy I've seen of its kind.

Includes instruction manual with NEED TO KNOW INFO.. including the PIN # to open bank door.. without it you have no access!! Toy itself does NOT have ANY prompts or cues on “how to” operate found on keypad!! Basically, if haven't read or have access to manual then you wont know how to operate, open.. or turn it on!

A standard # Keypad controls device.. the Asterisk * in left hand corner is “command” button- it shuffles options such as songs, abc's, animals, sounds, PIN code, etc. it just isn't marked in any capacity. Making this key in a color (ie. a green button) or labeling would fix so much. Also, no stop.. or on/off button (ie. a red button!) Hit a wrong choice- ha.. it must cycle thru! One perk to that- it's relatively quick and kids seem to like it. I included photos to try + help make sense of the info. above- Note: password is 0000.

The bill slot is tricky depending on age.. our 3yr old struggles bc of dexterity level and fact, $ is paper thin- it can bend/crease in trying to align putting into slot- it can prove a bit tricky for littler kiddos. Only if $ was laminated.. it would make all the difference. *I may laminate to solve problem.. and preserve the $. Also, as bills slide thru they end up disheveled on inside.. laminating would fix this as well. *Has a coin slot but, no pretend coins included. One can use real coins or add a set. Slot will fit quarter size on down.

Definitely entertaining.. unique as they come, and unlike any I've seen. An ATM idea with plenty of extras. Would be a fun gift- with a few quirks to overcome..!! Hoping info helps decision- stay safe everyone.

Hoping info helps decision- stay safe everyone!
—————————————————————-
Below I've included a few rabbit craft ideas if they help..
Depending on your need- one could use these rabbit as star of another project by adding x1 item and a glue gun! i would have need for.

Hack: a few bunny ideas-
1. hot glue the back side onto a 12” skinny wooden dowel.. these could be stuck into a plant, added the same into a spring arrangement, etc.
2. One could hot glue x2 exact rabbits “sandwich/Oreo” style onto the same type dowel- creating a 3-D effect. (there are duplicates of same cutout!) gluing x2 will allow for full 360° view without showing glue.
3. One could Hot glue onto skinner satin rope that is cut/knotted off long enough to slip over the head and make a pendant for a child.
4. Using a rougher twine.. hot glue back of these approx x8” apart to create a garland effect for mantle.
5. Paint/finish completely.. and sporadically lay flat down middle of dinner or serving table like pieces of confetti. Sprinkle a spring confetti in the same fashion.. to wow and bring home an Easter effect!
6. Hot glue back side to a simple napkin ring to create Easter theme for each place setting.. using skinny sharpie and write name for a place setting-

title: Fabulous.. on every level!! Total quality- A helpful tool for spelling/reading!
text:

title: Clever.. Truly is water balloon evolution!! Included Hacks for EASY use..
text:
Every kid loves a water balloon fight.. It's like a child's rite of passage into a higher realm! Only, Mama feels differently: ripped balloons from nozzle threads, sacrificing fingers when tying it off! Ha.. anyone else fall for the ‘nozzle hat' put on end of hose for easy fill.. all you got was wet! Top this off with a mess of colored debris to clean up.. aka- popped balloon shrapnel. Well, not anymore- here lies a solution!!

Clam style orb magnetically held shut via a “flip top” middle. these fill best submerged underwater. Opened up.. just ‘cup catch' the water inside. It may sound tricky but it's not!! Hack: fill with slow trickle! With a closed seal orb like pursing the lips- create a small pucker opening in the seam. As you do- let water trickle into open pucker.. when done- relax the squeeze to seal it up! Note: orb usually fills up 1/2 - 2/3. and it is plenty! No worry about water level- these will still be effective just fine!

A bit unsure- if orb was painful on contact.. it's not!! Tiny magnets set in silicone pop open with pressure/contact making it fun for young + old alike. Great option for a pool, summer bbq, beach day.. great b-day gift or activity. *Keep in mind # of participants bc, a set of x4 won't serve a lot of peep! *Best to plan for ea. player to have x2-3 to make a real go of a game! *Hack: if used in backyard or park- place a few h2o buckets out for refill stations. *Hack: assign a color that matches a balloon orb to individual player to help identify whose “balloons” are who's- and keep bickering between kids to a minimum!

A respectable set sold at higher price point up front.. with multiple uses it will pay for itself in the end- but the ease/convenience it brings is priceless. Hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone.

title: I'm smitten with fun learning.. or, learning fun!! See Hacks for easy ideas..

(name we've assigned it in our house!)

A few unique fillers: dried beans, elbow mac, split peas, rice (smooth pearl pilaf!) or mini stones for vase, rubber bb's for air soft gun, smoothed sea glass, 1” yarn nubs (aka: yarn inchworms!) coffee beans, granulated sugars a hit! Shred. coconut hair and our fav- tiny seed beads for jewelry making feels so cool!! I love you can use things around the house.. *Hack: grab snack bags and store items post play to reuse without waste for the next round and make for easier set up! Fill a shoebox with variety of bags or various options- makes process EASY!! Don't be afraid to fill all containers with same item and enjoy measure, pour, stir just the same. Store set with DIY add-on box together!

*Seller an add-on “item kit” of fill items in storage containers would be awesome to offer as optional purchase! Until then- create your own! I included photos of a few quirky items we filled to give ideas!

Added tools: measuring cups/spoons, ice cream scoop, ladle, suction syringe, shot syringe, whisk.. turkey baster. *Hack: a $1 store or kitchen drawer clean out can let you gain a few utensils that you keep with your kit.. it just adds extra fun and provides even more options. Along with work/focus on diff. skill sets.

Made with integrity and solid quality in a well thought design.* Hack: Placing mat/containers inside a disposable lasagna pan keeps spills contained and clean up a breeze- keep pan with kit to reuse!! Ideal for home, preschool, daycare, gma's house.. perf. holiday gift- kids LOVE this. After constant “no- don't” this is perfect outlet to throw caution and structure to the wind.. title: Smaller vs big- great for STEM- different then expected, see photos..!!!

title: Unique and easy activity for a group or single user- instant entertainment!!
text:

No strict rules to learn or apply.. just a light “roll” of the dice- whichever shape faces up is the one to try and locate! This is where you can vary the play.. everyone finds an item containing that shape.. Or, search till the first person finds and roll again! *varying the strategy allows you to control length of time per game. You could even choose the first to find 5 items- wins! Truly, there's no wrong way to play!!

Some shapes may be harder to locate if played outdoors- ie. heart, star.. You can always prep area to set out a few items like you would for a treasure hunt.. Or, just encourage participants to be creative and use imagination!

Ball is made of a Nerf type foam with a coated finish.. easy for any age to roll and maneuver. Water resistant so it's easy to wipe clean. title: Fun for on the go- wish letters/#'s were more substantial..
text:
This is designed nicely for “on the go” use or car travel entertainment! When opened it can be a little tricky without a solid surface.. so I appreciate the interior trays edges help keep pieces from tipping or spilling out.

Extra fun with dual sided option- white board or magnet. Smart thinking to have both sides capable to withstand the marker bc, some kids don't always realize they can't write freely on either board! White board is stainable.. so you need to wipe off after every use! Definitely a cheaper version of material.

The other angst is the quality of plastic letter/# casings- these are a far thinner and cheaper version of the official letter magnet sets. No worry these will do their job, but they lack a better quality about them. *Also note: you get just x1 of ea. letter.. so, spelling words can be hard! It would also be nice to include x2-3 markers! Varied colors are fun and would prolong playtime. One can add a few extras to the set is desired- either magnets or markers alike.

A fun activity kids seem to enjoy- ours thinks it's a “laptop” just like his dads! Could be a cheaper gift option to take or keep at grandmas house.. “A leave in car toy” to use in waiting rooms, sibling ball games or traveling etc. Hoping info. helps decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Fun tub water toys.. but, unrealistic science lab for merit! Flawed pieces-
text:
[[VIDEOID:9f67bc80308d29f2e6d08db92facd127]] Wow! STEM introduced at a young age.. I love that! These softer sided silicone containers are fun for the kids and seem to entertain and keep them interested- unique color changing features and various pour abilities is fun and exciting.. However, just don't expect the working science lab like we did!

The silicone material is quite pliable and loses shape under the weight of water.. it also can undo grip on wall suction. Each “cup” should have x2 suctions to hold it in place- but, x2 of our cups were missing x1 of their built in suctions- basically rendering useless on the wall!! As you see in my photos- I've shown the errors and how we had to shift to the tubs edge. *Another fyi- these do not like to stick on porous tile.. but stick to solid porcelain fine.

Another angst we encountered- x2 “cups” were also missing the open hole to insert the included habitrail tubing! It has a nozzle nub present where hole should be.. but, opening is sealed shut. All rendering set up shown in instructions- obsolete!! Yep! We were dead in the water- (pun intended!) bc the main feature that starts the process of connections was sealed over with silicone!? I admit, it was a bit of a let down.. that quickly went away when just used for tub fun. Hoping it's a fluke that set we have is flawed.. otherwise, it's entertaining and hits a lot of fun features kids like with water play: pouring, measuring, bubble concocting, water fall tubes etc.. tbh, mine used tube to blow bubbles in water creating a Jacuzzi effect! Hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone.

Set of 30 total- x5 of each design.. and bag of random color sticks along with x30 rings. To assemble + sign will take under 10min.. it's that easy!

*Note: glow stick only slides in one end- the other side is too small to fit and it should easily inserts. IF, it won't fit.. just flip it around as you have the wrong end!! If it sounds confusing- trust me, it's not. It's made this way so stick won't slide out the other side! *Don't activate stick as they only lasts approx. 12hrs. and will be spent before received! title: A fun activity for the cooped up indoor days of winter…!!!
text:
Clever and all inclusive DIY craft made to let little ones embrace their creativity and paint away with a fun activity! I find this a total lifesaver during the wet weather!! Keeping a 3yr old. cooped inside isn't easy- but in the height of flu/rsv season it's a must in freezing Utah winter. It's also important to note: this activity could be shared by a few- or even provide more than a single day of painting entertainment!

X3 small ceramic pieces and x2 brushes can be enjoyed however one decides.. Ha! Resealable flip top paint lids let one easily close up for later date. (I do wish it had x3 brushes.. x1 for each ceramic piece included.. if you have an extra brush from home, it will work no prob.!) Ceramics vary in their detail as, a child can paint extra's onto these OR, simply paint over the etched design and keep it easy. There's simply no wrong way.. and results are awesome however it's done!

Only thing missing is a protective cloth to paint on. I suggest a vinyl or plastic placemat, flattened paper bag, etc. to cover surface- and play clothes! Paint may stain certain fabrics. But, no prob washing off kiddos with just warm soapy water.. Ha! That's even including a bit of paint in the hair!

***Two easy tricks I found and wanted to share:
Hack 1: separate the paints into pairs of 2- it makes it easier to use without all tipping over.. scissors separate the plastic letting you make these into x3 sets of two.. and its easier to share!!
Hack 2: use wax paper over the counter for a no muss/no fuss way to keep mess contained and provide EASY clean up!!

A great gift or rainy day project.. and a fun activity to use imagination, creativity and simple skills. At the end of the day who doesn't love to paint! Hoping info helps decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Wow! The only one like it it's kind.. and crazy cool!

title: Solid set for a great price… fun for toddlers!
text:

title: Has potential.. may need an older or skilled rider?!  We've improved..!!
text:
Update: after a few months of off/on use- ours figured out how to ride on his own… don't give up- kids can get the hang of it just fine!!!

Super excited in theory.. with ability to use manually or with electronic option as needed- it seemed ideal by just a flip of a switch on bottom. Only for some reason, pedal doesn't respond every time like it should!! (Yes! battery is full when trying it- yet 15% of time it wont respond electronically- reason deducted x1 star!!?) When pedal engages- scooter is stable, easy to glide and maneuver.. and enjoyed. Battery outlasts our toddler whose rides for 15-25min straight and it hasn't run out! (For reference: our little is 33mo, 36lb, 38” tall.. almost 3yr old.)

because of electronic component- ours struggles to grasp concept without using the pedal since he's learned to ride with the electronic aid! So, when it fails to respond or we have pedal off- he just “jerks” scooter back/forth and side/side- its as if he's trying to get it to do what it “should..” by tugging it into motion. For some reason.. he doesn't naturally get moving scooter without electronic help so, it can leaves him fristrated.

Instructions are straightforward and connecting handle atop the scooter can be a tad tricky and tight.. Best if use included hardware to connect all screws loosely first THEN, tighten after all parts are aligned. Light up wheels are just extra!!! Not needed and not sure how long they'll last esp. rider encountered water elements? I love the “long press” music feature- ha, it's my fav. **bc, It shuts music all the way off!!

We've only used inside on tile and large smooth nape rug. No tire markings is nice.. I like inside option bc it's winter here! I realize some issues had may be caused by our rider himself- but feel pedal should not be a problem we have to deal with if it's charged. Hoping info can help decision.. stay safe everyone!

title: Fun fidget to use when noise isn't an issue..!!!
text:
A really fun fidget that hits the mark on keeping hands thoroughly entertained as its so much fun to wiggle into your own personal rhythm... There is no “wrong way..” A user can find their pattern with any of these type devices.. it's what I appreciate most about this style- This brings an ability to shift, click, wiggle and glide however it's best soothing to you!! Basically, it's a way of making it personal… The only downside- is the crinkle!!! Its a snap, crackle, pop of noise that would be disruptive and distracting to others around.. So, I do not recommend in a class type setting!!

Ordering the “brick” also offers a sensory satisfaction for those who like to physically trace the outline of the raised connectors- tbh, Im not certain why some feel this shape is automatically able to connect to a building set of similar blocks? Bc, It doesn't.. and should be noted as such!!

Now, the fact this splits in two is surprisingly fun… and for one whos trying it out for their son- it's been a lot of fun to play with! Far more enjoyable to a fidget, spinner, cube, or squish that are made as fidgets! Priced higher bc it's made of quality materials.. I would deduct .5 stars if I could- But, because I can't and the fact you can make this so uniquely personal.. I gave it x5 stars! Hoping info helps decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Solid little impromptu play anywhere game.. !!
text:
Very straight forward.. what you see is what you get! No attached game board or pieces, etc. 100% just the black shaped disc- and instructions (see photo included..) that's it!! very sturdy/firm and easy to take with you.. ANYWHERE!! Simple slip in your bag to happy hour or impromptu party- dorm room, neighbors house.. it's to sit atop a cup, mug, bottle making it a bit sticky! Good news is- washes/wipes off with soapy water no prob.!

Rules are NOT difficult to learn- IF, your players pay attention.. game is a simultaneous “movement..” Once you know THAT- you're home free!! I suggest informing rules and x1 practice round..(15min. give/take..) it will make a lot more sense for “those kind of gamers.. ha-ha!!”

Up/running: all positive feedback from our crew.. no one was bored and the quick pro quo is a great bonus to keep all engaged- any with fierce competitive edge will keep wanting to go another round.. trust me, it was me! Not much strategy just clever quick, thinking. Of course loser takes a swig makes it more interesting- but you can add any challenge if wanted/not.

Great gift for an adult aged family or anyone who loves a fun add-on to Game collection. $15 price point makes easy + great gift or stocking stuffer!! Hope info helps decision- stay safe everyone!

title: Trifecta of learning for numbers and counting- with a color bonus!!
text:
Perfectly thought out to learn #'s 1-10 in triple form..!! This puzzle allows for use of: numeric symbol, actual spelling + dot counting- a trifecta of learning the basic ten!! The cherry on top is including the element of Identifying colors as well.. using primary and a few 2ndary outliers. Although it's just a matching of colors (without the written word) it teaches how to visually pair.

Cute wooden “bubble style” lady bugs with corresponding # of dots.. will help teach the physical counting process- ha! It's a puzzle that keeps on giving!! All pieces are large enough not to fit into the mouth.. no matter how loud they are!! The 10 pieces will fit universally even if color match is incorrect.. can help learning simple dexterity!

Why not 5 stars? A puzzle without magnetic components to self hold to a puzzle board.. needs a box or carry bag and this doesnt provide either. One must find box/Ziploc sized to store and keep from losing pieces.

Also, some of painted ladybugs are a bit of a stretch for the color they represent!! For example, look at green- aka ladybug 4 that is not green!! It's an airy mint for all true purposes and although a shade of- it needs bold and distinct in green primary shade. Same with magenta/hot pink-aka ladybug 5.. board is colored appropriate but not the bug..as it looks red! Lastly, violet aka ladybug 9…this needs a bigger variation from the purple- most likely, purple should be much darker but, you get the idea!

Listing the flaws is not a dealbreaker!! Rather a solid understanding of what you'll receive. Made of wood and if cared/stored properly.. this is one that could last through child rearing years! A great gift for any.. could be used in a daycare, preschool, playroom etc- it draws attention for certain. $16 is a respectable price point and one we'll get plenty of use from. Hoping info helps decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Has such promise.. problems are simply in design!
text:
Wow!! In theory, a fabulous idea- playing a game created 4000yr. ago is almost hallowed experience! Regardless of how captivating.. that one sheer fact brings an elevated element to playing. One we were happily anticipating.. only obstacles presented as we got underway..

Most vital: Instructions are not clear.. and being complex that just can't happen!! (keep in mind-what life was 4k yrs. ago! This game transports you giving a taste of that exact experience.. it's noted by the simplicity of dice, pieces of leather/wood, even the drawings- it's really pretty wild!!) Simply put- instructions must be rectified. We found a way to learn via posted info. online.. that shouldn't ever happen in 2022..!!

As for game components: perfectly fit into a cubed style tin. The velvet pouches hold/protect small wooden parts.. board is rolled up like scroll and held with a faux leather strap. All an authentic touch but also the reason the game board fails.. Pieces are cut from a very light wood which lets them slide off their mark easily. But, biggest struggle is in the board itself. While trying to offer an authentic replica they've created game board on a faux leather hide.. prob. is bc it's been rolled and stored as such- it wont lay flat! Arched without ability to correct and pieces sliding around.. they must find better solution.

Definitely has merit and potential- if solid instructions were included that were simple to follow.. and pieces were better thought or stored differently- this could be five star for the experience alone. A unique game to have if fixes are put in place. Hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone.

title: Higher end to last forever.. universal for all ages!!

title: Small range of motion… one with ADHD may struggle to keep interest till loosens!!

title: Quality conversation for any relationship past, present or future..!!
text:

title: Know the quirks first.. Bc, it sure has some- but so worth it!!!
text:
Made of hard plastic the “lock-cars” and keys misses details and markings: # on a few cars missed + difficult to see the key #'s at all! Toy is lacking quality control.. AND YET, this was SOO 100% entertaining for our little one- I'm totally willing to put up with the quirks/nuances bc of it!! *Note: 5 stars given is all for it's engaging capability, not finishing details..!!!

So much variety of fun- Who doesn't love using a key? give the x1 master key to open east- or let match by trail/error or numbers. Train or car imagination play, connecting pieces, learning numbers. ALL fun is diff. and engaging. We get 30+ min. of play from a toddler without getting bored- and so worth it to me! But, a decision for you to make now that you have all the facts!!

Quick Fixes: keys have #'s you can easily sharpie over! I suggest if so, to match color sharpie used to color of car.. it cuts frustration down big time!! **Also, #'s on cars are written word not the symbol.. ie, two vs. 2, one vs. 1.. SO, we also put physical #'s on car just above the lettering. Hopefully this makes sense to parents + can help those with younger toddlers! A lot to fix?? Maybe- but, $12.98 for all the fun it's brought- i'm still glad I ordered.. it's been worth it!!

Depending on recipient, age and effort you may want to put in or overlook- Choice is yours. Again, worth it for us.. it's been a total hit at our house!! Hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone.

title: These have some perks… And quirks!!
text:
Smaller in size.. see photo compared to an adult hand- easy to store/use on the go. *HACK: store each puzzle in its own quart size Ziploc.. this keeps all parts to correct puzzle together and saves lost pieces! Puzzles are NOT magnetized to hold pieces on building board otherwise.

Although simple/easier build- realistically more suitable for age 2-3yr. (not 1yr. as stated) Can use to learn color, dexterity, problem-solving and dinosaurs. Ha!! with the exception of x1 outlier unicorn.. Hm??! (tbh, I removed it + put other x5 in our dino play bucket.. problem solved!)

Made of wood the board itself is a thinner type than most. Pieces themselves are thicker so easier to place/remove. Has decent paint job with a few details. Random shapes can be harder for littles to put in place- no mimicked lines etc. are drawn on the board to help. Building just x1 puzzle at a time will help SOO much in solving!!

Higher priced for their quality- these will do their job x6 over so paying more for the quantity! Giftable in cartoon style box. Puzzles can offer a fun way to learn/entertain. Hoping info. helps decision… Stay safe everyone.

title: Unique and holds attention well..
text:
Seen, yet never tried… So much fun for ANY to play with! Ball itself fits nicely in palm of hand and is easy to pack or carry when on the go. Perfect option for one who needs in a car or classroom type setting.

Easy to maneuver the “gearshift..” it was almost a little too loose. In case any user must have need to be in control of a pattern type maneuver. Moving this around, it may easily slide into a diff. socket while one is trying to repeat a specific or continued pattern in succession.. Something mine does!! ie, if he moves the gear up left/right to the top- he must repeat right/left going down.. (hence what I mean by pattern! bc this slides so freely- it can frustrate if slips to ‘the wrong slot.' It made us create the “oops” factor.. to help sooth him!) It's too precious- when using I hear a verbal “oops!” every few min. from the other room.. in a way that is progress for us!!

At $11.99- it's a solidly made fidget with merit.. the black ring stand is a total bonus, it lets you set it down without rolling. Hack: this can also rest on upturned water bottle twist off lid.. (if band/stand is misplaced!) Hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone.

title: Wow!! Absolutely smitten with this set and price- Wow!!
text:
I am absolutely shook.. this all inclusive train is a perfect starting point or add-on for any set!! Built 100% compatible to use with “Thomas/Brio” brand as I have both and mixed in, it's hard to even tell brands apart. Some color variations but with all natural wood.. it's to be expected and natural for any wooden train! Note: perfectly smooth pieces- NO rough edge or splinters 100% kid friendly!

So much detail in the accessories- DanG! Helicopter is to die for with spinning rotor..and “Space Station Center” which is heart of the figure 8.. brings the fun unique shape. All so amazing bc entire set is UNDER $20..!! One of best deals I've seen in quality of train paraphernalia- EVER! (you just get mind around.. a train in outer space!?)

Keep box with picture for easy “replica” build. But, remember a train track is imagination play- there's no wrong way to build. Skies the limit.. ha! (bc of the space theme!!) 2yr old can connect pieces but needs adult help creating a track. Keeps ours self entertained for 20-30min at a time.. priceless!

Awesome gift idea for boy/girl alike..I dont hesitate to recommend as its just that perfect! Hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone.

title: Not just for kids- this is a total blast..!!!!
text:
What can I say- this is a rock crawler, wall crawler step crawler.. even a shoe or toy crawler!! Doesn't stop for much.. it's talents are impressive making it a great option for younger kiddos without savvy driving skills to maneuver around items.. this little crawler will go right over OR.. flip directions- and be on its way quite fast I might add without needing to use hands to “untangle!”

Noise is just that of a motor- So grateful it doesn't have a siren or flashing strobes..!! It's just a revved up toy noise- only heard when in motion.. It's harmless and not irritating to drive mama crazy!

X2 sets of batteries- lets you charge x1 while using the other.. we played for solid 25+ min. and battery never faltered. The other battery was ready if needed. The issue in battery swap is a TINY screw that holds battery door shut on remote and crawler itself and mini screwdrivers included for the job- it's just a hassle of a process! *Put tool where easy to find- or you'll be searching forever- trust me.. i'm talking from experience!!!!

Otherwise, nothing but fun- ages 3yr and up.. just bc of control with the remote in any real capacity. This is fun for teens and adult alike- fast and entertaining.. SOO impressed by its abilities.. Makes great gift that any age would love. Hoping info helps your decision.

title: Love this brand start to finish..
text:
One can expect quality with “table topics“ brand in their signature plexiglass cubes… coated cards printed in classic style. Cubes can store pristine forever or set out on display for just the occasion. We have x3 cubes on dinner table now.. various topics depending on company we're with! Loving to add “Inspiring Women” cube- especially with x2 daughters.

FYI- these can be conversation starters or a game played that nobody wins! With this you answer x1 card each person.. or move in a circle asking the same question of everyone and then repeating process with a new card. The term game is used loosely.. Each card presents a question on x1 side and a relatable person/reason on the other side. Ex. What's favorite music? Flip side will feature an artist and some reflective fact of the question. “Topics” vary by cube you have- this happens to be inspiring women- so all featured cards are women!!

Made for “young girls” is a stretch. This is geared to young adult and up.. any gender can play!! Bc those featured are women excludes no one! Time played is up to user- as many cards read as desired.. a nice feature to control the time. Questions are quality and from basic to thinking, morals to character- how deep you open up is players choice! Nothing is vulgar or inappropriate.

A solid gift or addition to game closet.. sending our box back to college dorm with our daughter next semester- hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone.

title: Fun spin on Advent- can enjoy items afterwards!
text:
A fun take on advent- packed right into a decent sized shirt box.. CAREFUL cutting into or removing the wrap! Exterior box IS the advent window box itself- hate to cut or damage before you get opportunity to open as intended!! Doors are numbered but not in succession and with perforated lines to open easily.

Ducks are small at 2x2” the type that can be found set floating atop of “fishbowl” margarita or even in the toy gumball machine! Ducks are accessorized in xmas or winter decor.. Simple + sweet!!

Ducks can be put into play, tub toys.. even some like to collect. For us.. We chose for a college kiddo who's plan is to gather all-and then prank the main campus fountain by floating the ducks inside..!! A harmless prank- kids do all yr. Calendar just gets x2 birds w/ x1 stone.. ha-ha! Or should say “ducks” with that stone?! A fun surprise each day- it's the gift that will keep on giving! Hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone.

Reason for deducting x1 star is pricing- paying over $1 is a bit higher then it should be IMHO..

title: Great in theory- better for older Lego lover!
text:
Advent calendar that offers a mini build each day of Dec. till xmas.. tiny bagged pieces create parts to a xmas scene. Problem is, no step by step build instructions included with each item!! *Think mini happy meal toy- even those have “how to” paper inside. For best success you KEEP box intact to have visual of item your constructing to help frustration stay at a low! I included the photo of every object included.. some builds are so simple and some a bit more detailed *remember no wrong way to use imagination.. this may help offset any discouraged!!

CAREFUL cutting into or removing packaging wrap! The exterior printed box IS the advent box itself!! (you'll see perforated # doors.) I'd hate to cut or damage this before you get opportunity to open doors as intended!! *Also, the box itself creates “city backdrop road map” so.. careful when opening.. to gain all the perks. An extra pack of random pieces helps offset if one becomes lost- don't let it confuse you..

Best for older kiddos (8-10+) who still love the festivities.. I chose for my 19yr. old Lego-lover bc you're never too old to build.. especially at xmas time!! If given to appropriate age- this can be a fun 5-15min. activity. Once set gets underway the imagination play is endless.. I'd do suggest building when you have a few min. Not on way out the door to school! Hoping info helps decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Cute to add to kitchen play..
text:
A great add on to kids kitchen play… It has a fun feature of the toast popping up (it pops up- but not out!!) Buttons on front are pretend.. and timer twists making a clicking noise to simulate action. Toast lever on the side is what puts this into play and similar to a wind up toy- it runs a little buzzing or percolating noise.. and pop!! Toast is done!

Overall construction is stable, lightweight. Nothing fancy and very compatible with younger toddlers… something that can grow as younger children transition from to being entertained by a toaster- Who then use it in imagination kitchen play!

No fancy lights, whistles or bells! However, no need for batteries either!! As so many toys need to be plugged in and charged these days- it's nice to take a motor back to old school simplicity.. Size is small to carry or move around- (see up close pics of details above!) Toast is a firm plastic.. not foam to rip over time. **don't push into action by pressing on the toast- use the lever..otherwise, this can jam or break and stop working!! It happened to us but we got lucky to finagle it back on track.. whew!! Hoping info helps decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Wet performs best.. for grip and throwing results!
text:
Made for use in/out water.. I suggest wetting ball prior to play- it creates a grabbier fabric grip on what is smooth exterior. 1/3 smaller then standard football- its perfect for big/smaller players to get a solid hold.. and double laces help too! Wetting also puts perf. amount of weight on such a light ball to let you throw with solid accuracy. Hey, if playing at pool or beach.. its all about bragging rights!

Looks quirky on arrival- like a deflated balloon in a sock! Includes a pump (its ehh, but works!) let's you fill and play within minutes. Note: bc ball may lose pressure in heat/water bring the pump in case ball needs top off of air! Extra Note: if difficult to get a firm grip- expel some air for a better hold.. ”Tom Brady deflate-agate” mentality.. difference is you wont be in any trouble! A helpful tip for tiny hands having slip-grip issues!!

Needle is included. Note: dip in wax/chapstick prior to inserting will help secure a non leaking plug!!! (trick works on any ball- you're welcome!)

Bright colors are easy to spot if overthrown or in bushes.. has respectable craftsmanship. Nothing is loose or sloppy. Bonus set of x2 balls for $16- keep x1 and gift the other.. would make any happy to receive. A solid way to add fun for all ages to your outdoor fun.. hoping info helps your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Fun for toddlers indoors-great for cold day play..!!
text:
Expanding caterpillar is 6ft. of entertainment with that awesome “tent effect” that kids just love! Although a shorter height that equates to the need for sitting or crawling inside.. This makes a cool fort or hide out.. even an awesome entrance into a child's lair! It can spark imagination play- its refreshingly unique compared to the standard toys!

Think oversized slinky.. easy to condense and tuck inside the included carry bag being no more then 2” wide for storing away. Open and expanded- this can happily fit a few toddlers, toys or “ball pit” size balls like we used them! This has 2 round discs that can attach by hook/eye button to loosely close off either end- No worry.. these are optional to use and if in place, kids can still maneuver thru.. we set ours like a “flip door..” (see photos I've included.)

Caterpillar features include a fun cartoon face and antennas- along with its floppy feet.. matted pastel colors are unisex and easy to add to any space. Nothing but a lot of fun for a price under $20- Makes a great gift or spoiler.. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend. Hoping info can help your decision.. stay safe everyone!

title: Can crawl over anything- fun for any age!!!
text:
What can I say- this is a rock crawler, wall crawler step crawler.. even a shoe or toy crawler!! Doesn't stop for much.. it's talents are impressive making it a great option for younger kiddos without savvy driving skills to maneuver around items.. this little crawler will go right over OR.. flip directions- and be on its way quite fast I might add without needing to use hands to “untangle!”

Noise is just that of a motor- So grateful it doesn't have a siren to match flashing red/blues..!! It's just a revved up toy noise- only heard when in motion.. It's harmless and not irritating to drive mama crazy!

X2 sets of batteries- lets you charge x1 while using the other.. we played for solid 25+ min. and battery never faltered. The other battery was ready if needed. The issue in battery swap is a TINY screw that holds battery door shut on remote and crawler itself (see included photos above.) Mini screwdriver is included for a helpful undo- it's just a hassle of a process! *Put tool where easy to find- or you'll be searching forever- trust me.. i'm talking from experience!!!! *AND.. battery fit into crawler is TIGHT.. You must be careful fitting into it back into compartment so not to bend or break wire.. this aspect could be better for sure. Just be patient with the fit- it will get there!

Otherwise, nothing but fun- ages 4-5 and up.. just for controlling with the remote in any real capacity. This is fun for teens and adult alike- fast and entertaining.. I was so impressed by its abilities. Makes great gift that any age would love. Hoping info helps your decision.

title: Such a fun fidget- loves the colors!
text:
Hard to put down.. such a fun little fidget that has ample size and substance to hold onto. Weighs nothing and wiggles without effort- I appreciate it's not slippery or hard to hold.. keeps mom from retrieving over/over if infant drops easily!

Even the cupping sound is methodical! Sort of like a quiet clop-clop of horses hooves.. it's fun to maneuver and create the noise. Nothing loud as it's really only heard by user- another perk for mom!

Bright colors grab a child's attention.. and the fact you receive x2 for under $10- is a total deal! Twisted and manipulated in all directions we've had zero concern of breakage.. and no bigger than an adult size hand it's easy to slip into diaper bag or toy box. Easy to store away or take on the go!

Choosing rainbow variation- we've practiced and identifying these as we play.. our 30mo old can point out any primary color with accuracy found on inch worm!! Makes a great addition to your toy collection or a fun gift to give. Each comes in their own individual box and can easily be spilt up for x2 recipients. Hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone!

title: Great for party, class or larger group play…
text:
Very fun dress up set for boys or girls.. as the capes can be unisex! Can also be used year round- not just for Halloween..!!

Best part- these become a full cosplay costume by accessorizing! NO changing clothes is needed.. costume are add-ons with any outfit worn to create the finished look!! You can become a superhero in anything- school uniform, play clothes, PJs etc..?? Vvc

Note: set includes 4 capes and 8 masks.. capes are reversible and have a varied superhero insignia on each side (8 options in total.)

Perfect for family with kids, or a party.. even fun in classroom or theatre group, daycare and yesss.. the Halloween costume! These make a great gift for kids who love dress up and imagination play!

$18- is respectable for nicely made capes with adjustable Velcro to fit various sizes. I do wish this had a bit longer strip of velcro to fit a wider range. I can easily secure around 30 mo. old- but it does gape at neck.. longer strip of velcro could tighten for smaller child!! Masks have thicker elastic to hold in place- a bit irritating at edges/eye sockets due to felt fabric and awkward angles. Best for 3yr and up bc of fit. Length is perfect- as grownup- I can play too by wearing cape on looser fitting! Hoping info helps your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Great activity + exercise- definitely for younger kids!!!
text:
A great way to expel excess energy.. kids tend to love the motion of rocking or bouncing- and fact this is done easily under their own merit.. is nice for you and healthy for them. They enjoy being in motion and ultimately can tire themselves out in a manner of speaking! Sort of like peddling a bike around- nothing excessive.. but can actually help disperse pent up energy- What mama wouldnt love that!!?

We used electric pump to fill and cant imagine how long/rigorous a process it would have been to fill with tiny hand pump! This takes far more air than you'd expect.. zebra took shape quickly- then, it must FILL UP- A LOT. If not, it's obsolete of its purpose. Best way to know if full to its capacity- ears will not bend down!!! Trust me- it took over x3 tries to get it right. Blowup should barely indent under full body pressure.. Once complete, it's easy to zip closed. See photos included.

We used puppy leash to make reigns for our little guy to hold onto.. it helped 2yr old stabilize a lot. But they can also freely hold onto neck, head, ears!

Deducted x1 star bc it states toy fits 18mo-7yr old. Not even close.. if this fit much past 3yr old in size I'd be surprised! In order to create bouncing motion the legs hang off sides and feet hit just at the floor to let child push off. If a 2yr. old is ideal height to maneuver.. anyone bigger may struggle to do so!! Something to keep in mind when ordering.. Toys like this are made in different sizes.. best to choose one appropriate to fit proper size dimensions vs. base choice off of the ages listed.

Overall.. plenty of fun for $25- the fact it lets a little one use independence and exercise is a bonus! Feels solid without concern of bursting and cute and unique as a gift for self or others- hoping info can help your decision.. stay safe everyone!

title: Great option for indoor use…
text:
Perfect little balance bike.. made without grease or components to dirty or stain indoors. No black rubber tires to markup floors. This is ideal for indoor use- which was our intended purpose! With age and coordination needed.. I found it safer to ride on indoor floor vs. outside pavement!

Easy to assemble- x2 pieces connect to mount the seat.. no tools required as this securely clips into place by sliding metal pin into pipe with a pre-cut hole. Easy to follow instructions are just as simple and straightforward. Note: seat does NOT adjust and CANNOT be raised/lowered. Light weight and easy to maneuver, if supervised I had no concern bike was too heavy or cumbersome for toddler.

Reason for deducting x1 star: balance bike is consistent with toddlers capability and age listed at 12-24mo. However, bike size for a body that age is just FAR TOO SMALL!! We ordered for 18mo. old in the 52% for size.. precisely smack average for recommended user. Only seat to floor measurement was far too low- Only way to use is drag toe of shoe as you push.. or, fan legs out in awkward circles so not to catch on floor. I believe cognitive balance is on point with this age- So, unfortunate the seat doesn't match the average size child.. *This definitely doesn't provide any room to grow.. Not without ability to adjust seat height!

Overall structure is solid showing quality control with an easy build.. Could be a fun addition for developmental skills.. Would even make a great gift. Just keep in mind- seat to floor fit is SHORT! Making this best for younger/smaller toddlers if they can manage balance skills. Hoping info helps your decision.. stay safe everyone.

title: A quality ball intended for younger strength of contact..!!
text:
Ordering a sz. 3 soccer ball is best suited for a younger foot- one who's strength of contact is far less aggressive on impact. Used in this capacity- this ball is on point. However, If ball is used by someone with a much heftier strike.. you may notice it starting to lose its psi (inflated air is seeping out!)

The overall integrity seems present.. no sign of poor quality or craftsmanship. Set includes a needle, pump and carry net- a net that can also provide single person practice.(google any online video to see how this is done using net/bag. It can help player with touches on the ball-eliminating having to shag it down after every hit!)

If losing air- most likely culprit is the plug. HACK: a tiny bit of wax atop plug prior to pumping with a wax dipped needle (needle still has smooth entry.) Wax can help create an extra “barrier” to seal any escaping air. We do this with all our balls- so far no issues.. **it should be noted we use a sz.3 for shooting drills with a 4-5yr old players! Ball had merit to keep the psi level no prob.!!

One must also realize.. this may leak air through stitching from an older players strong impact- if this is the case..the most simple resolve is to size up to a sz. 4 or 5. If used as intended.. Zoojoy ball provides a quality option! Hoping info can help your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Kids LOVE those “forbidden buttons..!!”
text:
Perfect way to spark creativity and imagination.. It brings plenty of entertainment with its “forbidden switches“ they have set at their fingertips! Easy to twist, turn, flip, plug, poke, push their way into the fun responses- It has a compulsory vibe that really engages them with the fun responses!

Smooth edges and curved corners keep you worry free from accident or splinters. Made of a hollow wooden box this weighs next to nothing… So even the tiniest hands can hold onto. Perfect and easy to tuck into bag and take on the go. I do wish buzzer had mute option- it isn't overly loud but rather quite monotonous after a bit! This has no master on/off switch- so be sure when not in play.. buttons + switches are in off position to save your batteries.

Purchasing a similar toy was such a success this is our 2nd one! Ordered this to hang on playroom kitchenette double sided tape! Its become the kids “doorbell” and official command center for endless play- its awesome!

A truly unique idea for 1yr. old and up to enjoy.. nothing is to complex too fluster or frustrate. Makes a great gift for boy/girl alike and insert included x2AA batteries + tiny screwdriver this is user ready within a minute. For a worthy cause to support the people of Ukraine- hoping info can help your decision.. stay safe everyone.

title: Every child loves to push buttons- this is perfect..!!

Being such a success in the entertainment dept. we got a 2nd box to hang on playroom kitchenette! Its become the kids “doorbell” and official command center for endless play- its awesome!

A truly unique idea that little peeps 1yr. old and up can enjoy.. nothing is to complex too fluster or frustrate.
