title: Pricey memorabilia- worth the smile for sure!!
text:
Ordered for nostalgic purposes.. A great happy birthday surprise for my 19yr. old who loved his Bakugans as a kid.. This is a perfect set to give as a “throwback” to any who enjoyed the toys the first time around..

Used as a fun “dresser treasure or fidget toy..” At $39 pk. it includes 8 total in 3 diff. size and style variations.. with x2 of them lighting up (a new feature since we've purchased them over a decade ago.. !) Each ball comes with their “iconic coin..”

Definitely a solid mix for those active in the game or wanting a throw back down memory lane! Pricey like most of these crazy trends are. Hoping info can help your decision- stay safe everyone!

title: Has big potential- need to tweak but easily can do!!
text:
Just as headline reads a game with total potential!! Not sure why any product hoping to takeoff would cut unnecessary corners? ie. No timer… instead use your device?? Ugh, my pet peeve with game night is players distracted by cell phone during play and here you've asked us to bring in the enemy?! I cant suggest enough to add a sand timer- take out distraction! (Something you shouldnt have to do with new purchase!) While we're at it, get real wipe-off markers, bc included are subpar and don't like to erase!! A bottle of cleaner will help cards not stain- but it's optional.. See, why we shouldn't cut corners?! This is FUN- concept is there and a lot of laughs to be had… (just fix the issues like this!!)

Who can play: x3 or more players is best- otherwise you have “an old maid conundrum!” You know if 2 play and if you don't have maid.. the other does!! This is, if I vote for mine- and you vote yours.. we're always in a tie. X3+ players fixes that! We did play teams- IT WAS A RIOT!! Game can adjust like that. Age is teen/adult- younger wont understand abvr. concept.. you could team little with adult if needed but, prob. wont hold interest in the same way as others.

Game in play: instructions are unique- some steps easier to follow than others.. however, this is also a game strategy of common sense! We made our own set of rules that mimic original.. we took the gist and added simple where it became confusing. ie, we set pt. system by #'s of 10 scale and tossed out the offered idea. We also decided- first one to specified #..wins! This lets you control time less or more. We added bonus letters: Q,Z,X gave double pts. if you won round- which is a fun twist. Don't get me wrong you can use the rules including just be sure all players listen up during explanation..

A game mine really liked despite its shortcomings. Seller take note these are easily fixed.. you'd have a winner on your hands! As a family group text we always send snaps of unique license plates we see.. so for us, we find fun in the idea pregame! A concept completely unique to this game- tbh, I'd rate board/user friendly a 2.5 and fun had a 5 star!! Something to keep in mind when ordering.. Hoping info can help make your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: A build that needs patience + common sense!!
text:
Definitely an item that requires a little patience and a lot of common sense! With not a lot of hardware to assemble.. this can logistically be a bit tricky. In an attempt to keep storage to a small footprint they do an amazing job condensing the length of poles condense into a carry-on bag! The angst is- it comes at a cost of having to then assemble x3 pieces into making x1 pole for each corner. Might I add.. x3 very tight fitting pieces that get connected with screw + nut wing!

I find in typing this out it becomes a bit wordy and info. may be lost in translation. So, I went ahead and included photos of a few sketches I drew along with descriptions-hoping they'll help to understand the process!!? Yessss- this includes an instruction booklet.. only, it's a bit confusing at best!

Just think- x4 poles are broken into x3 parts.. each needs to be assembled with the hardware to slide in one of the four corner slots. Once x4 poles have been built.. and secured in canvas cover- place x4 rubber stoppers/feet on bottom. Use ballast to keep poles from tipping once erect.. string lights on interior/exterior. *One can utilize interior pocket to hold the small battery pack.. (I find it's a good starting point for the lights and work from there!) also remember lights are 100% optional and can be used in any capacity! Last step: place bottom floor mat inside.. and BooM!! A teepee is born!

*store carry bag till disassembled.. One can also “squish up“ like an umbrella and lean in a corner.. keep lights/ballast in interior pocket. Keep secured with a ribbon, velcro or bungee cord (roll mat separately like you would a yoga mat..) Ha! Storing in this capacity eliminates rebuild every time!

Overall, a fun addition kids absolutely love… It's their own private hideaway! We set up and left in playroom corner bc it's enjoyed so much! Made for 1-2 small toddler/children. Sturdy when complete but.. not bulldozer proof- so just be kind!

Hoping info provides help to clear up some of the confusion! Live and learn.. and pass it on!! Stay safe everyone.

title: Perfect for one who's parents in medical field..!!
text:
Ordered for nephew.. who's mama is a Labor and delivery room nurse! How great for him to cosplay and mimic what he sees mama dressing for on her workdays- after all, this is how kiddos learn so much! 100% universal for boy/girl.. along with fact, the costume can be a “doctor OR nurse” as it's not limited or stereo typed (an appropriate aspect this offers without even trying!!)

For 33”, 28lb. 2yr. old we chose 3-4T. Tbh, fit was great with ample room- remember, its a costume and not made with a lot of fitted detail!! I expect this may also get slipped on over something else while kids are playing.. So, if uncertain of size- go up! Length can always be rolled and rest of its fit is simple including elastic waist.

Accessories are so fun! A few have built in LED light and the shot is a big hit! But best is the working stethoscope.. one can actually hear their own heartbeat- so amazing! Glasses are adorable- but hard to keep on.. and the tiny mask is to die for! Only dislike in this entire set is the “medical bag.” Made of a thin soft synthetic cloth with plastic handle- it's a bit hard to fit all pieces (especially if 2-3yo loads it up!) *Hack: we got a black insulated lunch pack that is perfect! This holds its shape, has ample room.. and flip top zip lid lets little one load or locate the bags content- an easy fix if other rips or annoys.

Great set! Makes a great gift at a solid price of $20. Hoping info can help make your decision.. stay safe everyone.

title: Great to entertain while you scrub them up..!!
text:
Nothing fancy just straight forward fun! This basketball set is ideal for a bathtub with a toddler Who can't sit still long enough to wash/rinse hair.. this allows a distraction to get the body and hair wash done..

Suction cups to tile nicely and has tabs to quick release when done.. prefilled balls are small enough for toddler hands to grab hold of- nothing is too big or cumbersome. At $8- you shouldn't pay more.. this is not fancy or long-term, just a need in the moment for a fun tub time till they grow into the next phase! This set should do just that for you..

Could make a fun extra gift, stocking stuffer or welcomed surprise.. it's a win-win for you and them! could be a great item paired with bath towel or shampoos and body wash- Regardless of what some may think.. this is most definitely unisex and fun for girls/boys alike. Hoping info can help make your decision- stay safe everyone!

title: Has some perks.. and quirks!! Fun if you're sensible!
text:
Our 2nd summer river rafting as a crew.. and we grew by 3 new comers! Ordering extra river tubes, I appreciated the $30- price point.. However, we found this tube has limitations to be aware of-

Size of tube is smaller then other “adult” versions. Those 4” DO make a difference. Best for teens or smaller adults.. our 6'5” 190lb son couldn't use this at all!!! But, our 5'11” 190lb. struggled as well.. just to give perspective. I used- 5'2” 148lb.. I fit fine!

Tube has climb rope- but, not made to support the full weight of user.. neither is pillow! These can actually separate and rip a hole at the seam where rope or pillow attach.. if tossed off tube, try to gain lift by a secondary option and not just the rope alone. Rope does hold nicely if used to tether other tubes together.. we had 6 total and it did fine.

Cup holder is adequate width but not very deep! 20 ounce twist top was vulnerable to falling out so we had to wedge it in to stay put!

Made for natural water.. this is best used without rapids, rocks or tree debris!! All river tubes are vulnerable to sharp objects- however, we ended with a fatal “PoP” in this on the last bend.. Other riders using Sunlight Sport “American River Blazer” brand.. hit same large smooth boulder jetting out of surface and pushed off- this tube met its fate on the impact.. So, yesss!! differences in tube strength matter- this seems to has less vs. more.. Note: we did have rip in pillow seam but it's not connected to main air bladder- helpful if it stayed afloat less the headrest.. but, we managed to blow this out x2!

Overall, sized appropriately and not strained.. this can float in lake or calm river. Anyplace else, it has a higher risk of leaving you up a creek without a paddle… Or should I say tube ha ha!! Things to consider when making your decision- hoping they can help.. stay safe everyone!

title: Great little gadget play.. nothing but fun at our house!!!
text:
From a layman's point of view.. aka, a mom! I found these for my 18yr old son who's always playing with everything.. whether it be pen lid or drink top, any little item he gets his hands on! He CAN sit still when his hands are busy!! So, I tend to set a gadget or two on our TV coffee table.. these are a perfect addition and actually a lot of fun for any who sit beside them!!

I do LOVE there is no right/wrong way to play.. they're not a mind puzzle to frustrate or figure out! They can be just a monotonous methodical motion or clever creating action of activity- they're unique from the overplayed (obnoxious!) fidget spinner, the classic Rubiks cube or, clanking of newtons cradle! Tbh, i've never seen anything quite like it… Not in the size anyway. Made for adult hand and play- they're fun in a household of teens/twenty yr olds..

At $15- these make a fun gizmo or gadget to play with.. could be a fun stocking stuffer or b-day gift! Great for any who love science/physics.. as there's a lot of it going on with this set! We love just for the fun of it… and that's exactly what they provide!! Hoping info can help make your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Does what it should.. bring attention to user!!
text:
“Like a rhinestone cowboy… Oops cowgirl!” This is every bit the part- made for dress up or party.. Made of costume quality, all over sequins are nicely fastened- and although we lost a few by nights end
..it may have been caused by activity we put it through!

Battery will come in place- you just flip the switch. Hat will do exactly as you intended.. and that's bring all the attention to the guest of honor- She will feel like the queen in a cowboy tiara!! Lights glow neon bright..and add such a fun flare. Turning on/off beginning at dinner lights kept up the entire time.. we even kept these going into wee hours of the morning.. we had no glitches or outages.

A bit pricey for a costume accessory- you're paying for the uniqueness and wow factor!! Photo online shows adult model- but didn't find this is sized quite that big.. more in line with jr. sizing? With clever ponytail or hair clip- this could fit a younger or smaller size head for sure.

Overall, it did the part and made the recipient feel special.. with battery life left- it could easily be passed on or worn for another event! Hoping info can help make your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Perfect to stand out/feel special.. and gets free drinks!!
text:
Total home run.. perfect to make your birthday girl feel important and like the queen! TBH… When else can you wear a tiara all day long without question-
Our recipient put this on in morning and wore it till closing down the bar- i'd recommend gifting it in the same fashion.. that way they full use for a full 24 hrs. is possible!! *Hack: our user saved and as roommates hit their big milestone… they're going to do a passing of the crown! On back side of sash- they're signing their names.. a great memory to keep for years to come!

Crown is NOT childlike plastic.. it have metal build out and although not biggest- this can be tweaked to fit on most heads/hairstyles. Crown saw its fair share of rowdy and is fully intact.. so, not overly dainty/delicate which is nice. Let's face it- 21st bday is not most subdued! Total bonus: wearing to bar let bday girl be recipient of free drinks all night long- patrons had fun making her a mini celebrity!!

Overall, perfect purchase for $13 price… Couldn't have asked for more. Would recommend on any level of need. Hoping info can help make your decision- happy birthday and stay safe everyone!

title: Wonderful item… But best for 3yr. and older!!
text:
A fun set filled with handful of smaller pieces. One can make a creation.. or pretend “fix” things! This is best for 3yr. as tiny pieces = a choking hazard. But mostly bc it takes a solid, steady, coordinated hand to align the driver blade.. into screw slat!! I do wish this was made “kid friendly” with a deeper or even hidden magnetic pull. Something for littles to have more success without becoming frustrated- ours grasps the concept just not able to keep it aligned to turn.. I also wish it had a few more tools- even duplicates so it could be shared with siblings or a play date… this provides x1 wrench, x1 screwdriver.

Matted colors are very universal and solid wood is a value at an $18 price point.. Edges are finished and smooth- no snags or splinters. Little wooden box is nice but would be ideal to have some sort of lid of flip top to contain.. help to keep pieces together better! (just wishful thinking from my mom!)

For any of those not capable enough to create something out of nothing- the toy can fall a little flat.. But, if redirected to help “fix things..” a child can busy themselves for quite a while walking around with a screwdriver to put into cupboard cracks or vent slats.. this is how ours has found success until he can grow into the coordination needed.

Aged appropriately this would be a nice gift for either boy/girl.. it can stimulate fine motor skills and a lot of creativity. Hoping this info can help make your decision- stay safe everyone!

title: Fun pretend play.. quality mixed with a few cheap pieces!
text:
Love this idea.. crazy as it sounds it's a great way to introduce being a little helper and cognizant of the messes that must be cleaned up! Our little guy loves to mimic whatever we do.. and it includes cleaning! He follows behind with his broom, mop of feather duster.. Oh, and his spray bottle! (Yes, it actually sprays but the little hands have minimal skill to make much of a spritz!) These were the hit items for us.. I've included up close photos showing details so you can see their overall integrity.

The broom, mop, duster, spray bottle, dust pan and carrier… all are quite decent and what you'd expect for a solid toy.

The cloth, sponges + product bottles with lids that detach.. are sweet but not so much made of quality and the squeegee is pretty useless bc it's so thin and bendable. “Chore chart” and stickers were no use.. it came rolled up where most stickers pulled off the protective sheet- doesn't affect the toys but in case it matters.

Overall.. a fun concept for pretend play and sized appropriately. Nothing too big, bulky- or heavy! A little pricey for a few items not of solid quality.. Made to be enjoyed by boys/girls alike- could make a small gift.. addition to a playroom.. or preschool. Hoping this info helps make your decision- stay safe everyone!

title: Great for college roommates who don't know each other!
text:
Ordered for my daughter spending her summer involved in an internship program with a group of students she hasn't met.. Only the fact she is both living and working side-by-side with this new faces.. created an awkward 24/7 togetherness!! A far easier situation to navigate once they've had a chance getting to know each other!

Spill the tea was a very fun, safe and successful way to create conversation.. only it's perfect that it's done in a way to involve everyone and didn't leave one person interrogating another- it sort of gives “permission” or the ok to ask all sorts of things to find out about personality etc. yet questions stay very appropriate.

Categorized as a game- is a bit of a stretch! It's not about strategy or winning/losing.. and definitely more about getting to know the players you are with.. A perfect opportunity in her situation!

After playing for a weekend.. 2 nights in a row- I'm told the efforts paid off! In fact, the stack of questions that didn't get asked were set out on the table and have been used to keep the process going during meals together!! A card presented as a “table topic” where each one takes a turn answering that same question… how perfect is that?! I love the fact they felt safe enough and also as if this game was truly a positive and getting to know each other… They decided to continue on their own- Definitely speaks to the validity of what you can learn about others. I would recommend as a solid ice breaker tool- and note: One can alter the playing rules and expectations however it fits their needs. Hoping this info can help make your decision.. stay safe everyone!

title: Perfect for beginner cognitive thinking..
text:
A great way for toddlers to grow and develop their cognitive learning.. (ideal for 18mo. and older) very creative way to introduce concepts by using fun and creativity. Designed to get a child's attention and peek their interest..

Pictures of brightly colored cartoon objects found on the farm are used- different animals, people, machinery, etc.. Cards are cut in half some vertical, some horizontal and adhered to a sturdy cardboard to keep from bend/creasing. (i included photos to show the actual width-)

BEST part of all..these are simple and straight edge connections!! NO notched puzzle edges to figure out and frustrate little beginners.. this is focused on visual recognition and stimulating thinking by finding a match and putting together successfully! No worries- kids will have plenty of time to move up the puzzle chain as they develop those skills.. This particular game offers younger ones exposure to something that is at their level- not always easy to find items for the beginning steps of learning.

Would be a great addition to any home, preschool, daycare etc. would even make a great gift for a child. Comes in a flip top storage box to stack in a game cupboard. A solid find at $9.99- Hoping this info. can help make your decision.. stay safe everyone!

title: A plethora of purposes for fun..!!
text:
Ordered the smaller set to pull off the perfect prank! These stepped up in a big way and we're a total success… Our daughter lives in college dorms and every end of year.. kids are tasked with the annual “Staff against Students” prank week..!!! So why not float some ducks in the featured campus fountain?! Totally harmless and to be enjoyed by all who pass by ha-ha…!! These were a big hit- and even photographed for school newspaper- mission accomplished!!!

Ducks are small enough to swim in a small water fountain, pond, tub or pool and yet they're large enough not to enter the filtration system.. The fact these ducks are made with a variety of hats or hobbIes just added to the fun as something for everyone- even a few college majors! chef, artist, librarian, policeman, nerd, nurse, construction, beauty queen, surfer.. even a graduation cap duck!! Out of the 25- we had x3 doubles.. this wasn't a problem for our need but to some it may matter. (to be clear= 22 originals- 3 duplicates.)

Do note: we did NOT receive the ducks shown in photos- Ad shows ducks made in every color.. only we got 25 YELLOW DUCKS- the only color variation was in their built in themed accessory or hat! This worked for our purpose but, if expecting various colors you may not receive that..?!

Detail of each ducks features and accessories are there.. ie, ducks eye or beak- sunglasses, decretive hats, etc- colors cross out on the lines- it isn't sloppy but something expected with rubber toys like this.. the slight imperfections are definitely manageable. For $20 you get 25 ducks- definitely a better deal to spend $7 more and get 50 ducks for sure!

These could be used for childs birthday, carnival, float in fishbowl margaritas, bathtub, pool.. what ever the need- keep in mind these do have a plug in bottom to keep air filled shape.. and water can infiltrate if compressed which can lead to mold overtime! Bc of this they're great for short term use and then discarded- hoping this info can help make your decision.. stay safe everyone!

title: Fun option for all stages, phases and ages..!!
text:
Imagination in a box! If you can think it.. have fun trying to create it!! A real set that truly grows with your little one from ages 1-2yrs. and up.. With the integrity of built to last pieces- this will be around for your child to play until they grow out it.. I love that!! Expect smooth edge pieces with seamless connections and magnets inclosed + secure behind the scenes! LOVING the clip bucket “tool box” with carry handle- not too heavy/bulky so even a small child can carry. Case is made of high quality acrylic to hold and protect all the pieces inside.

Loving this spans age gaps if there's a discrepancy at a play date or when its used amongst siblings.. the ability to create at any level and not affect one another is huge.. Ha! Very few toys can claim that!! As for size of set- I suggest to go big! A bigger set lets multiple peep enjoy at once without running out of pieces for master creations! Note: its also possible grow the collection as needed all just by adding a set- no worry, these will blend seamlessly.

What to expect: set includes sticks, balls + bends.. I'd LOVE to see company expand options + provide additions of other fun, simple shapes! These are a cross between building blocks and Legos.. unlike blocks they hold together.. and unlike legos, they easily separate! Simple to connect.. if you have a negative end the piece will practically flip itself to a positive connection- It's like magic..!!! Perfect for littles who are learning as they grow. A great way to enhance imagination and dexterity. **Lastly, set is an awesome tool for learning math. From simple basics of counting to grouping.. adding/subtraction even fractions!! Who knew!!? A great gift idea or even a fun addition to classroom or dr. office- easy to wipe down and clean.. a win/win for many phases, stages and ages! Hoping this info can help make your decision.. stay safe everyone.

title: Great ADULT pool toys… both, size and style!!
text:
It's true, adults get excited about summer too… we even love to relax on a pool float! But the struggle is real- most adult options are standard boring “mats!” These can be cumbersome taking up much water surface from others.. Or, you find the float to be sized far too small OR, worst of all- gimmicky!! I don't care what you say.. straddling a dinosaur and holding on for dear life getting chaffed by plastic arms is not relaxing comfort!!! FindUWill has made a set that is the Cinderella trifecta of adult floats…

1. Sized adequately for actual adults- this has a netted center so, cheeks aren't popping out the bottom nor, is the saucer taking on water readying to capsize! The interior net helps you ride nicely in the circle while allowing water to breach which helps to keep you cool.

2. Working handles help and hold.. hallelujah!! 1/2 the battle can be “mounting” your float! These provide 2 built-in sturdy plastic handles to give the user solid confidence.. they help you get in/out and situated. But they also provide ability to connect floats together. If used at a lake, this is a huge bonus and allows users to create the floating island effect!

3. Drink holder: need I say more! This is placed on x1 side and is situated where it's easy to reach.. it's sized for a soda can width- or any water bottle of the same measurement. Fit is snug to keep it from spilling or falling out.

A perfect adult option that kids can enjoy just the same.. It's well thought out, user friendly and for a plastic blow up toy.. quite structurally sound! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend. Hoping this info can help make your decision- stay safe everyone!

title: Nostalgia at its finest… Ideal for a little kids!
text:
With a 2yr old wanting his turn on a PS4- only it's against “teen code” in our house- We can set this up next to it.. and watch the cousins play away!! It's been fun seeing all nostalgic options pop up..
A TOTAL THROW BACK TO THE 80's… I LOVE IT!! Tbh, older kids are in awe we played with such archaic amenities- Ohh well.. their loss! Those from the “greater” generation will truly appreciate!

Battery life was subpar for us. Stating 4hrs. when fully charged.. we only got 1x. BUT, bc this can be used while connected to an outlet or battery boost, we're still happy! *Note: blue option only offers x1 controller and I missed that! Would be nice to have for x2 player option- only I haven't found add-on for just single controller yet. *IF you NEED 2 player- Order upgrade with original purchase.. or you may not get option!! Size is smaller and easy for little hands to manage- aesthetically adorable on the shelf!

We set up indoor tent and connected this for our little guy- he was smitten! Screen has a surprisingly nice picture and did best in darker lighting. I'm grateful if “wrong” button is pushed, it's harmless. Simpleness allows independence for child and peace of mind for you! Although we haven't connected to tv.. not sure we will!? All cords and instructions are straightforward and included. As a mom without tech skills- I'm confident I could manage connections.. **just keep instruction book- it will help walk you through steps when needed.

Favorite features: x1 is mute and all my praises for it!! x2 is the “wake-up” achieved by hitting on the side- it brings/wakes up features! (how cute is that?! Just like knocking an old tv set for better picture- ha!!) For the price point $30+ this is a lot of fun. For those who need to trick a toddler, this does the trick! Any wanting nostalgia- you'll get it. “In car option” for road trips is also perf. with no wifi needed- *just bring the charge cord and system will keep up as long as they do.. a solid that won't break the bank and can be enjoyed by many- hoping info can help your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: sweetest things ever seen.. as adult, I'm in love!!
text:
ABSOLUTELY ADORABLE.. a perfect little learn and grow set of fruit + veggies. One can learn far more then just to become the pretend master chef! Everything about these are so much fun- the colors are bright and details have not been overlooked… One can easily teach little ones how to identify different foods as details are really impressive. I've included photos of the interior favorites we have!!

But the learning doesn't stop there- as I mentioned bright primary colors.. we began pointing out to our 20mo old- “red tomato” or “yellow lemon” and so on.. although not able to repeat the words quite yet- If you ask for a green, purple, etc.. he now will hand those specific colors to you! Ha- learning without even trying.. Great for making groups of colors, patterns to follow or counting numbers by objects or pieces- I am absolutely impressed and loving this set on every level!

These come with a play knife to pretend cut apart- an action to help practice dexterity and even a small cutting board to perform this on! Items come contained in plastic fruit basket.. I do wish this had a lid to keep all pieces secure- but unfortunately this is an open top.. A downfall for me! Set includes a few replacement Velcro dots in a bag- Perfect for parents to hold onto in case a dot pulls away..

Why 4 star? Only reason is bc 90% of these have all the extra detail and merit- and a few although they do not fall short but, they lack the same type of attention as others.. possibly to keep cost down? I mentioned just in case this matters. I don't hesitate to recommend, at $26 price- one will definitely get use out of these in so many ways. Would make a great gift pretty little one boy/girl! Hoping this info helps your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Multi skill builder.. it's perfect!!
text:
Bright and whimsical multi learning tool flower pot that's disguised as a toy! This helps develop and teach a variety of developmental and intellectual skills which progress to a degree as the child grows! Purchased for an 18mo. old.. its a solid age for him to grow use now and grow with. (best for littles at least 12mo+)

For starters this helps with dexterity and hand/eye coordination- Toddler seems to love pulling the flowers and replacing them in his own.. loving this has a soft magnetic pull to help guide placement successfully until skill is mastered. Notice photos I included- flowers can be plucked and stored in bucket by removal of dome dirt lid.. trust me, our little does this over and over and over and…!! We begin elevating by removing flowers in certain order as he tries to mimic. *Count aloud when doing this and you're adding another skill set.. told you- the learning options are endless!

As ones cognitive learning is developing this offers up bright primary hues that will be an added resource in teaching colors.. As I pluck flowers from basket- I'm usually stating its color out loud- or counting off #'s of flower I have picked. It's true.. we know toddlers have keen audio processing skills beginning to take place- this toy helps reinforce that.

flower tops are printed with a # (1-5.. and x1 is a bumble bee, total x6 flowers or.. x12 pieces if you pop flower off stem!!) you can use as they grow to learn counting themselves and written recognition. Even small mathematical equations can take place.

See.. for $14- this flower basket offers quite a bit! It's also ideal decor if left sitting out on the shelf.. it will brighten any space or place! Hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: You cant go wrong- easiest adulting ever..!!
text:
A hybrid of sorts- as its a cross between a board game and social activity! It looks like a game, you sit to play it like a game.. yet, it's NOT a game! There's no competitive edge, rules to follow, no winners vs. losers or, right/wrong answers.. Nope! No chugging a beer at the end of your turn!

This is a box of organized conversation!! Everyone gets a turn without one person dominating the chatter.. this will pull in the shy and quiet in the group- as it leaves no one out! Game is a bit eye opening thought provoking, self reflecting, laugh making, memory reflecting, ice breaking and scruple sharing. A creative way to spark organic conversations from a question stemming on a card. Nothing too racy, personal, awkward or vulnerable- just a fun way to get acquainted and understood by those you play with.

Could be played with teens.. but, more inline for adults. A solid option for office activity, newlyweds, family dinners.. vacations, neighborhood game night (ha!) even dating! I sent with my daughter in college and x4 new roommates- it just provides a solid way for ALL to get to know each other and get the chatter started!

In léui of rules this has more like “guidelines” which adapt and fit to whatever your need. At dinnertime we'd asked x1 question each.. and everyone takes a turn answering. (Yes! We got in plenty of use prior to sending it off to the dorm!!) This is a great date night activity.. a card between couples before bed, neighborhood bbq's.. there's no way you can't make it work for you.. No wrong way to play- you can make rule to answer for another player at table- take turn to all answer same question x1 at a time.. impose x30 sec. response to shorten game.

X400 cards in x3 categories: icebreak, deep, deeper. Category is printed in bottom card corner- but, why make all look the same? Maybe use a different color.. anything to help identify!? Also wish this had expansion packs- how great to have specific decks.. social justice, travel/vacation, holidays, childhood, families etc. An option to refresh after played x1 too many rounds- seller take note!

At a $20 price point- this is a solid deal for the endless amount of fun to be had. Even though game board isn't needed- I appreciate the deck come in a game box.. easy to store in game cupboard with other games/entertainment. *note: this is available for friends, couples and adult version- yet, friend can't be used for ANY type relationship.. very universal. Sorry so long-winded I wanted to explain all aspects for those unfamiliar.. Hoping this info can help you all- stay safe!

title: Feels light but, delivers in spades!!!
text:
Such a clever idea!!! The perfect gadget for a little one learning to speak.. and I'm so impressed with its ability to do so as easy as sliding in a “coded” card. Toddlers love to press buttons with electronic responses.. ours was smitten from flipping the on switch! IF, child lacks dexterity to put card into thin slot- parent can do this part and let little push buttons.. just till they master the task- so it doesn't damage cards.

I'll admit- Reading device feels light, almost hollow… Causing initial concern to its integrity along with the fact- it's quite small in size. But, once in play, I was beyond impressed.. this surpassed all expectations! With included USB cord one plugs into power until gaining a full charge which for us outlasts a toddlers attention span.. we've used x2-3 before recharging- LED will indicate when charge is complete.

Over 200 color coded cards gives options such as: colors, shapes, animals, people, nouns, etc.. One can select a color and run thru cards in that genré or, one can shuffle deck for sporadic mix of words. One can even make up stories by picking specific cards to go along with storyline or imagination.. The options are endless and all yours!!

Volume is regular speaking tone- nothing too loud. The device will speak a few extras when staring or trading cards.. so, a few added perks like to discover.
The one place for improvement would be on any specific card- if it read the printed name and then, common versions of the card as well. ie. Card reads MOTHER… I'd like it to say- mom, mommy, mama.. just so child could hear and relate the specific word used in your household! It would help make a few of these cards more identifiable.. **I'd love to see add-on packs of cards available to purchase as well so, seller take note!

At a $22- Price point this is universal and unisex… Something to help any little one learning to speak, spell or read. Could be an incredible asset with bilingual learning! Hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Gives a child their “own space..!!”
text:
Such a great way to let little ones grow and use their imagination.. and who doesn't love a fort?! Personal space provides space for a child to do things independently, in their domain.. “their fort-their rules!” Ha!! Not to mention.. giving as a bday gift solidifies my title of “the best aunt ever!!”

Assembly is easy and straightforward- pole comes in half length to make for a smaller footprint when stored. You will 1st attach poles to create the full size- then, slide each pole into premade gutter and tie off poles. Use ballast to secure any movement- and teepee away!! Used by indigenous who were brilliant and perfected the art of a nomadic lifestyle.. this benefits you with this design.. easy to set up, change locations or store- it's too perfect! (think umbrella closure when not in use and propped into a corner.. all so easy.)

Material is a softer midweight fabric covered in unicorn print with a feminine color scheme. I love it still includes cut out windows along with a tie back door.. this creates good sight lines into interior space which is helpful to keep eyes on a toddler inside. *I purchased small rechargeable “night light-sound machine” to create interior lighting and ambience! With nature sounds: birds, cricket, water, wind, stream.. its just perfect! Soft light allows for reading and eliminates any fear of the dark..

TAKE NOTE: photos on webpage show a matching floormat.. this is NOT included!! I improvised with a 4'4” 360° round shag rug in similar colors to help define space and add creature comfort- (in hind sight- it would have been better in square vs. round shape rug.. but, either can suffice and fulfill the need. Fake fur keeps with the theme!)

ALSO NOTE: online description mentions storage bag included- ours did NOT!! Not a dealbreaker but you will want to find a storage solution so this can be kept in its entirety and used for years to come. Hoping this helps your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Keeps a child so engaged.. perfect!!
text:
Hands down the sweetest, most clever and well thought out of all pretend kitchen/house playware sets Ive seen.. EvEr!! So much packed into a smaller size footprint- this will engage your tot on so many levels..

Bc of size, it's perfect for any with minimal space such as an apartment, playroom, placed in a childs bedroom in a corner! Not too deep to protrude into ones living space.. And the lower height is ideal for younger/shorter littles- they can easily reach almost if not every level. Note: placed on raised sturdy platform- this set can be enjoyed as a little one grows taller.. making it perfect for years to come!!

Perks are plenty! Truly not a single ounce of space is wasted. Knobs spin 360° and click-click as they do! AAA batteries add light to specified spots (oven hood, range, microwave) simulated cooking sounds at a push of a button.. Details are to die for! Tiny doors with peep windows- all impressive. Matted colors are unisex, combo of included options keeps child rotating thru each little niché- while holding interest.

Add-ons are welcome! Our velcro/wooden food set is ideal with this..cook, wash in the sink, nuke, oven bake! HACK: A few wash clothes makes the perfect laundry. Easy for littles to place in/out of dryer and even learn to fold. Love recycle feature- Teaching kids but, enjoy sliding items into slots.. kids just love little quirks like this!

As for the build: tricky! LOTS of detail connections to do! READ step by step- you'll thank me later! Far easier with a buddy x1 holds in place- x1 is the tool wizard! Doing so allows a more solidified and tight connection- plus, it cuts building time in half!!

At $99- this is worth the build for hours and years of pretend play to come. Just as precious as photos show- perfect gift idea. Hands down I recommend! Hoping info can help your decision- Bon appétit!!
**note battery NOT included- you'll need x6 AAA.

Update: after playing with this for a few weeks we realize- our fan isn't working- and never has!!? TBH, I thought it was a dead switch for fun- but clearly it should make a simulated fan noise. I'm not going to return because of the tedious build being complete. Something you should check prior to building- put a battery in all accessories to make certain items function prior to the build if needing to be replaced!! PS our little one still loves this :)

title: Bigger then expected- difficult to learn!
text:
Having a teen who likes to expel excess energy by goofing around with his standard style yo-yo.. I knew when he saw this online.. it would make a great stocking stuffer and challenge. I LOVE to promote any activity that gives one a break from screen time..!! This teaches much more then a trick using talent- it promotes focus, patience and dare I say practiced discipline!? A win/win for me..

Ordered in the larger size I was mistaken by actual measurements given- and for any who may not know.. take note: the sizes printed are just for the cups itself.. So, this was surprisingly bigger than anything I had anticipated!! Length is 18” in the sticks alone.. along with length of the yo-yo itself. ** see photos included for actual size idea..

Cup portion is made of a hollowed plastic and does appear durable- however, the sticks may be a different story! Thinner and in the longer length- makes these more vulnerable to breaking.. i'm certain there's a purpose for the lightweight material being used in construction- my guess it's necessary to perform the actual tricks?! One should just be careful to have plenty of clearance from hard objects when learning/practicing.. hitting into a solid item could potentially cause these to break! Definitely an item for older kids/adults.. Otherwise these may be a bit too fragile!! Priced at $35- it does seem a bit excessive for the actual materials used.. however, if enjoyed- it may end up $ well spent.

Not an easy feat to begin learning how to use- I suggest googling a few videos.. we found this is the easiest place to start and helped far more than any written instruction!! Be prepared to use patience and practice with this skill- but, I think I mentioned that already..!! hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe.

title: Great for those who fidget!!
text:
With an 18-year-old who is a constant movement of energy.. this was a past time for him growing up! Nothing like resurrecting his skills during pandemic but, he found elementary yo-yos quite tangled..!!! With his forgotten enjoyment of this toy- I set out to find an option that was solid but, wouldn't break the bank.. and the MAGIC V6 did the trick.

This is a beginner level and for one who plays for fun.. there's an appreciation for the responsive return! I recommend this for any who aren't patient or skilled enough quite yet, get a responsive yo-yo first… At least util you mastered your skills!! Mine likes the weight bc of the counter pressure it creates.. it makes for a longer hang time.. which is a plus when you're not super skilled in the art! For something that will be visited short term- $14 is a respectable price point for a “professional yo-yo!” Trust me these things can get pretty pricey..?!!

Overall this is a great place to start for anyone wanting to take their skills past a fun toy level. Hoping this info can help your decision.. stay safe!

title: Welcome to erasable art 101.. and fun!!
text:
A great idea for young ones who are not iPad or cell phone worthy just yet! This is a fun for “real” alternative.. (ha! bc it uses power!) However, I do wish there was a more substantial casing.. to feel a bit more “official” and to protect pad better. Ha.. I'm telling you if they did try to emulate the feel of an iPad a bit more- kids would be fooled a lot longer!!

A tad confusing and we're still unsure when the pad is turned on/off..??!! There is NO light to show otherwise- this wouldn't bother so much if it didn't suck the life out of and waste batteries. As for now, before putting away the only way to ensure shut down: we must scribble on pad and see if it will “erase” and if so, IT IS ON..!! If not, it's off and good to put it away.

This is perfect for car rides, traveling, office waiting rooms, rainy days, Saturdays, etc.. I love it focuses on creativity and helps a child utilize their own imagination. This can be A fun way to practice spelling words.. there truly is no limit! At a price point under $15- this makes for a clever gift and one that would be greatly received. Hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe.

title: Perfect for littles in a transition phase…
text:
Perfect item for toddlers who are stuck in that quirky place.. between infant toys not peaking or holding their interest yet, toddler toys are a bit cognitively too hard!! At 18mo. This is the perfect size being its lower profile.. for a little to play without your help! They can climb on/off and scoot a few feet.. if they tumble or bump off, no worry of injury with adult supervision and used on carpet.

Ours is entertained by anything he can load and unload on his own.. Ohh, and pushable buttons seem just too much for him!! This space blaster delivers in spades.. he'll mount up scoot a few ft. all just to get up and meticulously load in items around the house into the seat! Then, repeat the process stop- and time to unload his haul! Before each scoot.. he moves through a button sequence with the gadgets provided on the dash… he even removes spaceman and puts into the seat- filling up the “under the hood” as well.. This $38 item has provided us our longest entertainment yet at this awkward stage.

Downside components noticed: this does not have a mute button!!! If turned on you get both lights ans sounds- Would love ability without sound when using dash controls- as the sounds get daunting!! I recommend indoor use only and although this can in theory function outdoors.. I find it's not made for outside elements! Concrete rips up plastic tires fast and any water sprinkler, rain, etc will bring it to an early demise..!! (If used outdoors place on grass + bring inside after use!)

A quirky toy for that awkward phase and one I'd recommend.. it's not the element of riding that entertains- but, rather what can be done while maneuvering!! Hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe.

title: Like a game of tag that never ends..!!!
text:
Waiting for those who like gaming and have a competitive spirit! I really admit- this isn't for those who are extra sensitive as, you can “get got” when least expected.. Ha! it's the name of the game!!

I appreciate the challenges are quirky and a bit childish but nothing wildly offensive or out of line.. this could be appropriate if played by a family with teenagers and up- (I say teen for comprehension!) This is great for college kiddo's who may even put their own spin on the game to make it a bit racier or intertwine a drinking element- that's the fun of this (and college!!) it's meant to adapt easily for all players.

One downside to the extended play version (ie. the weekend long Challenge..) is keeping track of all the games moving parts. Each player holds their wallet dossier of challenges in a credit card size fliptop envelope- I won't lie, this can be a bit tricky to collect when game is completed. HACK: If you go for the long game- snap photo of your challenges in your secret wallet with individual cell phones and that way, you leave actual game pieces in the box! You'll have to cross off with a symbol etc.. but, it helps keep game in tact for future play.

A great game to play at a family reunion weekend or holiday, road trip, a day at an amusement park.. perfect for dorm challenges or getting to know you events- I could see this incorporated in a work setting as well.. A lot of options and a lot of fun!! Nothing like you've ever played before… Definitely worth adding to any game covered! Hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe.

title: Children's toys are just sooo amazing!!
text:
How great is this set.. and so clever! Toy's are amazing and evolving, bringing multifaceted uses in both development and fun!! Having a little one who just entered the incredible phase where they begin to mimic your every move- this set is all too perfect! The fact we have a play kitchen with a few pots and pans.. KaeKids cutting food set is the perfect addition to completing our kitchen. I'm just not sure who's more entertained.. the adult or child?!

Fun colors grab a little ones attention and the easy to attach Velcro pieces.. make it possible for even tiny hands to be successful with both, cutting apart and connecting the pieces. Not only does this encourage pretend play.. we love the matching game as well! Separating pieces and let them find the other half that looks the same… Or, imagine play by creating new fruits/veggies by mix and matching! Lots of fun to be had..

As for product/pieces: the various foods feel sturdy and solid. Made of thicker materials so, nothing feels weak or able to crush in on itself. No issue with Velcro lifting or peeling.. so far, all is right and secure.. and set up is great. Including a nice variation different food groups. Basket is nice to help store and included cutting utensils is a bonus! HACK: if wanting more/varied cutlery- add a safe plastic set.. perfect for when more then one little wants to play!

For $25 you get a 70 piece set.. and truly some of the more unique food items I've ever seen in this style! This makes a great option for pretend play.. something a little one will continue to use as they grow. Hoping this info can help your decision.. Bon appétit!

title: Great idea- cheaper and cut corners on quality!!
text:
For a price point of $30 I was expecting a strong durable toddler toy.. and with movable pieces for a child to interact with I was hopeful that it would keep a little one engaged and happily entertained- for as long as one toy can do with little people! The longer list of musical options also gave me promise this wouldnt recycle the same song/sound to drive parents crazy.. (we already have to endure baby shark on the endless loop!!) Well, let's just say this fell short of expectations.

Overall product has much less substance to it structure- I imagine fisher price as the standard in solid/quality.. this is thin, wobbley and due to its height- it does not provide a weighted base to help keep it sturdy and upright when a child is playing with it. Yes! A 1yr. old is a bit more clumsy but then again… It's sold for this age bracket!

As for the concept- it's great in theory. Surprisingly, little ones tire from it quite easily.. after putting ball down the shoot- they have mastered the task- it doesn't provide much variation to hold interest.. I know, it sounds harsh but kids are a tough critic! But also- totally honest!!

Songs and sounds?? If this has the ability to play 30 variations.. Im not hearing it?! Don't expect 30 sing along songs- if a fish has “a recorded one line” it counts as x1 of the 30 variations- I wasn't expecting this. I imagined 30 kid songs to play and sing along too.. not small snippets of chatter or tune lasting 3-10 seconds. Just know- this is what you get! I do appreciate 2 volume settings- speaker is adequate.. its mostly clear so it's not just chaotic noise. But, overall theme for price just feels far cheaper than it should be.

This does what it shows online.. it sends balls thru a sensor to trip a recorded “blurb” as the ball rolls to the bottom- child picks up and repeats action again.. over/over. If this is something you're after, this may be for you. Easy assembly- it does have a strong presentable box thats nice if gifting!? Just doesn't work for us and expectations.. I wanted solid quality, engaging and cognitively stimulating with sing along ability. What arrives is a lesser and different version of this. Hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe!

title: Can be used for younger age- it's frustration free..!!
text:
Far smaller than I was expecting- it still holds merit and cuts out a lot of frustration for a little one.. while creating plenty of fun to entertain. (see photos comparing size above!) The smaller size box does have its perks.. ie. it fits on child's lap easy enough- and smaller size allows for easy travel or take along toy when needed.

I actually went looking for a “shape box” that used only one simple shape bc, mine would become so flustered with the more difficult pieces on a different sorting box we had..!! Instead I found this- and it works! This is made for any age to enjoy with success with the much easier concept. So, I appreciate the versatility- something I didn't realize I would need with 17mo. old at the time.

Box is designed with “double bands” on 2 sides, and “single bands” on the other 2. So, it can provide a difficulty level if wanting to challenge a childs cognitive thinking to sliding the shapes through. This box being simpler still provides options.

Not sure why? About 50% of these shapes are a strong plastic and the other 50% are very thin and flimsy. So, it does give concern how long those cheaper objects will last before crushed or obsolete!? The one upside with this- you could replace objects to use within this sorting box to practically anything if desired. In fact, our box has extra pieces in it already! I find a lot of “kitchen food” from a different set end up inside this box!!?*But, I mention just so you are aware- For price of toy at $20- it would be nice if 100% of object were at top caliber.

Overall.. a great concept. It has more versatility and because of the stretchable/universal design it is a toy that can be utilized a lot longer. This can definitely start younger and grow with a child while using it for different learning skills! Hoping this info can help your decision.. stay safe.

title: Good in theory.. but, falls short entertaining!!
text:
Great in size, stability and theory.. this has a solid idea going for it- Problem is, it falls way flat in the sheer lack of components made to entertain! It's not that anything is wrong with what's included.. it just lacks so much possible activity which could've made this so right.. It lacks what is needed to hold a little ones attention and keep them engaged!!

This is 3 larger double sided page/boards that barely have x1 minuscule activity per side which doesnt add up- bc, Fisher Price is usually spot on with their target audience! Ex. if you see my photos above: x1 entire board (16x20) is designated to a sliding car that moves 1” side to side.. another has a small vent that slides up/down 1”…?? I included photo with cute animal shape in cut out window.. but, it does nothing!!? You see- many opportunities missed!

Plus side, bright colors attract attention, whimsical sounds can be started by a button- (it just has to be pushed repeatedly to continue) Our 16mo. old quickly bounces around each board looking for any fun to grab his attention.. besides the 3 block fit in shapes.. he's done within minutes. At a $40 price point, I am afraid this misses the mark.

Where I see this best suited is for the infant trying to go mobile.. crawling or standing- this can help support or draw them in! Otherwise, i'm not sure it will live up to expectations. Note: This can fold and store within itself to a smaller footprint- that's always a plus! Hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe.

title: Fun dorm accessory.. creates fun for all!
text:
Ordered for nephew heading off to freshman dorms and I figured… Where there is a hoop- kids will shoot. I wasn't wrong!!

Placed on the back of his freshman dormitory door- I am told during study breaks it is flipped around.. and from the hallway dorm mates and passer by's can try their hand at a jump-shot.. *disclaimer: I'm told this is a great way to meet girls- it's an excuse to strike up a conversation and challenge them to a shot… WOW!! Is it worth it or what.. Need I say more!!?

The backboard itself feels quite sturdy for a replica toy and the finished metal framed edge gives it a more official look. I appreciate the breakaway rim.. however, this won't last a lifetime (I'm hoping a solid year of dorm life!) The trick is with the breakaway basket- knock it down but, do not hang, grab onto or pull with any force.. (remember it's pretend!) as for the score board.. ehh! It should record shots but not accurate- I don't think it's a dealbreaker since it doesn't take away from the fundamentals. I love this includes 2 miniature balls and a pump.. taking only minutes to fill.

Easy assembly- connect the netting with basket on front.. and if using over the door hook- then Boom! You're ready to go.. **HACK: using a zip tie or paper clip- one can easily close bottom of net and shoot for accuracy.. keeps ball from bouncing off everywhere! Also a great way to store ball so out of way and easy to find.
Great gift idea- better put together then other versions both physically and aesthetically.. it will probably be longer too! Hoping this can help your decision- batter up! (Ha!)

title: Solid set of smaller sized balls- great in ball pit!!
text:
Made with intentions to fill a ball pit.. these will do just that! I added this group to our set and from photos above, you can see the actual balls come in 2 sizes- note: these are the smaller of the two in size (fill up less space but, easy for small hands to grab and hold onto.) Some balls are a bit plumper then others- (again, see photo's) Made of thinner outside plastic shell- none of the balls arrived crushed or damaged. I assume variations in fill are to be expected with compressed/captured air.. not all amounts will be 100% exact. Also with ball having the slight bit of compression it helps create a softer landing for little ones.. this fill ratio is what allows them to jump, fall and play in the ball pit without meeting a firm, hard plastic landing.. like tiny “air pillows!”

Using daily for almost x1 month we haven't had a single ball crushed beneath the weight of kids.. I think with # of balls in play it helps disperse the direct pressure that would cause a collapse.

Ball pit we use is 360° X 36” X 11” height. *Take note: #100 balls won't even begin to fill the pit in any real capacity- and we actually have a smaller ball pit! Emptied into container above- these #100 cover approx. 85% of bottom/single layer. If you're truly wanting to create the ball pit affect.. I suggest investing in a set of #300. (Good rule of thumb is #100 balls = 1sq. ft. of ball pit space. So, for our 36”/3' pit.. we need #300+ balls. Doing this fills our container 50% and its perfect. It gives kiddos room to bury, play and still keep balls contained.)

Easy to clean- these can be emptied into bathtub, rinsed and left to drip dry… These also stand up to a good Lysol spritz- to give parents peace of mind.

If you're looking for quantity of balls to fill a ball pit- these are a solid option. $20 balls for #100.. these come in a zipper carry bag for easy storage. Hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe.

title: Met with mixed reviews.. we LOVE it- Ours uses daily!!
text:
Perfect for imaginative play… I love the idea of the intricate practiced skill in cut/slicing these in half or even pull and peeling!!

Having a smaller set similar a few decades ago (velcro slicing fruits) these seem to lack the heftier substance in the plastic body compared to the older version… these almost feel a bit hollow? But, still being a hard plastic exterior they'll maintain shape 100%. TBH, this is something I'm writing off to the world being more plastic conscious- if shape is maintained using less plastic.. then why not?!!

These have been met with mixed reviews and I find it unfortunate. Personally, our set was totally on point!! No loose velcro tabs- It is odd you apply all velcro tabs yourself to vinyl activity chart- (i'm guessing to keep costs down in production down?) **NOTE: If any velcro feels loose- one can place a dot of permanent glue to assure adhesion..

Colors vivid and bright, eye catching.. and there are lots of them! It's a great mix for our 18mo. old who loves fill a pot + stir the pieces! He loves the ability to pull pieces apart with his hands.. it must feel victorious (too young for activity chart as of yet- we set it aside..) I'm working now as we just clump together colors on her own- Counting as we go.. their brains absorb so much, this is a great way to learn colors, #'s, shapes, names of items etc..

Bottom line this has exceeded my expectations- I'd recommend for your own child or as a gift.. I find it would be well received and get plenty of mileage. Hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe!

title: Fun idea.. kids get bored really quick!! Noisy motor!
text:
After assembling and being very excited.. I was hoping for creative entertainment- what I ended up with was a bit of a let down…

First, you will need to forgive the noisy motor that is masked with subpar song! From there you're left with 3 dolphins that round a track and albeit entertaining for 1-2 min.. you're quickly brought to that “so what's next” step? While the fish circulate for a moment… One gets out of sorts and they compile into a mess!! In theory, these are to be fished with the hooks- but, it takes a precise hand as there is no “magnetic” connection from hook to fish..!! After a few failed tries… Our little one walked away! Now, anytime turned on- he walks over and just puts all fish in a pile and that's about it.. definitely not the reaction I was hoping for!!

**FYI- small fish (size of a jack) end up in toddlers mouth just like things do- and this is concerning.. so, i do recommend constant supervision.

I have included photos to show hook and mouth and how precise connection it must be- more skill then toddler has is needed.. other photos show track and overall size..

Set up was relatively easy with a few minor connections and an included page of instruction illustrations. This has a USB cord but, it is short!! Definitely will need longer cord or an extension.

Table is very short legged.. if placed over the lap of a child- they bump it with their legs.. knocking it all off track to start over!! *I suggest placing at coffee table height and letting child stand to have free movement.. It's the best success we had.

For $35- this is not what I had hoped for.. it isn't a toy that can engage a 2yr old who's interested in everything!!? A better design and overall idea would be needed to make this child engaging. Of course, varied ages will respond differently- hoping this info can help your decision.. stay safe.

title: Best set ever!! combo'd with “extras” let me explain!!
text:
Ok, this is a 2 in 1 set of sorts and stay with me.. I can clarify! Absolutely a 5 star set and awesome little kitchen simulator! The minimal stove top with its 2 smaller size cooktop options make it easy for littles to move or carry. Ohh, and the battery operated noises are so easy to manipulate- there is no wrong way to use them.. kids will get a sound response every time!

In photos I included- you'll see 5 velcro food items- these are best I've EVER seen in their uniqueness, bright colors and fun details!! These along with the stove top, pots and cooking utensils are the complete set and 100% where ALL the quality is. Worth the $20 price point for sure.. this is all the set really needs..!!

Now, for the remainder of items: food, flatware, plates.. these don't match the other pieces as they're not the same quality. These are a “dollar store, hollow, bendable plastic” that will meet their demise rather quickly! Saying this isn't necessarily a bad thing.. it's as if these are quantity filler pieces that act like an “add-on bonus.” These may extend the playtime or imagination options.. TBH, they are fun extras to have.. just wish they were more substantial to match the rest.

Having said all this.. I'd recommend as this set is one of the better ive seen. This allows your little one to learn color match, size + shape differences and it does wonders for the fine motor skills! Our 13mo. Meticulously puts each item in a pot with a lid on top and carefully separates Velcro, and then matches correctly back together.. you'll be surprised how much they can absorb given the opportunity.. Photo above shows pot handle.. it is The only item one must assemble- otherwise, this is ready to go out of the box right out of the box- just add x3 AA batteries! Sorry so long winded… Hoping this helps in your decision- stay safe!

title: Bigger in size- #50 isn't a lot in theory for ball pit!!
text:
Ordered for 1yr. old in hopes to create a “ball pit” inside a movable in/outdoor vinyl hexagon- The idea is to make a personal ballpot.. Expect #50 balls barely covers if, 1/2 the surface of the bottom of a 36”x11” round collapsible pool! I realize it may sound like a lot but, when you see bag of 50 in play- you'll understand volume issue.

So, before choosing quantity.. know the effect your hoping to get- along with the size of space you're wanting to fill! To make an adequate “ball pit” one needs at least #250-350 balls to fill the space. Using our larger amount still only filled the depth below 1/2 way.. yet, it feels a safe amount with age of our infant.

Surprisingly, these were larger than the original set I had ordered. Mixed sizes actually make a fun variation.. these can still be palmed by the 1yr. old we're trying to entertain- solid enough but, some are translucent held to the light yet, having said that- we've had no issue with balls collapsing in or, puncturing it all!!?

Colors are great mix and bright enough to get and hold babies attention.. they are firm yet, still soft so if tossing around little ones- they won't hurt anybody… and that's always a good thing!

Overall, this is a fun starter set to be used for any need… not Just ball pits! We dumped them into tub with the little guy- and he LOVED it! Plus, it's a great way to wash balls too.. A great gift idea for a birthday for sure. Hoping this info can help your decision.. stay safe!
**photos included show #50 inside pool, bright colors, comparison of #150 balls used, comparable to both size options..

title: Great for weekend fun- play within age groups!
text:
Don't be fooled… The states it's playable for ages 12 and up- that proved a little bit difficult. I'd suggest at least 18yr of age- not for content but, for concept!! (especially in ongoing play mode!)

This is a game that can continue playing over a wknd etc and that proves difficult for younger age also, it's very frustrating when we played with a large age gap- we found college-age could run circles around our younger kids.. to the point of frustration- the worst kind of results in a game setting! However, when younger age played with their peers they seem to enjoy it a lot more… Probably true of any game?! It seemed the younger brains were “out of sight out of mind” when In the continued play mode.. so, they'd hated when they got “assassinated” when not thinking game!!!

Great idea for a weekend getaway or, vacation with a group of friends or couples. We went so far as to have our waiter in on helping an opponent say one of our kill words!! It has potential but, it does need players to focus and pay attention when discussing and going over the rules and how too's of the game.. (trust me, you'll find yourself circling back a few times- seems there's always those few in the crowd!!)

When played with set parameters we did have a lot of fun and found after everyone has been burned a time or two- it brought out the competitive streak in those so, we had to play again.. and again!! Our longest round lasted 71hrs. And it was by far the most wildest of rounds!!! Of course, we were on vacation with the thing group to make that possible.
Overall there is a basic concept and two routes to play… I appreciate the fact that you can easily tweak game rules to your group and do so with success. This would be appreciated for any game enthusiast… A great item for college dorm kids- it's got plenty of merit. Hope this info can help your decision- best of luck as an assassin Ha!!

title: Great all inclusive item- perfect vacation take a long toy!!
text:
Easy enough to assemble- takes a few minutes to connect pack straps and fasten a few items into position. Very straightforward- shouldn't need instructions.. we didn't. All accessories packs into the “sink basin” which is the base/back of backpack. It's a very smart design keeping it all minimal..!!! Just note: some items attach over edges and must be removed/connected back on each time you pack it up.

Love the water feature which is surprising- I actually didn't plan to use it (didn't want to mess- I know, mean mom!!) without connecting battery this still can provide plenty of entertainment.. However, I bought for a little one (1.6yr old) who wasn't quite old enough to grasp imaginative or mimicking concept yet.. So, water feature ended up a good thing!! Ours likes putting things in it/out of h2o and splashing his hands etc. the water offers enough play till he can grow into the toy. *this is probably best suited for littles with imagination or the make believe concept.

As for durability and longevity… This isn't going to last for years to come! It's a nice “busy toy!” A perfect solution any place you need a solid entertainment activity that may not have it available.. So many little fun pieces to hold ones attention- note: this isn't a hefty durable last forever type toy.. priced @ $25 one will get $ worth in the form of, it's all inclusive and can do its job. It entertains for the week of vacation in hotel room- trip to grandmas house.. and best of all, little ones can carry the backpack themselves-‘ it's very light weight.. ours loves to put on and walk around..??!! Note: this is sturdiest when placed flush against a wall- but, you can also set atop a table and just use without the legs. We do this on the coffee table.. it's the perfect height!

A great, all inclusive pack- extra perfect for that trip or event where you need a entertaining option that is fun and exciting for a little one.. This can offer one endless hrs. of playtime. Hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe!

title: All inclusive “busy toy“- just note the few caveat!!
text:
I would consider this a “busy toy” for little ones who grasp the concept of make-believe. Our 1.5yr old did some investigating (ok, eating!) of pieces but, is not reached this level!! To get any real mileage out of these 2 sets (I did order both) a basis of these concepts is needed ie. Cooking dinner- playing diner, doctor visit, etc.. From there, I imagine a little one will be making a 7 course meal or setting their baby dolls broken arm!!

With most parents and toys- I feel we want a fun way to create mind stimulation.. but, also give us a bit of longevity in the entertainment dept.!! (is that too much to ask?!) This has the potential to hold a child's interest.. once they've crossed that imagination or, mimicking milestone.

Solid concept in theory- a toy all contained inside a pack that is also part of the toy itself. All compact so a child could feasibly carry it. But, bc this builds “out of the packs” dimensions.. just realize each time one must disassemble the “extensions” when putting away.. ie. burners hook on and hang over edges.. blood pressure device/armrest clip to outside of pack. So, not only must you Tetris the pieces back inside.. ha! (we actually got all pieces to fit back just fine.. it just takes a bit of patience and parental help to do so.) You will also need to help clip a few extensions on/off to play and pack up!! It's not hard but, necessary if storing inside the storage case..

For the entire set up and what this is plus, all of the accessories included listed under $20- it's respectable. TBH, I don't think this is one to be around for years to come- it's sort of a “serve its purpose and move on” toy. This would be perfect for car travel or hotel stays! Even a trip to crazy grandma's where toys can be old or sparce.. this is an ideal solution! I'd be happy if, I could take this on our next hotel vacation- giving an all inclusive toy set to entertain a child.. one that they could pack around themselves.. it would be worth the price just for this purpose in my book! Hoping this info. can help in your decision- stay safe!
