Hoping this info. can help in your decision- stay safe!

title: Cup holder perk.. But, rope is the BomB!!! Sized for adults..
text:
Best float around to take down the river.. EVER!!! Very durable and made for natural waters- lakes, rivers, camping… . Sure! *This isn't rapid worthy but, we all should know that!? IF, well kept.. this should keep on giving for a few seasons worth of use!! Store deflated in off season- it can be water ready whenever the summer rafting trip is planned. (We use 2 from last year and got more to this year!!)

What's not to love, this is large enough to fit most adult men.. possibly 2 small kiddos.. After a day floating the river- we avoided irritations from any chafing or rubbing from the tube itself.. and lets face it, floating the river does come with painful aftermath- it's almost expected. Tube kept things to a minimum in bumps and bruises- that's a huge perk!

Drink holder is such a plus.. **BUT, be certain drink.. has a twist top lid!! Trust me on this one- you will thank me later! This is even a great space to hold sunscreen as you burn your way along.. love this feature!!

I recommend using an electric or foot pump when inflating and although it may look doable in size… It needs A LOT of air to fill. You want this plumped up taut- more then you know!! **A little secret: when filled completely.. this tube rides higher in water which is nice when river water is mtn. runoff freezing cold!!! Keeps you from being in ice cold water the entire time!

Climb rope is a lifesaver for getting back on if, you happened to fall off. It's also great for connecting tubes together and creating a floating island.. LOVE THIS MOST OF ALL!!!

Without hesitation I recommend to anyone who river rafts.. hands-down it's one of the best I've seen. I hope this info can help your decision… Be safe and have fun!

title: Absolutely Beautiful educational toys- with a whimsical vibe!
text:
Absolutely adorable!! 100% happy to have found this set of educational toys! Let me start by saying- how beautiful these look all on their own.. truly, these could be placed on a shelf in the bedroom and used as part of the decor! The wooden shapes and button/tasks are far more then I even anticipated.. and the matted use of colors and whimsical prints are perfect for boy/girl.. These are so well made and designed, they'd be a perfect baby gift for a little one to grow into- ha! See, nursery decor till they're old enough to play.. notice how my idea keeps coming back around?!!

I love the fact to a little one these are merely just play toys.. what they don't realize is at the same time.. they are actually stimulating the brain and learning a multitude of things! This teaches size differential- large to small, matching pairs, shapes, similar/different colors, light vs. dark and so on.. Plus, a number of physical capabilities like solid hand/eye coordination, finger dexterity... The cognitive abilities in infants are more than capable of being stimulated.. it's just giving them engaging ways to tap in and try! No need to be discouraged if your infant starts by eating the pieces or, even banging them together.. Trust me, over time after watching you they make a connection on their own time- its pretty amazing when they do!

The five tiered stacking rings are a lot of fun and each layer is made of varied materials that are durable. These will stack up even out of order.. they can slide on/off the post however they are put on. Everything is smooth and nothing too small and concerning for baby to play with. We chose this set for an 11 month old.. and no! He hasn't mastered any of the tasks at hand but, he does try to fit shapes into holes after watching us.. and when we take lid completely off- he loads all shapes back into the box- he's figured out that's where they go! He loves to dismantle rings one at a time after I stack them.. All showing me that he's paying attention and trying to mimic! He can slide the zig-zag button back/forth but, only after he tries to bite it off the box!!?

These are a fresh take on an old trusted developmental learning toy that have been favorites for families for decades. I love this is tried, tested and proven effective- nothings changed but the whimsical fresh 2021 look!! I'd recommend without hesitation.. hoping this info. can help your decision- feel free to let me know!

title: Great float for teens, smaller adults and smaller pools!
text:
Great pool float that is larger in size and can be enjoyed by even smaller sized adults! I recommend for any tween/teen or adult women. Its much larger than a child size life ring but, not overly sized- and so most adult men would be able to sit on it but, not in it..!!!

I also find this is a really good size item for the smaller pools.. this will keep the float from being too overpowering and taking up too much of the water space.. it's a very happy medium!

inflating: This does have a built-in safety at the air valve when filling.. using an electric pump to fill, this took just a minute to complete- but, A hand pump would suffice just fine as well.
Love the Hawaiian print- and especially love the fact it's not dark in colors- This way it won't become too hot in the sun.. The pastels are perfect!

As for durability… mine are not easy on pool toys to say the least! They've used this the past 3 weeks in every capacity- from a basketball hoop dunk, a bulls-eye to jump into from the side.. and a float to layout upon! Other than normal air loss in the sun and plastic expands.. this has held perfectly!!

At a price point for $12 this should carry you thru the swimming summer season and possibly longer! I hope this info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: Great for prosperity- but, had a few issues!!
text:
Ordered this for nephew who graduated high school in 2021… Although, it is a great way to commemorate the craziest year in history, there were some struggles in putting this puzzle together!!

Issue we found: Some pieces were not completely cut apart/all the way through. Therefore, when trying to simply separate stuck pieces- it was ripping the front printed photo off of the puzzle piece itself!! Once realizing this issue- we found it best to leave those pieces attached and not try to pull apart (about dzn. small groups were like this!!) For any who love a jigsaw puzzle… They also love the challenge and at the very least, they want all pieces separated and !!

The 2nd issue was found in the puzzle pieces and the cardboard foundation- as the pieces are thin! This was frustrating when a piece would bend at the loop when trying to securely fit into place inside the cul-de-sac.. and a few pieces that had extra “debris/paper-tag” stuck to the edges (Im guessing it was caused by the poor cut?) these would split apart in what appeared to be layers of cardboard..

For a price point of $10 and the fun theme- my nephew chose to put together and preserve it by making it into wall art using a puzzle glue! This did help stick down any of the lifted or torn pieces..

Just keep in mind, thinner puzzle pieces and some pieces not thoroughly cut/separated and may cause this to have issues. I suggest if ordering… Turning it into wall art or, keeping for prosperity in the box! Loved the idea just lacked overall quality. I hope this info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: Solid beginner set for the littler infants-
text:
Ordered for 10 month old in hopes to create a “ball pit” inside a movable outdoor pool- this idea works in theory.. only #50 balls barely covers if, 1/2 the surface of the bottom of a 36”x11” round collapsible pool! (I realize it may sound like a lot but, when you see bag of 50 to scale in photo included- you'll understand volume issue.)

So, before choosing quantity.. know the effect your hoping to get- along with the size of space you're wanting to fill! To make this be adequate “ball pit” style- I'll need at least #250-350 balls to fill the space. Using the larger amount still would only fill the depth approx. 1/2 way.. but, it feels a safe amount with age of infant.

Balls themselves are thinner and lighter then expected from previous experience.. held to light they were a bit translucent (see photo.) Having said that- we've had no issue with balls collapsing in or puncturing it all!!? Probably better sooted for younger vs. older kiddos due to thinner material ans weight may crush.. Our 19lb. little one did fine!
Colors are great mix and bright enough to get babies attention.. they are firm yet, still soft so if tossing around little ones- they won't hurt anybody… and that's always a good thing!

Overall, this is a fun starter set to be used for any need… not Just ball pits! We dumped them into tub with the little guy- and he LOVED it! Plus, it's a great way to wash balls too.. A great gift idea for a birthday for sure.

title: Here are the details for this flotation device…!!!
text:
A really fun water float for infants/toddler‘s.. After using with a 19lb.10 mo. old my suggestion would be: do NOT assume the “age range” posted equates to a sure thing!! ONLY USE with infant who has solid neck control and the ability to support the weight of their own head!! w/out this babies tend to slip, slouch, slump- creating the potential to get their face too close to the water or possibly against the plastic of the actual float itself!! I don't need to state the obvious but, ADULT/PARENT supervision is a must when using- whew! I said it.. just in case!!

Deciding between float options for infants we chose Swimschool Narwal simply bc, the baby is NOT harnessed into the float itself. IMHO- it is safest to have the ability to snatch an infant instantly out of float in case of emergency- ie. If float popped or sinks, chocking on h2o, float is getting away from you, capsize.. So, I appreciate there is no no harness to unbuckle on this float!

Functionality: this doesn't provide adequate photos letting you know what to expect and/or how it works exactly- so, I included photos to help decipher. This is a floating triangular saucer and built into the center is a seat with an inflatable air ring fit directly around the opening. A flotation netting then connects a second/outer air ring providing the floatation device all its excess stability and buoyancy. Dead in the center is a built in crotch sling seat so, baby cannot slip straight thru ring and out the bottom! Underneath the seat (between the legs) is an adjustable nylon strap connected directly into the float itself- THIS is how one will adjust the height level an infant sits inside the device at when on the water. All the closed seams and connections seem durably reinforced and strong and this feels very structurally sound. **Note: smaller/younger infants will tighten the strap to sit higher up when in the water.. for larger child, this is loosened for seat to ride lower.

Details: this has 2 separate air chambers.. it inflates easily and is completed within minutes (we used hand pump with zero issues..) *Air chambers are completely separate for safety purposes: in case of any air leakage or puncture, one would still be intact.. I love this forethought! But, my favorite feature is the approx. 5” netted ledge that connects the 2 air chambers.. it makes a 360° Platform that is perfect to place pool toys etc. for baby to play with and be entertained..

The one feature this is missing- is shade!!! There is no awning attached or otherwise. Its not a dealbreaker but, I mention it bc without one, I highly recommend using a bucket hat ample sunscreen for an infants delicate skin!

For a price point of $20- this is a solid find to help your little one enjoy time in the pool. It provides the confidence and if used appropriately- it will be a welcomed addition to anybody's outdoor fun! Apologies for being long-winded.. but, with so few details I hope this can help others make their decision.. feel free to let me know!

title: Great concept- but, must think thru before using!!!
text:
A quirky review as, I'm unable to float inside the pool just yet (I'm counting down till memorial day weekend!!) I studied the instructions and filled this with air -which was not the easiest task, for me and I had an air pump! This has sectioned chambers needing air yet, I cannot get the last chamber to fill completely. It isn't sealed off bc, air does get in.. and it doesn't have a leak bc, air isn't escaping..?? So, I am hoping with the last chamber approx. 75% filled at best- this can hold an adults body weight?! After all, this IS listed for adult use.. Hoping after some use and stretch/pull on plastic itself will help open up the air jam to complete filling to capacity.

The concept of an “all inclusive bag-n-pool float” is great for any who must travel to a pool.. I've tested and was surprised at the amount of space/capacity this has to hold things- No! It's not a suitcase.. but, this can easily fit ones goggles, sun screen, pool socks and even a reasonable sized pool towel. I loved these items can be tucked in and sit safely away till they reach their destination. This has a nice adjustable carry strap that allows for different lengths depending on height of person carrying.. plus, The outer mesh/elastic pocket is great for any last minute stow and go needs!!

The one issue I foresee with this all-inclusive “bag/float” theory- is what to do IF.. you bring things such as a wallet, cell phone, electronics, keys, headphones, etc to the pool inside the float but, then want to use float in water..?? This most likely would present as an adult issue. But, If using float as a bag, you'll need some sort of smaller pack to leave items in while using in water.. otherwise, items would be left in the open? Hmm?!!

Overall, I love the idea but, the fact this is made for adults (by sizing!) does present some trouble spots that need to be thought thru!! I hope this info can help make your decision.. good luck!

title: Great item… A gift that grows with your little one!!
text:
Such a great item for anyone with an infant- and useable as baby grows! A jack of all trades floor mat.. These make great drop mats under high chairs and are so easy to clean.. A wet cloth or disinfectant wipe does the trick! The bright fun colors add an element of fun for little peeps- and are great for getting babies attention.

Assembly is simple!! Just put into place like a puzzle- I love you can make any configuration.. all pieces are universal! I make “runways” around furniture giving baby a safe place to crawl and play. (see photos included!) **Hack: save your box for storage.. these will fold up accordion style x4 sq. at a time- and slide back in- and this will keep mats tightly together and take minimal space storing!! *this fits nicely under a standard height bed- out of sight out of mind.. love that!!

I recommend for any with an infant going mobile! These have a solidly firm foundation yet, a soft absorption and impact ability.. Mats eliminate issue of carpet grabbing at little feet, it provides better comfort for the tumbles and bumps as they master their skills!! Ha! Keeps tiniest of objects finding a way into babies mouth, and mats create a safe and clean place to play- I cant forget to mention.. mats stop carpet burns from crawling. A total lifesaver on tile or hardwood floors!

Note: set has 36 large solid squares.. the 20+ remaining items in the count are just the edges (These turn notched edges into straight edge- see photo.) personally, I don't use them as they're just aesthetics and I don't see any point (I bagged mine away!) Possibly useful if planning to leave mat out fulltime?

Floor mats come in handy soon after baby arrives and stay in play the over the course of their 1st yr.- these would be an excellent baby shower gift. With many styles, colors, set sizes etc. to choose from- KC Cubs brand is as solid as one would want. *Extra bonus, these can incorporate add-on sets into the future.. and as kiddos grow, these make great tumbling mats and fort walls! If cared for these can last thru more then x1 child cycle as well- I always like to point that out! These mats make a great hand me down item or, “save + store” till the next little one comes along..
I wanted to cover it all with this fun item! For so many reasons, I recommend every parent having a floor mats set, as they are worth it for certain! I hope the info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: ALL newlywed needs.. I've included ALL details below!!
text:
A total must for those wanting to invest and get more from their marriage in a healthy way.. this review will be long winded but, bear with me-i'll give you the details bc, it's worth it and I'll share all!!
As one who's been married 29yrs., my baby sis' is starting into her 2nd year of marriage.. Lately, she's been having a bit of a struggle and came seeking advice- Wow! humbled, honored and out of my league to guide beyond the level of my own journey.. I went seeking ideas to offer appropriate tools that could be tailored to her situation. Lets face it- no 2 marriages are created equal! It was here I found “Openity- meaningful conversations“ and was SO impressed. I found this helpful for any couple new to the marriage game. BUT, I could clearly see this being beneficial to any wanting a reconnect, recharge or, a relationship recalibrating.. whew, that's a lot of “R” words!!

I gave this to newlyweds who found out- that movies and fairytales are the eye candy to relationships and the actual work begins when the going gets real and real tough. That moment that hits soon after the euphoria is tampered down and daily life starts piling up! Oh, and when together forever really sinks in, talk of mortgages, possibility of babies, employment up/downs, boundaries, in-laws, balancing budgets, religious quirks, etc. Ha! Toss in a pandemic (Kudos btw, to all newlyweds who have had to navigate quarantine- I applaud you all!!) Its true- so many couples spend more time, effort + detail planning their wedding that will last a few hours, thinking it's a passage to “Happyland!” Truth is- as those of us who treaded the waters.. there is SO much more! Worth it, yes!! But, it takes work (something “that secret society” never told you- or else, you didn't want to hear?!)

This tool is created by all physical standards like a game but, in reality.. it can be used however one chooses: X1 hour an evening each week, a card before bedtime ritual, dinner conversation starter- coffee chatter in the morning.. options are endless! I don't recommend “playing together” with other couples although, to each his own..Since, the gist is to help couples navigate and get to a deeper level- questions are designed to create openings for couples to safely be vulnerable and breach sensitive subjects.. I feel that depth and “security” could be lost if, played with others!

I love the goal setting aspect as these create a way to put words into action and provide a “measuring stick” to see progress made- that can be motivating in itself! I love, love, love the challenges as well.. for example, one can accept to write down a few ideas they'd like to do for their partner that week (a challenge!) These are small, simple things that feel so big when received.. ie., make dinner together, tell a partner an affirmation or, memory by a simple note or song, it can be a surprise “I love you” text for no reason, and so on.. Not only does this give to your partner a piece of you- It helps develop positive patterns when put into action and that's a win/win for all! I love the challenge isn't difficult or $ involved either, it's just being cognizant of the other persons needs. Better yet, this confirms x1 person is truly listening and the other is being heard- hallelujah..!!

This offers a “safety” which is a must without a 3rd party to help guide.. The contemplation option lets one take a moment on a question and circle back at a later time. This has a “turn-around” option as well, letting both parties answer a same question! I'm telling you, it's like this covers everything in a safe and positive way.

The creator is a therapist who's spent a career in marriage counseling and its present in the respectful creation. Neither participant should be afraid to begin.. This has safeguards to keep this a positive experience. Cards are sprinkled with ample feel good questions: ie., tell me about the day we met? What you admire most about your partner? Words to describe one another- how did you know I was the one? Even some about childhood- show me on map your hometown or dream vacation spot.. favorite childhood tradition and so on.. I call these “feel goods” and the world can't have enough of them- Hands down, I recommend for any warning to enrich their relationship. This would make an incredible wedding gift- it should be given with the purchase of every engagement ring.. ha!!
I warned this was long winded but, I hope giving all details I could can you help in your decision.. feel free to let me know!

title: Take note: no volume or mute button at all..!!!
text:
Consider yourself warned!! You must know this is a miniature yet, bulky mechanical plastic toy.. Calling it a remote control is wrong. This does not have a remote to guide it but, rather just an on/off switch. There is no volume or mute- (warning applies here by the way!!) imagine a hollow sounding speaker placed inside a rattley plastic toy- with a few quirky sounding song tidbits.. (5 total I believe!) and equally noisy is the robotic mechanic noises of movement.. totally eye-catching and entertaining when turned on, after watching the toy “crab dance” through the loop of the songs.. You realize, this repeats itself- doing the same movements: Crabwalk forward- wiggle/prance on all 8 legs.. crabwalk back- wiggle/prance on all 8 legs.. Pause! New song and repeat!!!

Once you've seen the duration of the loop you've seen it all… Kids can probably handle x2-3 loops longer then adults- but, even a silly gimmick toy made for sheer mindless entertainment has its limitations! Arriving from the Easter bunny in a basket- not even 5min. into the looping I found myself looking for a volume/mute button… as, this would have made all the difference mind you- We even went looking for a sound wire we could clip.. bc, that was the extent of tolerating this due to the obnoxious factor.. there is not volume/mute!!

Now, if you can believe this… I think the best way for these to be enjoyed is getting two of them!! At least they dance together and feed off one another.. i'm not certain if music overlaps one another but.. otherwise they become rather repetitive on their own rather quickly. (kids may not care!)

For any who's seen original Toy story series- remember Syd the neighbor used a doll head on spider legs?! It was scary but, sadly quirky cute in movie?!! Well, this reminds me of that- I'll give it “uniqueness” for sure! Keep in mind.. 8mo. old recipient was terrified when turned on- So, that is something to consider. I see these being used as an office prank or entertainment, or younger ages 3+ bc, it might just be enough to hold their attention for a quick minute. The crab legs can be a little ominous but, this is balanced with a computer animated smile to look happy and less threatening! The Wally computer headed structure on top is where the on/off is found. These take x3 AA- and you must have a TINY screwdriver to release the compartment lid!!

This is one of those toys that I say… To each his own! It will either be fun or make you crazy and I fell in the latter category. At a price point of $10 it's not a big investment if, not used every day. I hope this info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: Be sure these can meet your babies needs..
text:
A set of various infant teething and play toys- as you can see from the photos I included.. there are x4 (of 7 total) solid toys that are compatible for tiny hands to hold onto.. I included photo of this group. Some are more teething compatible then others. Each item has its own simple but, unique feature.. ie, x1 has rubber nubs and handle for babies to easily hold and get this into their mouths! One rattle has a spinning hamster wheel style ball, hammer has beads housed inside so.. as you tap- it shakes noise, ball has a squeak inside and so on. NOTE: only electronic, interactive toy (x1 with batteries!) is the makeshift cellphone/remote.. it has x4 buttons that change sounds and color. Other toys just simulate a button push, without effects. All are made in bright colors.. But, with an active 7month old- he does seem to lose interest in these rather quickly!

As for the quiet interactive book.. this was x1 item that felt subpar to the others. From photos included you will see, every page incurred loose threads and strings.. The magnifying glass is pretend and made of a floppy felt.. I realize the concept in using this to “search” but, Poor quality structure makes using it obsolete! You can of course, still use quiet book for entertainment without the fake magnifying glass.. it has ‘crinkle' sewn in pages to make noise- and small flaps lift or, Velcro off. BUT, these are not confidently secured to the book itself-so, I recommend using with supervision!! (this might be caused by the loose thread issue?)
Overall, at a price point of $25 you receive a handful of toys but, with our experience.. Truly, only x1 is attention grabbing- along with the ball! Baby loves the fact, ball is soft sided so he can pinch/grasp on his own.. problem is, it's bigger in size and when dropped, it falls and rolls out of reach.. making it a chore for mom to constantly retrieve!! Personally, when looking at toys for baby, I'm wanting to find items that are unique and stimulating.. and able to keep baby busy a solid few minute without my “need” for constant interaction. I always say- the best way to rate infant toys is: how much time do these keep child engaged!!!? (sure! We all love to spend time playing with our baby..) but, we also live in reality where we do need a few minutes to multitask.. So, I want to find toys that will allow me to do both.

At $25 price point.. this is at higher end for x1-2 items that may grab attention, x4 that smaller infants can hold onto.. and x1 for teething. Prior to ordering just be sure this will meet needs of your infant- I hope this info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: A needed staple for useable baby entertainment!
text:
These are a must have for any with a little one..!!! These are a perfect add-on to any place you want to set your baby down in: a car seat, strollers, swing, play place, jumper seat- you name it.. truly, the list goes on!

These are bright in color which grab a babies attention and yet, not too overdone with whistles and bells (A nice feature so, not to drive a Mama crazy..!!) there is one moveable rattle wheel at the base of the giraffe.. the ball spins easy with momentum of baby fingers and seems to be a total hit! Our 6mo. old figured out within a minute- (of course, we're pretty sure he's a genius ha ha..!!)

Love these are ready to go from the moment they arrive- they need no extra batteries or, clips as they can be put in action once opened- see photos attached.. it's one/done.. it's just that easy! Better yet, these can easily move around to the next desired location. I love the fact there is no acrobatics or, unscrewing nor, permanent fixing- making removal so doable with a slide of the clip.

These can wipe down with a Lysol wipe or, disinfectant spray easy enough and I do- especially with COVID-19… I'm constantly wiping everything down and these hold up just fine. Hack: x1 a week I prefer placing all capable baby toys on the top shelf of dishwasher. These having the proper slat for any liquid drainage… give me peace of mind that no yuck or gunk will get stuck inside and causing mold and germs to grow!
These would make a great birthday or shower gift… Or, just an extra splurge to help mom keep the baby entertained. The simplicity is worth the purchase and the integrity let me know these will last long after baby outgrows! I hope this info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: Fun twist to standard puzzle- quarantine worthy!!
text:
Perfect Covid past time… Although, a puzzle can be fun for all ages- the second portion of this puzzle can be tricky for those who may not be familiar with advertising. So, for the puzzle in it's entirety- I would say this is best for teens on up to adults.

With the current pandemic we have been searching the web over for ways to stay entertained at home and this is definitely a good option. Who knew, there could be another twist on a standard puzzle.. and yet, here we are..!! Best part of all- for a price point of $12.. even if this becomes a one and done puzzle/game, it's worth a family night of entertainment!

After family played over the holidays…My college-age kiddo took this back to the dorm.. where everything social/fun is on lockdown! So, this will be a welcomed puzzle in their game basket Menagerie.. In fact, being upperclassman and of age- they turned this into a drinking game with a bottle of wine !! Hmm.. but; it's college- if, it keeps them having fun at 21yr + since bars/clubs are off the table.. I'm willing to smile through it!!

The puzzle itself is built with solid and sturdy approx. 1+” pieces and the “pop open doors” have a little wiggling to do in order to get some open.. Note: we used a small thin metal nail to help separate the last connected portion of any pop opens that hadn't been 100% “cut” loose.. once opened the first time, there seems to be no issue afterwards! Overall, a fun twist on a standard puzzle idea… allowing you make the most of stay at home fun. I hope this info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: Great fun for those who I think they know everything!!
text:
As a lover of board games… Our family members each receive a new addition to the game closet in their stocking every year… With kids off to college- I am constantly looking for new and fun options that don't take a lot explaining or, learning and can peek their interest, liking them to be a bit competitive yet, can be played with minimal effort- So, a hard combo to find! So, I'm happy to say… “How did You know That-“ falls into this category!!

DID YOU KNOW THAT is easy enough to learn and that's a perk! Also, a big plus is the fact, it's easy to explain it to those who have a tendency to not pay attention during rule reading (we all know a few of “those type” people- ha ha..!!) BUT, with an easy concept they'll be playing like pros in no time.. LOVE the fact, this game can be tweaked and adapted if necessary.. and we always love those! (Anything that allows you to simplify or shorten a game as needed.. is like sprinkles on top!)

Basic idea: one person reads 4 questions in a row off of x1 card. All other players write their 4 answers down… THEN, players will correct answers as revealed for all 4 questions asked. giving x1 pt. per correct answer. If only x1 person gets it right the crowd shouts “how did you know that!” and gets double points. Its that simple..

This is full of Quirky odd questions at various levels of some useful/not trivia! Winner is whoever has most points at the end of game..
Best part is: YOU decide do you play to a certain point level (1st one to 10, 20 wins?) OR, do you give everyone certain amount of cards so, everyone has a turn or two to read questions.. if so then, at the end of all reveals.. they tally up those points received to see who's the winner! That's it..!!!

This would make a great game for the dorms- (especially during the time of the pandemic.. these kids have a lot of Shelter in place/quarantine time!) for those old enough, I could see it turning this into a drinking game of sorts (good or, bad?!) it would easily adapt.
Definitely, feel this is geared toward older teens or, adults.. it's too hard for younger kids. I do feel this has a niché for academics and know it alls! Any with mega time spent learning, reading, gaining random facts off the Internet- it's a great way to share that trivial academia skills.. Ha! Some things will just be fun facts you picked up thru life, in elementary school or, info. From those who've raised you.. tossed with real trivia facts. So, the smartest person doesn't always win!? Fun for a competitive group with a plethora of knowledge and facts to share!!
Played with our college kids over holiday and it went back to the dorm bc, of its fun factor- with x3 college kids and/or, recent graduates.. we had a ball! I hope this info can help your decision.. feel free to let me know!

title: One of a kind RC ability- never seen anything like it!
text:
Wow! This is one fun little number… Young or, old!! Don't let the age range posted fool you- this may be enjoyed by all! I feel it's best suited for older children and/or, those adults who are young at heart!! To my surprise, this does not have a child like “plasticy-cheapness-cheesiness” about it, all at a price point of under $25..!! This has the ability to be appreciated by motorcycle enthusiast and those who just like to experience sheer FUN with a new gadget. Because, that is exactly what this is… FUN!!
This can even look “marvel avenger like” when not in use sitting on the shelf- its a cool decor feature as well!! (See photo included!)

The challenge is lower moderate - medium. I feel younger will mostly just appreciate the ability to be the driver of a “remote control vehicle” bc, that itself can be empowering.. and the more it's played with.. their skills will be gained over time. An older/more capable recipient will have fun testing, trying and improving their talents by perfecting some of the sick trick, figure 8 moves, leans, burnouts, 360s etc. that this can do..

I LOVE the wheels themselves actually tilt 180° to either side and simulate a lean on an actual bike so well.. I've never seen anything else like it.. super cool!! Plus, I love this has set of stabilizer wheels under the riders feet (tiny + hard to detect- see photo I included) these prove super helpful and will help keep bike from tipping over as you perform all your trick moves!
We got 20-25min. from fully charged battery and as expected, tricks become harder to perform as battery dies approx. 15min. in- So, I suggest charging both batteries (included) prior to running so you double the play time! Trust me- 40min. can go quick!!
Remote is super easy to learn- especially for gamers! Simple 2 toggle buttons and that's it.. (needs 2 AA) x1 screw locks down both battery doors - ugh.. but, set includes the screwdriver so, don't lose it! Hack: open door over WHITE surface.. screw is black and easily lost in carpet- If happens, use a magnet to locate.. yes! I'm speaking from experience!! Overall, this is definitely a win-win for sure.. For $ spent, you won't be disappointed. I hope this info can help your decision… feel free to let me know!

title: A must have for every game closet..!!!
text:
TOTAL CLASSIC...!!! No matter what type of spin you put on charades… It will always be a solid go to/staple for any group- no matter ones talents- young or, old! My group includes a player with a disability.. and I love the fact, this can be played in teams and eliminates the worry if, one must be left out if they can read or not- this game can be easily tweaked not to exclude anyone! (with teams we pair up 2-3 players per group.. sprinkling those who need extra help amongst all teams and we take turns acting. Then, when an adult adds input/guidance, it's done without ever appearing like “help” to those who can't.. instead, it appears like a natural collaborative decision!) with party charades we actually found it to be quite helpful for adults as well to play in teams!! Some of us adults were a bit clueless to the “pop culture references!“ So, it was great to have a younger kiddos be knowledgeable on the team.. The help flows both ways with this style of set up... it's perfect!!

Note: you can tweak the rules OR.. follow included instructions.. OR, Control the time by playing “best out of five rounds” etc. charades is a must-have for any game covered.. One more perk- Party charades definitely can help keep the mid adolescent teen group entertained as well- (this is big when playing family game night- anyone with a 17yr. old boy with coolness attitude can attest! The Party charades version actually keeps the teens entertained..!!)

One last note/hack: we do allow for a set # of “cell phone sneaks” if no one knows the person or, catchphrase reference on the card- I recommend this just to keep the game rolling.. definitely must limit the “sneak peek” to 15sec. just enough to know Who/what but, better we found it's better then skipping multiple cards.
Loved party charades so much- I bought 2nd copy for my daughter to take back to her dorm room… During Covid quarantine this will bring endless fun in the dorm room, I'm certain of it..!! Hands-down recommend for sure. I hope this info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: Easy to learn/play.. best with people you know!
text:
As a lover of board games… Our family members each receive a new addition to the game closet in their stocking every year… With kids off to college- I am constantly looking for new and fun options that don't take a lot explaining or, learning and can peek their interest, let them be a bit competitive yet, can all be played with minimal effort- that's a hard combo to find! So, I'm happy to say… Priorities falls into this category- just know a few of the fun caveats!

Priorities is easy enough to learn and a big plus is the fact, it's easy to explain it to others who have a tendency to not pay attention during rule reading (we all know a few of “those type” people- ha ha..!!) BUT, with an easy enough concept they'll be playing like pros in no time.. LOVE the fact, this game can be tweaked and adapted if necessary.. and we always love those! (Anything that allows you to simplify or shorten a game as needed.. is like sprinkles on top!)

TBH, I must admit - this game is best played with those who know quite a lot about their opponents.. as the gist is: to rank in a list of “priority..” how another player would answer. So, if you don't your players that well.. it still works- lets just say you will get to know each other better after a few rounds! My daughter took to college to play with her dorm mates.. They've had a blast playing this during quarantine and said it brought up conversations they may not have ever had otherwise. So, I'd call that a win/win for sure..!!

I appreciate the fact the game is not one to last for endless rounds or, hours.. this has a nice “Quick Pro quo” and that translates to letting others jump in/out as wanted.. plus, it creates a lot more opportunities for socialization amongst the players-

Love the game it's self has a small footprint with minimum set up needed. This is also a game I can easily see expansion packs being created for in the future… At price point of $20- it's higher end for a handful of cards with topics on them- But, when it brings entertainment like it has, I say it's worth it. I hope this info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: Fun game that can be tweaked to your level!!
text:
A great game for anyone -Super great for any who has teenagers… I will admit, that was after we made a few adjustments!!

We first played this as a family: college kiddos with our youngest being 17yr old. Since, I purchased specifically for his crowd as a quarantine option.. I am writing review in respects to the tween genre- (just in case anyone else may plan to use for the same caveat/age group..)

Quick background… Our youngest joined our family via adoption. Born into heavy drug exposure and abuse from conception to 3yr old. to say there is a learning deficit- is an understatement! At almost an adult age- he struggles to read and comprehend basic instructions with major cognitive disabilities- and can become Intimidated and not give things a try. Looking for something easy to understand w/out major need for game reading.. I found myself grasping for a simple, fun and age appropriate game for him to feel confident with. But, after playing this as a family, I saw with just a few tweaks- we could make this something that met our needs with him... Jackpot!!

So, what are the tweaks?
First of all, the string provided is bound up tight to fit in the box BUT, the string does not like to straighten out very well… And that matters in this game! * The concept being- you are given a shape to “create” using a string verses a pen/paper. We also found, one string was limiting- 2 made it a lot more fun.. easier?? Maybe but, I would consider it still a challenge for any who play!! Trust me, it's a bit harder than you think-

**We added our own string (aka just a standard shoe lace) and we also added x2 of them- allowing players to use 2 strings to create an image vs. just x1, was a total riot! We did add x1 white and x1 black string- and made up a point system- more points for designing with x1 string over using x2. For example we did:
10pts for creating image with x1 string-
5pts for creating image with x2 strings-
And the first one to 50 (you can pick high/low # depending on how long you want game to last..) the 1st to reach that #- WiNs!! That's it..

Yes! We tweaked the game to fit our needs- But know, the basic concept of this game still is quite similar if following actual rules. (Minus an extra string!) Either way you play it's a fun take on a game with a Pictionary + charades vibe. With us manipulating the game to our circumstances actually made it more enjoyable for the whole family…

**So, take note there's A LOT of give to make this more conducive to different abilities… For that reason, I give five stars for the fun we had playing..!! For the confidence it gave my teenager, I'd give this 10stars- Hands down!!
I realize, this is a unique twist on a standard review but, do hope it can still help in your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: Nothing but scavenger fun.. This is a total winner!!!
text:
I love games!! Im a total fan of any game that creates activity and games that are the most interactive- are the best. And this doesn't let you down.. because, that is ALL this game is!!

This is a true scavenger hunt in every sense of what you know- it has two options which is SO perfect depending on the fact, if you want to let the kiddos go play outside or, not..? How great- this is created with items to find either: indoors or, outdoors.

Keep in mind, this doesn't have age limits- I bought this for my collage age daughter who lives out of state in the dorm during Covid pandemic.. And this gives a fun something to “do” for her and any roommates alike- its a fun variation to cure the boredom.. Ha! this offers a fun activity and clever idea for safe entertainment.. Younger players can easily be teamed up with older to include really any age-

Which brings me to the fact.. playing teams allows for a bigger group or, teams to be formed- So, this definitely has some flexibility for sure!! And ok, game could be played with as few as 2 but, let's just face it- this may not be as entertaining or fun?!

And.. Which brings me to the other fact- this game has such a simple design it has the ease of altering rules to be more conducive to your group and your surroundings.. If, certain items to scavenge are not possible to find safely or, not within reason- You can just tweak (or eliminate that item) bc, It's just that easy.. adjust any part or, expectations with this hunt- trust me, it will not take away from the overall game itself. (say it with me...)

Which brings me to even one other fact (ha-ha!)- this provides 2 sets of cards showing players the items to “scavenge!” As stated- feel free to remove any item or, put regulations so no one brings home your neighbors nativity scene or, yard decor!! (Ok- I'm kidding.. that isn't one of the items!) but, here is a HACK: I found using standard index cards one can easily create their own add-on ideas to scavenge.. and new items to find IF.. game is played often enough and in need of some variety. You can also add on an “activity cards” and by this I mean- you create an index card with a fun suggestion for each team to do/perform and as “doing or, done” these can be documented with cell phone.. (Christmas caroling on a door, or building a snowman, making a reindeer rap..) Just write idea/item on a card.. draw or, include a photo to go with it if, necessary for explanation.. and this is just a simple way to keep the game fresh and interesting.. this can be tweaked with photo scavenging +added cards.. so, remember that!!

This is fantastic for the holidays and will definitely become a staple in our house I'm certain of it. We are always in the market for now “realistic and doable“ activities- and games are one of the favorites. This combined game and activity.. I could recommend this without any hesitation.

Improvements: could be made producing more durable coated cards! These get tucked/stuffed in the racing of the game and can bend and fold if not being careful… A laminated set would be fantastic! Including a few extra solid bags to collect items- just to be all inclusive and have extras as needed. (*but, this is easily be rectified by using a reusable grocery bag from home as well..) Lastly, Provide blank cards that could match and be to add on items to the deck- HOWEVER, listing 3 improvements is just a way to make a really awesome game even better.. this is definitely a keeper as it is! I hope this info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: Great to get early and use so many ways along the way..
text:
This is such a great “add-on” toy and I say that because, it truly can be twisted around whatever you want!! Being built of a spiral body.. this naturally wants to twist around ANY handle or straight line it can “vine” onto.. no buckles, suction cup, velcro..nada!! It does this ViNe LiKe connection purely on design shape alone- it's brilliant!!

The simplicity of 3 dangling animal heads is plenty for baby.. Dangles includes extra items as well- giving you a 2 for 1 toy for entertainment- mirror on the flipside, rattle inclosed.. even the ends of the twist toy itself.. have “crinkle paper” inside- so, they will add a fun noise... You can tell, a lot of thought went into such a simple item. When babies world is explored by sight, sound and color stimulation- this offers up the trifecta! I am using with 3 month-old who's just now discovered- he is surrounded by objects (crazy when that happens!) This toy gets his attention + keeps him entertained for small segments of time- just long enough for me to empty a dishwasher or, start load of laundry -which is a priceless gift as we've all come to know!

Best part of all… As he grows, he will be able to interact on different levels with this and therefore, it's a toy that can grow with him- just another priceless perk!! I am loving this can be Tweaked and feel I must share my **HACK: as baby tires or, becomes bored with this toy, just find smaller light up/noise making toys that you can clip to this spiral.. it doesn't have to look pretty- it just has to offer more variety of “whistles and bells” and with the ease and convenience of how this attaches to things.. it's worth finding those few extra items to clip on! Translation: It will basically be giving you a ton of extra mileage out of one single item- (an item prices under $15- mind you!!)

How does it work exactly? Well, that's what's so great.. in photos I included you can see the full structural body.. picture you holding from one end- and letting it hang (you can almost hear the boing-boing sensation it has going on!) but, as the spiral separates, you simply twist those around any object.. You can even just intertwine around any stationary object bc, there is no wrong way to attach this.. it just needs an item to vine onto!! I will say this appears in size + style to be designed for stroller, car seat, crib rail bar/handle - but, get creative.. you can see I've strung it up the leg of floor activity gym.. or, bouncy chair as well! Baby can even play with it attached to nothing- options galore!
Only downside, items do not detach so, washing is a bit tricky.. personally, I use baby safe (all organic chemicals) wipe Cleaners.. and just give a good wipe down and let it air dry. But, this doesn't have ability to toss into washing machine.. not that I'd feel confident to try w/out damaging toy itself.

This is a great gift to get early on in baby phase.. that way, you can get plenty of use throughout the first yr.+ I hope this info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: Know what your getting and What it can/can't do!!
text:
Wow! Having a son who is an intermediate participant in the fingerboard world… I thought this would be a fun addition to his collection. He loved the fact that he got to build four boards in a row!! That includes the placement of trucks, wheels, stickers… However, for any who like to use fingerboards to do “skate tricks“ in some capable ability- this is not a set for you!! No, you cannot Ollie a ladder or, wooden plank or, snowboard made of a bulky plastic- as, they are quite long and cumbersome… some, a bit heavy. The rail and ramp included, can be used to slide item up and down or along- but, for someone who's been playing with fingerboards the past few years, he has taken his skill passed that level and then some! No he's not going to make a living at it… this is like playing with a yo-yo or a Rubik cube.. even a fidget toy- but like any practiced past time, you get better skills over the span of a few yrs. So, mine was less than impressed after the building took place.

These would be fun for imaginary play- Kids could pretend roll around or get creative… The only issue with that, is the small intricate details in assembling. Not difficult in the instruction per se… But in the level of small nuts, bolts, screws- about the size of eyeglass hardware.. Now, you might be able to see my concern with younger kids! If an adult is willing to help assemble… Then, you may have a fun set that will keep your younger children entertained?!
Tbh, I see these in that Imaginary play genre or, possibly for one who likes to collect the unique fingerboard items.. then, this may be for you! Personally, I was hoping my son would gain 4 new fingerboards that he could excel doing tricks he likes to do with these gadgets..NoT as a profession but, as a fun past time!! (I don't know many professional yo-yo users either… But, if you can justify having fun with that- then, you may be able to understand fingerboarding!)

The gimmicky boards are neither, here nor there and the ramp included is simple plastic.. ehh. I will say, the rail included can be used with other boards and it's made quite solid- it is trick worthy for sure. I've purchased a rail in the past separately for approximately $10. I'm guessing that's half of the $20 price point- The oversize “wheel case“ it comes in is sort of fun and could be used as display or, even to contain ones collection- it would just depend on the recipient. The surprise inside gimmick is one us parents “love to hate..” Think buying a deck of Pokémon cards, we all think it's going to be the mother load of “ amazing collector cards“ and we end up buying endless packs- to end up with a million mediocre cards... But, it is what it is! I believe there's a total of eight various items one could receive. (it seems there's always that specific one your child is after… And never get it on the first go around!) that's up to the person buying how much they want to invest in getting the entire collection.
Overall, it gave our fingerboard enthusiast an hour worth of entertainment. There are a few perks that came with it but, not something suited for him as a repeat purchase. He is past this level yet, this could be fun for beginners or creative minds at play!? I hope this info can help in your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: Such a great learning toy.. it works on so many levels!!
text:
Love this! What a fun and creative way to let our little people grow, nurture and stimulate their brain. We all know this is key to their development and those little ones with active stimulation prove to develop faster in this area.. What better way to do this then, with a bright and inviting wooden stackable puzzle of sorts!?

This is a great starting point to help little ones gain a handful of different skills… The painted blocks allow for creative thinking, picture replicating-(they can mimic one of the 10+ shapes and patterns provided), increases hand/eye coordination, and practices great finger/grip dexterity. Not to mention, this helps works on their ability to gain patience as they trial/error their way through to their final creation.. Remember, there can be no wrong end results.. just ask Picasso!!

This is fabulous for beginning stacking skills, as this has small wooden posts to stack blocks upon- (Yep! Blocks have a hole drilled into them!) which will help immensely as little ones gain their talents. The base structure will help cut out major frustration of knocking over a masterpiece.. and trust me on this one, it matters!!

As for the physical product itself.. (i'd love to attach a photo only, I'm not given an option.) But, the size of the blocks are compatible to the tiny hands this is intended for, making it easy to grip and hold onto. **Better yet, pieces are not small enough to pop into the mouth and create a chocking hazard- like it's distant cousin the Lego can do! Edges are smoothly sanded so, no splinter or slivers.. and the non toxic paint gives a smooth coated finish- which allows you to wipe blocks off without worry of ruining the wood itself! These blocks are color painted on all sides to allow for the variation in designs.. So, it may seem a bit more challenging as to which side or direction to stack each piece.. but, not really! The “block puzzle” has only 12 pieces to create any of the set shapes.. and the physicalLy cut differences in these shapes, really make this a “doable” puzzle to learn and grow with.

This is a one stop shop of a toy item! Beginning with grasping and beginning stacking for the 1+yr. age... as they grow, they'll learn to stack in order and create replicas 2+yrs. From there, the cognitive design will begin to take root.. Making this a gift that works on many levels and adapts along with their skill set. Hack: this makes for great decor in a nursery just by setting it on a shelf and displaying the fun animal character. So, when not in use your gaining a fun accessory to look at.. it's a win/win big time!
I purchased for my sister who's welcoming her first baby with her husband from Ghana.. such a great way to bring a part of his world into their Americanized home. Priced under $20- this is a quality item.. one I'm certain will be enjoyed for years to come..
I hope this info helps… Feel free to let me know!

title: Great set for beginners! Perfect alternative to Video games and use creativity!!!
text:
Great for beginners who want to try marble run building or, for any who may have shown a peaked interest in the idea.. This is a great starting point without making a serious investment of money or, supplies until certain this is something that will be enjoyed. This is a good size starter set to get you going- one can definitely build quite a fun variety of ideas with just this set alone.. this complete set will provide all pieces needed to create a run start to finish.. any add-on's are just that, extra perks and bigger creations!! (Fun but, not necessary..)
The box comes with a few ideas to get you started- But, I suggest googling building ideas online as, the options are endless.

This can be enjoyed by any age (OK, any age that knows not to put a marble in their mouth! Simple rules of parenting apply marble= chocking hazard.)
The only other item necessary to get going.. is a flat surface and that's simply due to the laws of science that apply!! Sturdy surface is a must- **IF, you want to save endless frustration. Parents take note of this- and spare an unnecessary meltdown, no carpet is flat enough.. trust me on this one!

Being sold at a lower price point- I personally feel these are made with a quality geared for the juvenile/beginner level and not the “official marble track building enthusiast!” *Major life hack: for any parent who must help their child create a Rube Goldberg science project (endless continual string of events that keep triggering the next step to happen?) Yep! The one worth 1/2 the childs science grade.. the assignment that gets saved till the last minute (even though Instruction came home on colored paper and you swore you wouldn't put it off!) ..it's the assignment parents end up doing 99% of the work, the work that must all be caught on film- WoW!! Just typing it out brought me such flashbacks of angst.. PTSD from science class!!!? Well, this could help with that assignment..!!

My only drawback with this overall set: I wish the base/foundation piece(x4 of them) were a bit weighted or, made to be a bit more solid. I feel with the market for these type of sets applying to younger crowds, it would lend a much needed safety to those with a higher probability of bumping it over. *Last hack: we have used small 1” slices of gorilla/duct tape..and do so to securely steady the base. That way as kids build, those oops and bumps- won't topple down due to a wobbly first layer! Trust me on this one.. it saves us many of tears!

Although, this may sound a little ominous… It is not!! Just know your audience and use a hack or two listed, to help the building be a success. These are a great gift idea for any who love to create, build Legos, stack dominoes, Minecraft, etc.. in our house, my son likes to incorporate all of the above listed! A trifecta of fun.. and what's so great about a set like this… It gets kids off of technology and provides them a way to exercise their creativity! And that is a winner if, there ever was one.. for the price point- you can't go wrong with this as an “investigation piece!” A great starting point to see if they have interest and tbh, who wouldn't! These are actually a lot of fun!!!
I hope this info helps… Feel free to let me know!

title: Works as good as our original cornhole brand set!!
text:
These are perfect! I was hesitant ordering a new set that didn't come with our actual brand name cornhole board set- (we left our set outdoors by accident.. And much to our dismay- someone stole them!?? Really.... Why?!!)

So, having to replace with a quality set.. one that could withstand the use/abuse we put these thru- We took a chance and ordered the TOYSHARING patriotic Replacement set.. and they're awesome!!!

Material used is durable and strong- it is weather treated which is awesome.. bc, we do play rain or shine.. and as you may have figured, with kids playing the game- sometime, they dont cleanup and it gets left out in the yard.. So, weather worthy material- is key!!

Not only can these stand up to the elements. But, material used does make these strong enough to endure wear/tear!! Not impossible for a bag to be tossed into a nearby bush, by sheer lack of ”overthrow” (like I said, we play with kids a lot!) and they seem durable to withstand an accidental slide on pavement.. depending on where game is played! Bag seems reinforced by sewing, doubled with strong quality material- corners are tucked in and sewn very similar, if not the same grade and quality as original set that lasted 3yrs!

No! We don't use everyday!!! In our house it's very seasonal.. we go thru phases of being obsessed with game- but, it does see it's fair share of action.. just not everyday- Hoping this gives an idea of use to compare these too the use at your house! Knowing how long a set of toss-bags can last, I feel content if, needing to purchase a replacement set every few years. (If not stolen- we'd still use old set!)
Love the pattern- stars/stripes.. red/blue!! Easy to know who's toss bag is who's! These can also be an add-on to a set.. giving the ability to let more then 2 people play a time. Or, if making your own boards/toss game at home.. these toss-bags are great for any the need.
The pull string bag these arrive in is a nice bonus- it makes for easy clean up and storage.. then, when playing at a later time, all supplies are easy to find-

(Hack: on our original set we'd developed a hole in x1 bag soon after purchase.. we did apply a canvas tent patch directly over the tear- and it held up till they went missing! A little hack to help if ever you do get a trouble spot on x1.. worth a try to fix before buying entire new set!)
Hope this info. Helps.. feel free to let me know!

title: Like the solid product- But, you must buy protectors for the base!!
text:
My son who fingerboards really likes this accessory but, for the price I am a little less in love! it is just a heavier Metal with two platforms. Just like the photo! only, it is a must to place a rubber stop/anti-scratch mechanism on the bottom of each of these Platforms. Problem is, once this arrives… you want to use. Yet, You realize you need to purchase anti-scratch pad (furniture protectors) separately! A nice rubber self-adhesive protector needs to be part of this purchase! It would make all the difference-
***03/24 UPDATE: I was actually contacted by the seller who informed me, protector pads should have been included with the purchase and placed inside the box when mailing this item. For some reason, ours were not included.. BUT, I appreciate the contact to let me know, this was an oversight. So, when ordering the rail you should receive pads with the purchase!! Good- bc, you will need them!

We did use a self-adhesive rubber dot for each platform… (about the size of a nickel) This stick right onto the base (x2) but, it will then keep the metal rail from scratching any surface as well as, slipping when they skate the mini finger skateboard across it!!
This is as simple and straightforward as it looks… A solid metal bar welded to the bottom of two bases. This is a sturdy piece- the base feels strong enough at the welding points and is nice quality, no jagged edges at all..
For price, I just would expect/appreciate an all inclusive- “everything I need to use” to be included upon its arrival. If protectors came in the package.. then, the user could choose on their own to use none scratch/slip pads or not.

In the end, The recipient being my teenage son was a happy camper and that's what matters most!!

I hope this info helps.. feel free to let me know!

title: Saw first hand the fun/laughs this game can provide!!
text:
Gave this as a gift to a recipient out of state- Due to that fact, I never felt capable of reviewing the product. Craziest thing… almost a year later, when we went On vacation and met up for dinner at the house I sent this too..(can you follow that..?!) to my happy surprise- they were all playing awkward turtles!! Yep, the game I had sent to them almost a year prior!! (could have been contrived Sure-but, from the wear and tear on the game… I knew they had been using it all along.)

Of course, we went to have Dinner with the adults at the house.. But, their group of teen/20+ yr olds were laughing hysterically in the other room having “game night“ and I promise, they were having way more fun than we were!!

I peaked in on the gameplaying and the concept looked pretty straightforward. Basically, divided into two teams… One member has an awkward word and tries to describe it to their team- if guessed correctly they get points! And the game sort of back-and-forths from there… Funny, quirky, annoying, cringe worthy, racy words all make up the options.. These kids were playing the game when we arrived- 2hr. Later we left... And they were still playing! (No! Not the same round but, plenty of rounds and all entertained long enough to still be having fun hours later.)

To me, this is the best type of endorsement one can have… Seeing a game in action and hearing the laughter as it was being played. This told me all I needed to know… The game was a hit for the crowd at hand- it kept them happily playing for hours. Combined it with the ease of which it takes to “learn” the game.. And you've got a winner in my book!

title: A lot of Ninjago characters, fans will appreciate..
text:
This is a medium size Lego set- and tbh, it has a lot of characters- 9 if I remember correctly. But, it isn't a lot of “building” building!
This would be a hit for anyone who is a Ninjago fan… The characters come with handheld accessories and it's fun to acquire a handful of people at one time.. just keep in mind, if you're getting this sent to keep someone occupied for a decent amount of time… That really isn't that type of build. Sure, it has a few smaller parts/stands that you build to accompany the set- however, majority of this is the characters!

I gave this to my son who has been a long time Ninjago fan and he was excited as, there were a few characters he has never acquired.. I am not certain if this is the only set to get those certain characters or, not? So, for him it was definitely a great addition.
I think this has a special niché in the fact- this would be a good set for a Ninjago fan.. but, if looking for a set that entertains and occupies time to build and play with the finish product- this may not be it.

title: Love this and has awesome rare pieces that go with it..!!
text:
This is a fun, quick 30 minute build for anyone who's a Lego fan.. !! No, it's not the larger pack and not too difficult but, this comes with a lot of rare Lego parts I've never seen or only seen once or twice!!
The details and intricate moving parts are so awesome... especially for set this small! The little moving sweeper mechanisms are to die for.. I'm just 100% impressed- I've never seen a quirky little idea such as this- maybe the Zamboni or garbage truck.. but, I love this has stepped away from the typical “build a car/build a truck“ set!
Way to actually think of other city jobs that exist and to have a fun way to understand how they work..
This is definitely a great addition to a Legos enthusiast bucket- I love the fact we're thinking outside the box Legos!

title: Perfect combo for Minecraft/Lego fans!
text:
Who doesn't love Legos!?! If you are a fan of Minecraft… This will definitely make you smile. My son who is a teenager still loves to build Legos and mix it with the love of Minecraft- boom! It's a perfect storm for fun.

He loved that this that came with plenty of characters, between animals and people I think there were five total. The size of the set is perfect for distracting and getting kids away from electronics and video games… yet, it's sized perfect to complete in one sitting. I love the size for the price point as well as, the amount of time it can distract them. Some of these sets offer less building opportunity but, this was great (maybe it's because he loves the subject of the set?) he actually built this and set it on the desk next to his video game system. It is small and sturdy enough to do that… It makes great Minecraft Decor for any kiddos bedroom- I will admit some Legos left out tend to be more fragile than others but, this does not have too many intricate pieces and is great on display!

This was not too difficult of a build and I feel, anyone age appropriate with the dexterity or, with intermediate skills could do without issue. Again, the bonus is five characters included…
I'd recommend this to anyone who loves Minecraft and Legos.. it's a win-win for sure!

title: This makes me want to start a carpool karaoke..!!!
text:
I want to get to know this better.. and trust me, I've tried!! Problem is, the kids understand it much better then, I ever could.. Ugh! Technology sucks!!!

So, if you have someone a tad tech savvy then you'll be in business! Hooking things to Bluetooth/android/iPhone becomes a little complex… When reality is, I just want to sing!!

Pros:
The case this comes in, is amazing.. and a Godsend. When buying a device that uses cord, attachments, instructions, Charger and replacement parts… (Along with the fact, the device is a bit fragile-) nothing is better then, a sturdy and compact case to corral and carry all the parts.. and store them safely together for future use! This zip case is made just for the Karaoke microphone. It has a cutout to place the actual mic. itself and a pocket for smaller parts!
All buttons are easily marked on the mic. and easy to see and use. Bonus… You can purchase an SD chip separately, to record your masterpiece and future Justin Bieber duet!! We however have not taken this toy/device to that next level… (i would consider us still at the novice side of things!)

Various buttons can alter and enhance the sound of even the most tone deaf! Some choices enhance singing quality and some are just being funny- and it will surprise you which mode you find each artists chooses to belt out their tunes in..

Mic. We got was in rose gold!! It is pretty swanky I must say- my kids added a few bedazzled rhinestones to bling out there look… However, it's Awesomely great just as it comes. (The package comes with 2 mic. Covers as well and this helps if sound becomes a bit distorted..) The battery included is rechargeable (yes! It comes with..) and it also includes both, a charge cord as well as- a cord to plug into headphones on a cell phone too!

Speaking of sound quality- NO!! You're Probably not going to belt out Mariah Carey/Taylor Swift studio recording album Quality… Yet, you will end up with hours of fun and most likely, end up like we did- fighting for turns to sing our song.

Improvements needed:
My only complaint is with instruction. There are separate perks for android over an iphone- And yet, the instructions are a bit vague in explaining what those are and this would be best.. if it included 2 separate sets of info. One full description for iPhone and then again, one full description for android. One page explaining different points for different phones… Was not working for us at all!!
The other piece of advice, list more detailed info pertaining to the compatible Apps this can coincide with- and don't just assume the user knows what these are by “one quirky word” reference! (Sorry, some of us are a bit older and need the extra details!!) if not- How will I ever conduct my very own Carpool Karaoke?!! I am certain my high school boy would be so glad if I had the skills… Ha!!

Overall, the price point of $30 is spot on and a very reasonable good deal for the product you will receive. My youngest is High School and male… So a little too cool to admit this is fun- my 2 college age girls are fighting who gets to take it back to the dorms with them after Xmas break!?!! I'm telling you- singing is fun, and this.. Just makes you want to sing! I won't break out into a Neil diamond song right now… If you're looking for a fun add-on to family/friend game night.. Or, if you're just wanting to switch it up a bit… This is perfect!!

title: Nostalgia is this toys best asset...
text:
I got this for my son as a throw back to his Nostalgia and his Pokémon days… I would say, this is the best gifted are used in that capacity. I want to your original Pokémon and grew up in that world would get a kick out of this no matter how old… Being Kadabra original characters- this was a hit for the recipient (24yr old!) Careful, it didn't cause him to break out all Pokémon card help and reminisce!!
If they have a gift for the appropriate age, I would suggest 6-10yr old could build this with ease and most likely be appreciative. Obviously, the fan is in the building and it doesn't take much to get this put together. So, for a decent price point.. it's a fun distraction from all the technology kids are consumed with. Personally, this could sit on a shelf as a fun addition to I bedroom/play room decor- but truly, if your child isn't into imaginary play then… There might not be much use after that?!

Pieces are easily connected and as stated, it doesn't take much to build. )Possibly someone younger may need help with 1-2 pieces but, that's it.. it truly is quite easy.)*This is a great activity to leave when the babysitter comes over and parents go out… Pretty much, you get an afternoon/evening worth of entertainment- Sometimes that's just what parents need!

title: An hour worth of entertainment- cost should be below $10-
text:
I have a teenage son who no matter what age… Will not grow out of Legos anytime soon! I love the fact, these give the brain a little bit of a challenge and get young and old alike off of social media and electronics!
The issue we have is we'd like to build once and be done. It's part of his age progression I'm sure.. so, I'm forever looking to get a reasonable deal on a smaller intermediate level build. This suffices my requirements adequately… Could be a bit more to it of course-
Only, after it's completed it makes its way to the side and eventually into the bucket. I still feel the positive influence is worth the entertainment and utilizing the brain in different ways. We tend to forget the power of building with our hands and imagination… And being a Lego builder as a kid, this is not a hard sell for me. I have found in hormonal rambunctious overstimulated teenage lives a small Lego build does wonders for their ability to decompress!
Who knew… Legos = teen mental therapy!!!

title: Worker placement game- best suited for adults
text:
Ok, let me tell you.. I bought this for my son and his girlfriend who spent 3 weeks this summer touring Egypt for the very first time! What a perfect year for a perfect game that includes Gods pharaohs, slaves, the Nile, burials, etc..

Before, I begin I tried to piece together a loose definition of a WORKER PLACEMENT GAME:
Most worker placement games involve resource management + player strategy.. and these choices will vary the outcome each time this game is played. Most often universal starting actions or, a draw of mandatory game card (cards that impact steps/strategy as you begin) will set you on your course and determine how you react.. actions then taken by players will ultimately control the outcome of game.. (actions such as completing tasks, producing a resource, building cities, advancing in war-) all while using a strategy to generates enough victory points to win the game.

I found this game takes longer than stated on the box… Our first round was 90+ minutes and that was with a lot of trial and error. We played game in teams of 2- all were adults and 16yr old. I'll be honest, the teenager was glad to see the 1st round come to an end and he didn't sign up for another round- it was far too complex for him!! I can't imagine seeing him and his friends sitting down to play this game. So, claiming the game is for ages 12yr to adult- it's a little bit of a stretch.. at least in our house! Our 2nd round was was a bit smoother but, it still took us about 90+ minutes to complete. The instructions are a little more intimidating then, the game actually is- I suggest the best way to begin is reading instructions out loud as a group.. And instead of endless explanation- jump into a trial round.. seeing these concepts played out as its explained/learned... helps make much more sense!
Trust me- we got more frustrated trying to understand what things were without ever seeing them.. once we put it into play- we had much more success!
This is a Great game for those who like to think and strategize… being competitive is a plus, as the games begins to reveal a winner- it instantly gets you thinking ahead.. how you will play the next round different! Trust me- you could have game night with a group of adults and this one game will be all you need to keep them content!
Board is colorful and a fun rendition of the Nile and ancient Egypt. Game pieces and cards are made with quality and not overly done but, pieces are clearly distinguish between one another. if you purchase this game, it definitely has the ability to become part of your board-game collection for many years to come.

title: Adult version of a game we all love...!!!
text:
Got this for my college kiddo- she and her friends are athlete's who can't drink during their sports season.. So, instead of heading out to parties or bars- her and friends get together and do game night!! As much as I hate to admit it- but, what a better way to kick up game night for the college kids… Make it a little racy!! (I was a bit nervous because, they do game night “coed” yet, she told me… Being They're all such good friends, they all have a good time and after x3yr. together, no one is left to feel uncomfortable!) Whew..

After looking at the content once opening the box, I can tell you most charade cards are innuendos- they don't have to be acted out as dirty… But, I'm assuming that's what makes it a lot more fun!!
Ex. of theme topics: caught with your pants down, strip tease, giving a dog a bone, photocopy your butt, office liaison.. and 100's more like these!

From the examples above- you can see how these could be acted out in a few different ways and yes, most of them a bit dirty I'm sure! Welcome to college🤗🤭.. Personally, I think these would be a lot easier to act out with a drink or two on board, damn those NCAA rules..!!

What I liked most of all, was not naughtiness but rather, The level of difficulty was definitely kicked up a notch or two or five! I can't even imagine how I would act out “Photocopying your butt.. or, Swinging your sack round and round” (OMG- I'm not even sure I know that's a saying to guess!) But, you can definitely see these are taken to a more difficult level to act out and guess- making it a lot more of a challenge as well!!

Rules of the game are pretty straightforward like original Charades- these are 3 different levels of difficulty so, that is a fun addition- The harder theme that you act out, the more points you get-
I would definitely agree with the advertisement… This is not a game that parents want to play adult children, I can see how it can be awkward or uncomfortable… But, that's obviously left up to the individual players. Just be advised you've been warned!
Overall, if you have adult kids or friends that have a good sense of humor and love playing games, this would be a fun addition to the game collection.
**One point my daughter made was- at times it gets annoying as well as, time-consuming to explain rules of new games to newcomers etc. and this, she said is just universal… The basic concept of charades is known to everyone and has really straightforward instructions. She also said it was nice that if, your time was limited- you could shorten the amount of rounds played, keeping the game to a shorter time frame.. and/or, Letting you play more than one round in a sitting. Again, these are college athletes who are very competitive… more than one round in a sitting, lets them all fight to win.. ha! Bragging rights..!!

title: Legos for life!!

Usually toss in a suitcase and give anytime we stay in a hotel… Just fun and easy surprise to bring for entertainment in moments without a “playbox!”  The only hard part.. packing a built masterpiece home!
