My sibblings and me love this game and now we can play whenever we get together and that could be anywhere in the world. Family who play together stay together: so we love the game and couldnt be more pleased with the quality: durable.

Obviously, it is not like the quality of the board game: but playing scrabble as a fmaily evokes a lot of wonderful memories. keep the game going and keep the memories coming.

It's a big thing and it stays big so you'd better have room for it.  But it's a great addition to play time.

title: The British Are Coming!
text:
I ordered this costume for a party my daughter will be attending. I was worried that it would be too short for her (she's 4) but it's a modest above-the-knee length. It's polyester, and looks like it will be cool enough for the indoor summer party, but I wouldn't recommend it for Halloween unless you live in a warm climate. There are no snaps or zipper up the back, just a square of velcro, and then a long, open slit that goes to the middle of her back. It's not really a problem since it's summer and she's small, but I'd think twice if it were for an older child.

It's a really cute dress that I can envision her wearing even after the party. It would just be a cute thing to wear (once I address the back situation, put in a button perhaps or snaps). I can't imagine it would last for more than one season, but for the price, it's perfect and I'm happy with the purchase.

title: Loud Fun!

title: Great Product! Great Fun!
text: It's been 30 years and change since my first time using Shrinky Dinks, and they're still as much fun!  This set doesn't have anything but the Shrinky Dink "paper" -- no colored pencils or stencils or anything -- but that doesn't take away from your enjoyment.  It's such a great product and great fun for a rainy day.  Just buy this, get some colored pencils and design away.

title: Beautiful Doll

Right out of the package she was hugging her and cuddling her and taking out her "binky". It's such a nice skin color, too, especially since my daughter is biracial, and it's nice to have a doll that's close to her skin color.
The cloth "diaper" was a nice surprise as well, as was the little belly button. I'm really happy with this doll. I just wish I didn't know that she has clothes and accessories that we can purchase!

They are also great for when you're constantly having to swap out the kinetic sand because they constantly makes it with dirt or other colors and then don't wanna play with it. The little castle container makes a really nice little mold. They love them, but I do hate cleaning kinetic sand a carpet.

text: These blocks are much smaller than I anticipated. They are borderline too small to be giving a toddler. They're nice. I just wish they were bigger.

text: My 8-year-old loves this car. It doesn't have a ton of power, so it definitely drives better indoors than out. Even on the texture of the driveway or sidewalk, it slows down considerably. But that doesn't seem to bother my kid too much.

title: Not Durable
text: It's not a durable toy at all. It lasted maybe three days. It was a little bit difficult to get the hang of, and once I did they liked it, until they broke it.

title: Perfect Toddler Doll
text: This doll is absolutely perfect for a toddler. It is the perfect size, and the south body makes it easy for them to hold and squish and love. The clothes do come off, so you do have to keep up with them. But overall, it is a great little doll for a little hands.

title: Small
text: This board is really cute, but it is on the small side. The “pencil” isn't attached and is quite sharp. It quickly fills down, but I do wish it were made with a more rounded tip.

title: Great Size
text: This is a great size doll for an older baby or toddler. It just fits perfectly in their little arms. Well made.

title: So Fun
text: Remember the Flying Turtle from childhood? This is like that, only faster and your legs don't get as cramped sitting on it. These things are so much fun! But do yourself a favor and get at least 2. They're a lot of fun to race.

title: Girls Love It
text: My girls love this little doll stroller. The seat does come off easily, so I do feel like I am constantly fixing it for them. But they love pushing their dolls around in this.

title: So Fun
text: This game is so fun. It is very simple and easy to learn. Even young children can learn to play this game. We had a lot of fun having a family tournament.

title: Very Durable
text: This game set is great. They have a pressed wood kind of feel. They're very durable. The kids really like them. I'm very happy with the quality.

title: Cute Crayons for Toddlers
text: These are nice little crayons for toddlers. They aren't great for precision. They don't get on their hands. They don't break easily. They're great.

title: Dinosaurs
text: These dinosaurs are really fun. They aren't as high-quality as some of the more expensive toys like this, but they are decent. The kids love them.

title: Velcro Food
text: These little foods come with little knives and cutting boards. The foods "slice" apart by separating velcro on the insides of the pieces. This is a lot of fun. You can use the foods to play kitchen or you can use them to talk about fractions. They're great. Very durable.

title: The Best
text: This comes with four complete sets (including instructions) in individual muslin bags. You can match the moods with a matching game. You can draw a mood and imitate it. My toddlers LOVE these! They're so much fun and so durable. Seriously, they can chew on them and not make a DENT!

title: Alphabet
text: These come with four sets each in their own muslin bag. They're great for gifting! The material is like a wheatgrass plastic type feel. VERY durable. We have absolutely loved these. The letters are also inset a little so you can practice "writing" the letter with your finger.

title: Fun!
text: These come in individual muslin bags. So you can easily gift them or combine them into one giant set. The material is really interesting. Very durable. Feels almost like a wheatgrass plastic. These are excellent quality. And these particular dominos are great because you can play them with younger kids who may not know their numbers yet.

title: Night Carrot
text: My three-year-old has to have a carrot to go to sleep. She calls it her "night carrot". We thought it would be funny for her to have a stuffed carrot to be her "night carrot" for whenever she outgrows her carrots in bed obsession. It is a super soft velour and is very squishy.

title: Boys Loved It
text: This little hoop is a lot of fun. The door hook is sized for indoor doors. It won't fit on outdoor doors. The hoop does fold up. The koosh ball is significantly smaller than the hoop and will not "bounce" off the backboard. My boys did think it was fun.

title: Tiny Animals
text: These are tiny animals. Not really appropriate for small children, but great for the kindergarten age. They're great to pair with Play-Doh or Moon Sand for a full fun activity. There are three boxes, each with 10 animals. You get dinosaurs, ocean animals, and farm animals. The individual quality of each piece isn't perfect. These are Schleich level toys. But they're great anyway. Small. Fun.

title: It Sings
text: My daughters love this play set. It is very cute and has lots of options for imaginative play. It does sing “Let It Go”. So be prepared for that. It gets quite annoying.

title: Good Theory
text: This is good in theory, but the reality of this is just a giant impractical mess. First, with a giant sandbox style, the colors get all mixed together. There really isn't any way to store the different colors anyway. It would be better if it were like a sand table, since it closes and such. But it is like a sand table without legs that you can close. It just ended up a giant mess. I feel like I need new sand in this almost constantly. With the smaller tabletop bowl type trays, I feel like the sand lasts forever. With this, I feel like it gets contaminated and is spilling sand out every open and close. I'm just not a fan.

title: She Loves Them
text: My baby and toddler love these little bath squirters. They're adorable and lightweight. They do have holes to suck up water and squirt, so eventually they'll have to be tossed because water gets in there and even when you squeeze it out before hanging them up to dry, I don't think you get everything out.

title: So Fun!
text: These little crates are so fun! They'd be great for a party or group. Each box contains a min shovel, kinetic sand, a full dinosaur skeleton to assemble, and one other artifact. The items in the sand are rather easy to find. The assembly of the skeleton can be done by a kid, it just takes them a little trial and error figuring out how the pieces fit. (Which I think is part of the fun of the kit.) The box can be put back together and everything put back in.

title: Easy To Assemble
text: This rocket ship is a lot of fun for a little ones. If you have carpet, it is a little bit wobbly. It is prone to tip over, as well. So the baby cannot use it to stand up. But once they can stand up on their own, they have a lot of fun with it.

title: Basic Blocks
text: This is a great set of basic blocks. They can make the things with the instructions, or they can just build whatever they want by them selves. Great for someone starting out or needing to add to their bricks. The kids loved it.

title: Tiny Set
text: This is a small set that kids will love. Super quick and easy to build. Great mini-figures.

title: Lego Set
text: This is a good Lego set. It is a little more complex with the shape of the build, but nothing too crazy. The kids liked it mostly for the Lego figures.

title: Fun Set
text: This is a fun Lego set. It is a super simple build and very basic. Great for a kid just learning to follow directions for Lego builds.

title: Good Set
text: This is a fun set of basics. My boys really loved the set. Vehicles do tend to be a little more complex to build than building. It took my 10-year-old about an hour to Complete the build.

title: Kids Loved It
text: My boys really loved this little car set. I did not love it. Tiny pieces. Tiny cars. With little ones around, this set was a headache. It is also not compatible with other car sets, since the cars for this are tiny. We decided having one size of cars was better for us.

title: Tiny Magnets
text: This activity is most fun for toddlers and preschoolers, but the magnets are really too small for them. For kids old enough to be using tiny magnets, the activity isn't very fun.

title: They Do Break
text: These are great for fidgety kids. They love them. However, they'll inevitably start swing them around and whipping each other with them. And despite the listing say they aren't easily snapped, they do break quite easily. Any kid can tear it apart.  My three year old immediately snapped the tail off. I would not consider them heavy duty at all.

title: Not the best
text: These are not the best balance boards. They are much smaller than a normal balance board. The handle also keeps it from rocking all the way to each side. They're okay for younger kids— like toddlers. Not so much for older kids. They are well made and good quality materials. They're just not as fun and functional as a full size balance board.

title: 4 Sets
text: Four sets of castle blocks come in this. Each is in its own box. You can combine them for bigger castles. But one set it big enough for a full castle. The kids really enjoy these.

title: Cute— But
text: This is a cute set. My toddler loves the play phone and camera. However, the magnifying glass came very scratched. Also, the phone has a very flimsy screen. I worry about it popping out. None of these make any noise (yay!), and they are really nice to hold. A little heavy, but not too much. Would be great if part of it wasn't completely unusable.

title: Plastic Slinky
text: These plastic slinky's are so much fun. They are double colored, so they look really cool when you move them around. The plastic is more prone to getting bent out of shape permanently. But the kids really like them. Each slinky was individually wrapped.

title: Fun Puzzle
text: This is such a fun puzzle! It is very unique and pretty funny. It is a good quality puzzle. It isn't super difficult to put together.

title: Tiny
text: This pool is tiny. It is big enough for a baby to sit in it. The spray function is not great. It sprays onto the overhang. The overhang seems dangerous. Baby can easily pull it down around them if they're trying to maneuver around the sides.

title: Hated It
text: The sides of this pit are foam encased in t-shirt material. It looks super nice-- for the first couple days. It stains like crazy. Also, my baby decided to chew on the edges. She'd bite huge chunks of foam off. Of course, she couldn't actually get the foam, it stayed inside the outer cover. But you could see all these divets and places where the foam with ripped and lumps where the bitten pieces live. (She's a pretty normal one year old and doesn't really bite things all that much, so it was surprising that she'd choose to attempt to devour this.) All in all, I just did not like this ball pit at all.

title: Smaller Than Expected
text: This little writing board was much smaller than I expected, but still big enough for the kids to use to practice letters. The stick that came with it was a little sharp and the tip dulled and frayed quite quickly, but it hasn't really been a problem. There is no way for the "pencil" to stick to the board, so it is constantly getting lost. I wish it was attached somehow. The wood is lacquered and it has little arrows printed for letter formation.

title: One Kid
text: This pool is a good size for one younger child. It isn't really large enough for multiple kids. It is deep for it's size. My three-year-old loves it.

title: Baby Walker
text: This baby walker is adorable and very well made. It is easy to put together. You only need a Phillips head screwdriver to attach the handle to the box. Everything else is preassembled. The blocks are a little on the small side, but not so small they present a chocking hazard. It is pretty sturdy for baby to use.

title: Fun Rope Swing
text: This is a fun rope swing. The rope has no give, so it holds pretty tight. It is fun to swing or climb. The kids really like it. It comes with a strap if you have a limb low enough for it.

title: Lego
text: This is a fun Lego set. It isn't huge, but it is unique in that it is a character. My boys liked it.

title: Fun Activity
text: This cardboard house is a fun activity for kids. They enjoyed putting it together and coloring it. I did find the markers work best, because it was such a large space. However, it isn't going to last. The doors and windows are perforated all the way around so they will come off. And of course the thing is cardboard so it isn't gonna last forever. But it was a nice activity and a fun little thing that worked for about a week.

title: Fun Puzzle
text: This is a decently challenging puzzle. The colors are really vivid and the puzzle was fun to put together. It took about 6 hours to assemble.

title: Fun Puzzle
text: This is a fun puzzle! The cat astronaut is amusing. It is one of those puzzles that you just smile while putting it together. The vast amounts of blue do make it a little more difficult.

title: Funniest Puzzle
text: This is one of the funniest puzzles we've ever had. It is just so amusing to see those cats in tights! It is 1000 pieces, but the high contrast in colors makes the puzzle a little easier. So, I wouldn't say it is super difficult. It was of moderate difficulty. And high amusement.

title: Slime!
text: My 5-year-old is super into Play-Doh, so I figured he could expand his horizons and see about enjoying some slime. The volcano is fun. The whole set is fun and exciting. You put slime in one place and it comes out another. It is a bit difficult to keep the slime, though. It just runs together and gets all over the place. But it provides hours of entertainment for my can't-sit-still kid!

title: They Love it
text: My 3-year-old lacks the motor skills to operate the bulky squirrel tweezers. However, she still loves to play. My 5 and 7 year olds also love this game and can use the squirrel tweezers without issue. There is some sneaky play, so it isn't super boring. But not so much that someone ends up crying about cheating. Super fun game.

title: Need Safety Googles
text: You will need safety googles for this as it does kick up a lot of dust. My 5 and 7-year-olds had a blast digging the rocks out. Set has 3 continents, which can be broken apart by hand. It comes with a little plastic pick axe and a magnifying glass with a brush on the other end. The box it comes in is transformed into a rock display box. Once they find all the gems, you can then use the book that comes with it to identify each gem. Great set. They had a blast.

title: He Loves Them
text: My 11-year-old is llama obsessed. He was absolutely thrilled with these. They hit all his preteen boxes. Surprise pack- check! Llama- check! Adorable and funny- check! He proudly displays these on his shelf.

title: Big Hit
text: My 11 year old loves Hot Wheels and he loves RC cars. This is like his dream come true. The car is the size of a standard Hot Wheel, so it can be used in a track. It is super light. This thing flies across the room! Because it is so fast and light, it does take some practice to control it well. My 11 year old thinks this is the best toy he's ever laid his hands on!

title: They Love It
text: I had intended to get this for my kindergartener. And yes, he does really like it. What surprised me was how much my 9 and 11 year olds also like it. They will sit and play for an hour or more. They like the challenge of the cards, but they have also taken to free styling their own pictures. It comes with lots of rubber bands, and you can easily replace them if you lose a few.

title: Sharp
text: These are pretty sharp and pointy. However, they cut really well. And better yet, they can be used left or right handed. (My lefties have a hard time with contoured scissors.)

title: They Love It
text: My teens and preteens are board game junkies. They like playing this game with friends because it doesn't take too long to explain to them how to play. In fact, we've since purchased another one for a friend. Good game. Fun. Different.

title: Poor Quality, But Kids Love It
text: This tent isn't great quality. It isn't built of good materials and certainly not built to last. However, the kids love it. They like the gazebo style, where they aren't trapped in it. It is pretty small, suitable for preschoolers and toddlers.

title: She Love Them
text: My 3-year-old loves these bath toys. Each doll has an attached float with a pull string that makes the doll swim through the water. The pull string is easy enough for her to use. My only complaint is that the organizer will not stay attached to the side of the bathtub once the toys are in it. I think it is too heavy. (We use other suction products in our bathtub without issue, so I know the tile isn't the issue.) Other than that, this is a fun bath toy.

title: Art for Kids
text: This kit isn't as nice as the Melissa and Doug stamp kits. It is fun. The stamp pad could be better. I ended up swapping it out for a nicer stamp pad. But the kids really enjoy the stamps.

title: Huge Dice
text: These dice are very large! They are really nice quality. The box is great for storing them. My kids who are into D&D love these massive dice. It also keeps them from getting lost. And it makes your roll seem more epic.

title: A Boots for Real Life Dora
text: My three-year-old is obsessed with Dora. Her siblings thought she needed this monkey to be her Boots so she could be Dora. She loves this monkey. It is a lot larger than I anticipated. It has soft, velour feeling fur. He does make noises. She loves it.

title: He Loves It
text: My seven year old loves this toy set. The action figures are a decent size. He thought it was great and carries them around in his backpack.

title: Magical Sea That Is Green
text: My kids get each other gifts for Christmas. My three-year-old was insistent that her baby sister needed “a magical sea that is green” for Christmas. After chuckling about it, I came across the “sea” colored play silk and realized it was perfect! The toddler proudly gave her baby sister exactly what she wanted her to have. Now the three year old will wave and toss the playbill over her baby sister. Baby sister laughs and thinks the playsilk is the most fun thing ever. The way this thing floats is quite magical. We will definitely be purchasing more of these as these little girls think they are the best thing ever.

title: Broke Quickly
text: I like the set. However, the elastic on the castanets broke with very little use. The egg shakers are very quiet. I would have given it a better review if the elastic wasn't so fragile.

title: So Fun
text: You have to put this higher than the instructions say. (They say 24” above the elevated hands on the smallest child. That puts the smallest child very barely off the ground and the taller kids can't really swing/hang at all.) So, put it higher than you think. But the kids LOVE it. We've had slack lines before, but this is like a mash up of a slack line, rope swing, and monkey bars. Great for kids working on upper body strength and coordination. The swings can be used by smaller kids, too. My kids ages 3-13 all love this thing!

title: Big Baby
text: This doll is soft, but has a good bit of weight to it. She has a sweet little face. No creepy doll vibes here. My little girls love her. Her clothes are removable.

title: Mediocre Markers
text: I was really excited to try these because the BIC crayons are just next level awesome. These, however, were a disappointment. They have a brush style tip. But the pigmentation of the markers is just mediocre. They work similarly to free markers that come in those little wooden craft kits. They're okay, but nothing spectacular. There are 2 of each color. So the color variety just isn't there. They bleed through paper pretty significantly.

title: Fun Puzzle
text: This is a fun puzzle. It is a lot the same, but slightly different— which makes it a good challenge. The pieces are all cut very similarly, so you do have to pay attention to the colors because some pieces will definitely fit even though they shouldn't. Overall a fun and challenging puzzle.

title: Tiny Little Characters
text: This is a cute set. The characters are very small, so they wouldn't be suitable for younger kids. They are small enough to be cake toppers. They make good stocking stuffers.

title: Little Rainbow
text: My 3-year-old loves this rainbow. It isn't too large or too small. It is a good size for her. She loves putting it together and taking it apart over and over. I do worry that she'll try to step on one of the bows alone and end up snapping it, but so far she hasn't done it.

title: So Fun
text: We laughed so hard we cried! It was the funniest game. We all enjoyed it. You do really have to be able to read to play properly. For the younger kids, they just handed in a random card from their hand-- which proved hilarious at times. Lots of fart talk. Definitely not a game for those easily embarrassed. My five boys and I thought it was great!

title: So Fun!
text: These Voomerangs are so much fun! We had fun learning to throw them. They're very lightweight, like a foam core board or corrugated plastic. You throw them up and they come back to you. It does take a few tries to really perfect the throw-- but these are so much fun! My kids ages 5-14 were able to play. It is fun for kids, teens, and adults.

title: So Fun
text: My older four kids (ages 9-14) and I had so much fun playing this game! It is such a fun game. It is really easy to learn. It was full of laughs and jokes! We had such a fun time playing this game. We all enjoyed it.

title: Extra Battery!
text:
Please note that this comes with an extra button battery. If your child pulls it out of the package, you may miss the button battery hiding inside. And we all know how awful a loose/lost button battery is! Please be aware of that.
The stylus is a little bulky and it didn't come with a ribbon or way to attach the stylus and the tablet. It has a place to do so, it just didn't come with anything to attach.
The tablet also doesn't have a “Lock Screen” switch. It has magnets on the back so you could use it for list making and such, but without the ability to lock the screen— that is living on the edge. It works fine for a kid drawing and doodling, but I wouldn't trust the list making since a bump to the erase button disappears your list for good.

title: Kids Love It
text: My kids (ages 9-14) play some sort of D&D hybrid game that they've created. They go through so much graph paper, I figured these mats would save me some money in graph paper. Not only do they save the graph paper, but these are huge! These are poster sized grids. It comes with straighteners for the sides, dry erase markers, and an eraser along with the grids. They absolutely love them.

title: They Love It
text: My boys (ages 5-9) love playing with this game. They love the challenge of stacking the dinosaurs. It is not easy! Great game for developing motor skills!

title: Just What We Were Looking For
text: My toddler is suddenly obsessed with Dora. This doll is perfect. It is super simple, no bells or whistles. Just a simple doll. She absolutely loves it.

title: So Fun
text: This game is so fun. Having a gigantic version just makes it so much better. My kids love it. Adults even have a great time playing. It is a little bit more work since when you dump all of the pieces they're all over the ground and you have to then go around pick them up, but the giant size amps up the fun considerably.

title: Not The Best Crayons
text: These crayons are not the best. In terms of quality, you're looking at mid-range quality with these. Really, the appeal is that they come in blank kraft paper boxes-- meaning you can label them any way you wish. This is great for a church, club, or business. You can stamp or sticker your own label onto the box and they look super nice! Again, the actual crayons are mediocre. But the blank boxes are awesome for advertising or even turning into Valentines or Party Favors.

title: Love
text: My boys loved this activity. They had so much fun excavating gemstones. I did have to pull out a few more "tools". They wanted bigger paintbrushes and toothbrushes like "real" archaeologists. And since it only comes with one set of digging tools and I had three boys giving it a go, I needed a couple more picks for digging. Once they found all the gemstones, they had a lot of fun figuring out what they had. The little cards do contain quite a few typos. Those really could have been better. But overall, it was a really fun activity and my boys (ages 5-9) loved it.

title: Smooth and Challenging
text: My teenage son is very into these cubes right now. He was super excited to try this challenging cube. It has 36 tiles on each side. It spins pretty smoothly for there to be so many moving parts.

title: Good Puzzle
text: This puzzle is not such a challenge you can't complete it in one evening. But it is not so easy that it isn't enjoyable. The colors add to the fun of this puzzle. Definitely one you can enjoy a few times!

title: Nice Quality
text: This binder is very nice quality. It comes with tons of card slots. It also has 3 D-rings inside, so you can add more card pages if you need to. The feel is super soft, like imitation leather. It is very large. And since it zips, you don't have to worry about cards falling out.

title: Doors Pop Off
text: My little kids (2, 4, and 6) loved this tree until the doors started popping off shortly after we got it. I think it doesn't have enough variety or use. It doesn't encourage imaginative play at all and there are such limited ways to use it. But they thought it was wonderful until the doors started popping off and then it just made them mad.

title: Just Okay
text: This isn't the highest quality. The kids enjoyed it and I think they learned by making it. But it wasn't really as nice as others I have seen. It was pretty cheap craft quality.

title: Great Crayons
text: These crayons are so much different than typical crayons. These are more like the Japanese style crayons. They're harder and can be sharpened to a pencil-like point with a standard handheld pencil sharpener. They're not super waxy. They color in an even way. The finish is similar to a colored pencil, but not quite. They're completely paperless. They don't break as easily as regular crayons. The point on them lasts a really long time. These are definitely an upgrade on crayons!

title: Nice Chess Set
text: My teenage son has gotten very into chess. He started with a plastic chess set to learn, and wanted something nicer. This set is perfect for him. He can store all the pieces inside the box. The pieces are nice and sturdy, with felt on the bottoms. The chessboard is numbered and lettered.

title: Smaller Board
text: These little boards are excellent practice for little ones. They do make a little click clack he sound, but are otherwise quite quiet. They're easy to use. My little ones love them. This board is smaller than the letter boards.

title: Big Letter
text: These little boards are excellent practice for little ones. They do make a little click clack he sound, but are otherwise quite quiet. They're easy to use. My little ones love them.

title: Great Practice
text: These little boards are excellent practice for little ones. They do make a little click clack he sound, but are otherwise quite quiet. They're easy to use. My little ones love them.

title: Homeschool Math
text: We use these giant dice for homeschool math. The 2.5” ones aren't massive. Kids can easily handle them. The dots are nice and big so we can count them easily. A lot of fun for learning to add. Also a lot of fun to play Yahtzee!

title: Legos
text: My boys really enjoyed this Lego set. I'm not a Lego expert. All I can say is that they were super happy to see the set and super happy to build it. It took them about half an hour to complete the build.

title: Fun!
text: This set is a lot of fun. Good, quiet fun. However, the pieces are really small. If you don't take care to help little guys put up all the pieces, you'll very quickly end up with tiny magnets all over your house.

title: Fun
text: This set is a lot of fun. Good, quiet fun. However, the pieces are really small. If you don't take care to help little guys put up all the pieces, you'll very quickly end up with tiny magnets all over your house. The kids really like these.

title: A Bath Toy?
text: This did not feel like a bath toy. It felt like we just stuck a random toy in the bathtub. It has lots of little nooks and cranies in the hard plastic that will mold because they don't quite dry properly.

title: They Love Them
text: My little guys all love these blocks. They love playing with wooden blocks, but this set has some more interesting shapes and bright colors that their standard wooden blocks don't have. They like them.

title: Great Set
text: My 12-year-old son got a basic cube last Christmas. He obsessed so much and then found out they make other sizes and shapes. He has been absolutely thrilled with this set. The basic 9 square cube is a speed cube, so it turns super easy. The pyramid has been a nice challenge. My 5-year-old even loves to pick them up and play. Like a fidget toy— but with a point.

title: Pretty Okay
text: I would not call this large. It is pretty heavy, but not so much that a kid can't lift and carry it. The scent is very distinctly lavender. It is pretty soft. It is cute. I'm just not entirely sold on the concept because of the size. It seems like a weighted blanket is just a better option because there isn't much of this to lay on you anywhere. You can set it in your lap while you sit, but that doesn't seem to have the same calming effect as a blanket.

title: Fun Math Game
text: My preschooler really loves this math game. Rolling dice is a big hit for little guys. He loves using the bug to shake the dice up before rolling. This game is fun and educational. You can play with one kid or several kids.

title: Her Favorite Doll
text: This bath doll has a swimsuit material body and little beads inside. It has a hanging loop on the back of the neck to hang to dry once she is wet. For whatever reason, this is my daughter's favorite doll. She carries her around everywhere. The arms and legs and head are harder plastic, but the body is super floppy.

title: Doll Crib
text: My toddler loves this doll crib. We use it to keep her babies when she isn't playing with them. She drags it all over the house. It is not super sturdy. I frequently have to fix it when she is a little too rough with it.

title: Lego Friends
text: The Lego Friends sets are typically easier to build than standard Lego sets of the same size. They just have a lot more accessory pieces and a lot fewer actual building pieces. That said, my girls like them. They aren't challenging but do provide the opportunity for pretend play.

title: Doll Clothes
text: This little outfit fits the Glitter Girl dolls. I don't know about dolls because we have the Glitter Girls. They hold up, even when washed in the washing machine. My daughters love them.

title: Doll Clothes
text: This little outfit fits the Glitter Girl dolls. I don't know about dolls because we have the Glitter Girls. They hold up, even when washed in the washing machine. My daughters love them.

title: Adorable Kit for Younger Kids
text: This Lego set is great for younger kids. It wouldn't be much of a challenge for an older kid.

title: Low Quality
text: This magnet set is fun for learning, but I feel like the quality of this company is going down in recent years.

title: Baby Didn't Like It
text: The baby wasn't a fan. It is a cute idea, I guess. But the baby didn't have any interest in kicking things. She wanted to grab things.

title: 4-Year-Old Loves Them
text: My four year old loves these little racers. He races and we decide if we're racing shapes or colors. They're a lot of fun.

title: Doll Accessory
text: This is a cute little market for your dolls to go shopping or work. It is definitely adorable and doll sized.

title: Great Toy
text: This little box train set is perfect! You can play at home or on the go. The pieces store right in the box, which you can close up and take with you. Great to have on hand when the kids need something quiet to do.

title: Great Toy
text: This little box train set is perfect! You can play at home or on the go. The pieces store right in the box, which you can close up and take with you. Great to have on hand when the kids need something quiet to do.

title: Perfect
text: My older kids have a rope swing that they play on for hours at a time. The little kids were feeling left out. This swing is perfect for them! It was super easy to set up on a tree limb in the yard. Multiple kids can swing together. All the kids love this swing.

title: My Boys Love These
text: My boys love Top Trumps cards. They would play with them for hours. We're talking 4-year-olds through 13-year-olds happily playing together. They want all the sets.

title: My Boys Love These
text: My boys love Top Trumps cards. They would play with them for hours. We're talking 4-year-olds through 13-year-olds happily playing together. They want all the sets.

title: Fun
text: This was so fun! I set it up for a group of my kids and their friends to play. They had a blast. Unfortunately, it didn't last long. By the time they were done playing after a couple of hours of tournament-style play, they'd broken baskets off and it had to be tossed. Would have been great if it had lasted more than one day.

title: So Fun
text: This is a fun project for any dinosaur loving kid. It would be great for a homeschool project, as well. My boys absolutely loved this. It makes a lot of dust, so definitely do this outside. It took a couple hours for the boys to free the dinosaur from the plaster.

title: Batman Kid Loves It
text: I wouldn't say this is the first choice Batman toy for a kid. But with our Batman loving kid who seemed to have everything else Batman related, this was a nice addition to his BatCave. He loved it. It doesn't come with any figures or anything-- just the car.

title: Cheap Quality
text: The quality of this is just poor. It is very cheaply made. It didn't last very long with the kids using it.

title: Okay
text: We like the globe, I just wasn't the biggest fan of the talking part. The kids didn't seem very into it. I thought it would appeal to the lower elementary kids. They loved looking at the globe and finding different things on it. They didn't care about the "game" portion at all. Should have just got them a regular old globe.

title: Table is Not Sturdy
text: These blocks are fine. They're cute. They're fun. However, the table collapses under pressure. Not great when you're talking about little kids playing at it. It isn't very tall. If a little one tries to pull up on it or leans on it while they play, it'll collapse under their weight. The blocks are a keeper, but the table, not so much.

title: Super Cheap
text: My son insisted on this Slappy and saved up his money to buy it. I feel really bad for him. The dummy is just terrible quality for the price. It should have been half or a third of the price. The packaging is cheap. The doll is cheap. His clothes won't stay on. You move his mouth with a pull string that require quite a lot of force to pull. The dummy has no weight to it, so it is hard to get it to sit properly on your lap. It is pretty large, but very cheaply made. I feel bad my son saved his money for this thing. He's a huge Goosebumps fan, but was clearly disappointed in his purchase.

title: She Loves Them
text: My 14 year old loves these. She's into Dungeons and Dragons and likes having extra dice around to encourage friends to play. She really liked this set. The box and the cup are both keepable and useful to store dice.

title: Cute Bear
text: This little bear is super adorable and soft. It has perfectly totable arms and legs. The headband the body are stuffed more firmly than the arms and legs. The fur is super soft, almost minky feeling.

title: Toddler Pool
text: My 2-year-old likes to lay on her belly in water and just wallow around. That is her idea of a great time in the pool. A regular pool is too deep for her wallowing. This is perfect! We can fill it with a couple inches of water and she can wallow to her little heart's content. It is a decent size for her to move around. The bottom is inflatable, as well, so it has padding all around. She really enjoys it.

title: Need the O-Ring
text: This sprinkler pad is a little smaller than it appears in photos. There is no reinforcement around the sprinkler holes. They are just tiny holes in the plastic where the water comes out. When hooking it up to the hose, you definitely have to have the plastic O-ring that comes in the little accessories pouch. Without it, the water just spills out from the hose connection. The middle portion does accumulate some water and it does get very slippery. It ends up being a little slippy slide pad. My kids enjoy it. I just doubt it makes it to the end of the summer.

title: Fun Team Version
text: This version of Monopoly is quicker than standard Monopoly and you're divided into teams. The team approach makes it easy for younger kids to get in on the Monopoly fun without having a clear understanding of the game. If they can roll a dice and count, they can play! The rules are a bit different than monopoly and money only comes in 100s and 500s. It is a simplified, but fun, version of Monopoly.

title: Glitter Girl
text: These dolls are a fraction of the price of the expensive version. My daughter loves these. She loves their clothes and shoes. The hair can get a bit messy, but it is easy to sort back out with conditioner or fabric softener and a comb.

title: Glitter Girl
text: These dolls are a fraction of the price of the expensive version. My daughter loves these. She loves their clothes and shoes. The hair can get a bit messy, but it is easy to sort back out with conditioner or fabric softener and a comb.

title: Glitter Girl
text: These dolls are a fraction of the price of the expensive version. My daughter loves these. She loves their clothes and shoes. The hair can get a bit messy, but it is easy to sort back out with conditioner or fabric softener and a comb.

title: Glitter Girl
text: These dolls are a fraction of the price of the expensive version. My daughter loves these. She loves their clothes and shoes. The hair can get a bit messy, but it is easy to sort back out with conditioner or fabric softener and a comb.

title: Glitter Girl
text: These dolls are a fraction of the price of the expensive version. My daughter loves these. She loves their clothes and shoes. The hair can get a bit messy, but it is easy to sort back out with conditioner or fabric softener and a comb.

title: Cute Doll
text: These dolls are a fraction of the price of the expensive version. My daughter loves these. She loves their clothes and shoes. The hair can get a bit messy, but it is easy to sort back out with conditioner or fabric softener and a comb.

title: Daughter Loves Her
text: My daughter loves this doll. She is super floppy. She has some kind of foam pellets inside. Her body is swim suit material. This is a perfect doll for summer outdoor play or playing in the bath. The doll also has a loop so you can hang her to dry.

title: Too Many Pieces
text: It is so cute for a pull along. But it comes completely apart. So kids young enough to enjoy a pull along toy can't put it together. Kids old enough to put it together don't have any interest in pulling it around. As a pull along, it should not come apart. As a building toy, it shouldn't have wheels and a string.

title: Looks Scuffy Forever
text: It looks awful when you get it. Even after washing and drying, it looks like a law machine toy that you picked up at a sketchy thrift shop.

title: Cute But Not Functional
text: This is such a cute idea. However, it didn't work out so well in practice. The desk comes off of the stuffed animal. The desk portion is small. The markers that come with it don't come off the desk. The puppy ended up being too lumpy and weird to provide a good writing surface. Just didn't work well.

title: Don't Leave Outdoors!
text: These dodgeballs are pretty soft, but they are also heavy enough to throw with accuracy. The only problem is that they have a slight hole in the bottom of each “skin” and the foam is ever so slightly exposed. If you leave them outside, they get water logged up in the foam and there is no way to rescue them. So keep your dodgeballs dry and indoors!

title: Unicorn
text: My daughter loves this little unicorn. It is well made and is a great size for her little toddler hands. It is super soft and colorful.

title: Legos
text: This set was a big hit with my boys. It wasn't a particularly challenging build. But they loved the character and the fact that he had a lightsaber.

title: Small Parts
text: These are cute alternatives to paper dolls. However, you should be VERY aware that this contains lots of small magnets. If your kid still puts things in their mouth at all, skip this! It does come with a nice wooden box to keep it all sorted. And it is a great quiet activity.

title: Cute Little Guy
text: This little guy is so adorable. The various textures made it a real hit with the little one. The hair is looped. It isn't fluffy fur, but has a nice corded feel to it. It is really cute and really well made. (Even held up in the washing machine after an unfortunate incident.)

title: Legos
text: My boys are big LEGO fans. This is a smaller set, so it goes together pretty quickly. They really enjoy it.

title: Messy
text: No where on the small package does it indicate this is an eraser. So, you have to inform kids what they are, or they'll open it and try to eat it before you get the chance. As a kneaded eraser, they do work, but not extremely well. They are pretty messy in the hands of younger kids. If you accidentally wash them in a pocket, they are awful to get out of he fabric.

title: 12 Year Old Love Him
text: These are the weirdest looking stuffed animals. They don't “do” anything. They just look super creepy. My 12 year old son thinks they are the funniest, best thing in the world. The teeth really make the creep factor. I'm not entirely sure what the appeal is, but he loves it. It is well built.

title: Huge!
text: This magnifying glass was much larger than I anticipated. It has a nice handle for little hands. It is perfect for little ones to explore without worrying about them breaking glass. I'm very happy with the quality.

title: Kids Love It
text: My kids love this thing. It isn't extremely accurate all the time. It does sometimes have a difficult time "hearing" if you're in a louder area. But the kids found it to be quite fun and if you pick pretty basic Pokemon, it'll guess them correctly.

title: Huge Set
text: My boys were ecstatic to put this set together. It took them 2 days to put it together completely. (They are 9 and 11 years old.) The instructions were easy to follow and it was broken up into steps with each bag, so it wasn't an overwhelming undertaking.

title: Kids Love It
text: My four year old picked this out and he absolutely loves it. It comes with several containers of Play-Doh (most of them brown). It has an extruder where you push the Play-Doh through to create the shape of your choice. And then it has these Mr.Potato-Head-like pieces that you push into the Play-Doh to give your creation a face or arms or whatever it is you want. It also comes with a rolling pin and plastic knife. Again, the kids think it is awesome.

title: Pillow Cat
text: This cat is roughly the size of a standard pillow. It makes an excellent sleep away lovey/pillow. My 7-year-old absolutely loves it. It has a decent amount of stuffing, so it is actually decently comfortable as a pillow. Plus it is adorable.

title: Better Than Corn Hole
text: My kids like this more than regular corn hole. They find it easier and more fun to play. It reminds me of ski ball. It is fun.

title: Foam Letter Magnets
text: I wanted to like these. My kids love using magnets and so I thought Letter magnets would be awesome. These look nice at first. They have a mesh storage bag, which is awesome. However, the letters are foam. They aren't durable at all. They are quickly warped and mangled by little hands (and teeth). Maybe if you had some miraculous preschooler who could control themselves and not put the squishy foam magnet into their mouth, they'd hold up for that mythical child. For daily use, these aren't durable enough. Wooden magnets are really a much better way to go.

title: Fidget Toy
text: This is such a fun little toy! The little suction cups are a lot of fun to fidget with. The kids all really like it. This jr. version is their preferred version.

title: Adorable Mystery Baby
text:
I absolutely love these. They are so adorable! Cute little swaddles. The surprise of it all. We got a boy baby and he was anatomically correct.
So why not five stars? Price. These are so overpriced. They are tiny. While fun, it is more of a novelty— like a vending machine toy. They are definitely overpriced for what you are actually getting— which is too bad, since a more reasonable price point would encourage me to certainly buy more.

title: Fun Set
text: My kids live Legos. LEGO Creator 3-in-one sets have instructions for three builds. You have to reuse the same blocks, so you can't have all three things at once. It is an excellent way for kids to learn to read and follow directions.

title: Ducky Baby
text: My seventeen-month-old really likes this little duck baby. The fabric on the outfit is so soft! The outfit is removable, but there is nothing underneath. The baby's body is fabric. Hands, feet, and head are plastic. It is the perfect size for smaller hands.

title: Animal Baby
text: This is a such a fun little baby doll! It is sized nicely for little hands. They smell a bit like baby powder. Under the animal print outfit, there is just a naked doll. The hands to the elbows, legs to the knees, and head are all plastic. The body is fabric. The baby can suck it's thumb. Eyes stay open.

title: Donut
text: This little pillow/plushie is so adorable. It is a decent size. Big enough to look like a throw pillow on my tween's bed. Plus it comes with little “extra” surprises. It smells nice, but not super strong.

title: Beautiful Doll
text: This is the most beautiful doll. It is a significant size and it is weighted. The eyes stay open. It has beautiful lashes. Her little face is so beautiful. It looks so much like a porcelain doll, but it is a friendly plastic that a child can actually play with.  Clothes are removable. Body is muslin fabric. Arms, legs, and head are plastic.

title: Cute Pillow
text: Such an adorable pillow. My tween daughter loves it. So cute and relaxing to flips the sequins back and forth.

title: Looks Like Porcelain
text: This is the most beautiful doll. It is a significant size and it is weighted. The eyes stay open. It has beautiful lashes. Her little face is so beautiful. It looks so much like a porcelain doll, but it is a friendly plastic that a child can actually play with.  Clothes are removable. Body is muslin fabric. Arms, legs, and head are plastic.

title: Beautiful Doll
text: This is the most beautiful doll. It is a significant size and it is weighted. The eyes stay open. It has beautiful lashes. Her little face is so beautiful. It looks so much like a porcelain doll, but it is a friendly plastic that a child can actually play with.  Clothes are removable. Body is muslin fabric. Arms, legs, and head are plastic.

title: Beautiful Doll
text: This is the most beautiful doll. It is a significant size and it is weighted. The eyes stay open. It has beautiful lashes. Her little face is so beautiful. It looks so much like a porcelain doll, but it is a friendly plastic that a child can actually play with.  Clothes are removable. Body is muslin fabric. Arms, legs, and head are plastic.

title: Classic Pieces
text: My kids call these boxes "extra" pieces boxes. But they do come with idea books to build specific things in the set. They are great for early builders who are just learning to follow directions or for those who toss the directions straight into the trash anyway. This set has 300 pieces, which isn't many in the world of Legos. This is a small or small/medium sized kit.

title: Bath Baby
text: This little bath time baby is so cute. The float isn't the best quality and was quickly popped by a rambunctious brother. The little doll has a fabric body that dries pretty quickly when you hang her on the towel rack after a bath. She has her own little towel to use at the end of bathtime. This is definitely a fun alternative to the rubber ducky.

title: Little Baby
text: My sixteen-month-old uses this as her travel baby doll. It does smell like baby powder. It is just a small, basic baby doll. The clothes are removable. It is small enough for tiny toddler hands.

title: The Kids Love Them
text: The kids would give these 5/5 stars. They love them. The little animals are cute. They love the floam. The mother (me) would give these 3/5 stars. Little foam bits tend to always escape. The little animals are made sticky by the foam. And the animals are tiny choking hazards for the baby. The foam also gets mixed really quickly, leaving some unappealing colors. They are fun for the kids. They aren't super messy, just minor messes with escaping foam balls occasionally.

title: Super Cute Puppy
text: My three-year-old is an animal lover. He drives our poor dogs crazy, so we thought a Little Live Pet might give them a break from him. We were right. He loves this thing as much as his real dogs-- and it isn't annoyed by his poking and prodding.

title: Fun Game
text: This is like a hipster animal version of Guess Who. My kids all really like it. It is simple enough for my three-year-old to play. Fun enough for my twelve-year-old to play. The animals are all really cute. It is pretty much all cardboard, so I'm not too sure about longevity. However, those cheap plastic versions aren't really any better.

title: Original Big Wheel
text: Do you remember riding a Big Wheel when you were a kid? This is so much like the original. The seat has three positions depending on the size of the child. They can be used by 3-year-olds and 10-year-olds. They are so much fun. It is different from a standard tricycle in that your legs are straight in front of you, so it is not the same type of peddling motion.

title: Fun Set
text: This set took my 11-year-old and 9-year-old about half an hour to assemble. They said it was pretty easy. They love the NINJAGO Lego sets. They are kind of a steampunk kind of thing, which the boys seem to really enjoy. This set would be too complicated for younger builders, probably a doable challenge for the 7-year-old builder.

title: Small Set
text: This is a tiny set. My daughter jokingly said it was Rapunzel's shed, not her tower. The tower is barely large enough to hold the figure. It does open. And it has her brush. It is a nice set for younger kids who are building their “following directions” skills.

title: Simple Lego Set
text: This Lego set is pretty small and simple. My 7-year-old had no trouble assembling it on his own. It is a good set for the younger crowd transitioning into full sets. Or it'd be good for the person who needs to add to their Star Wars Lego collection. It is a small, quick set for the more advanced builder. It would have taken my 11-year-old 10 minutes or less to build this set.

title: Fun Game!
text: A good game. Creative. Our kids (9-12) enjoy it, but they are a bit confused by it, especially explaining to one another how to play it.

title: Harry Potter
text: My eleven year old loves all things Harry Potter. This is a fun, easy game she can play alone or with her younger brothers. She loves it.

title: Water Everywhere Baby
text: I dreamed of a water baby as a child. So, I naturally assumed my child would want one. Turns out she is terrified of dolls. That issue aside, because it isn't the fault of the doll, this thing was terrible to fill. It took a lot of time to get the baby filled properly with the crazy funnel. Then, a couple weeks into her sitting around and terrifying my daughter, she springs a leak around the back seal. Such a mess! I'm scared to fill her back up because of the disaster it would be if she sprung a leak in the toy box! So, we now have a waterless baby that sits around terrifying my daughter.

title: They Love It
text: My 9 and 11-year-olds love this K'NEX set. They love building toys in general, but the K'NEX add a little extra challenge for them that they really like. The "Ride It" App portion of the toy is useless since we don't allow children to use cell phones in our house. But they still enjoyed the building aspect of the toy.

title: Toddler Favorite
text: My three-year-old loves these all in one Thomas train sets. These seem much easier for him to use than other train sets. This isn't a set you can add to or transform. This isn't the wooden Thomas train stuff. These plastic sets are just very toddler-friendly.

title: Annoying, But Cute
text: This vacuum is so annoying to have to listen to. However, my sixteen month old loves it so much that it is just the most adorable thing. But the songs over and over and over will drive you crazy. If only this thing actually vacuumed-- my floors would be so clean because she "vacuums" for quite a while every day.

title: Little Kid Power Wheel
text: This power wheel is appropriately sized for a toddler. It is not powerful enough to be carrying around kids over 35 lbs. or so. It is a little annoying to charge. I feel like I'm rebuilding it every time I need to charge it. You'd think they could make it simpler these days. The battery does last quite a while-- I only have to charge it about once a week.

title: Third Time Buying
text: We had this for my older kids when they were little. It taught them all their letters. We went through two sets for them. I didn't have one for my middle kids, and found it a little more difficult to teach phonics when the time came. So, we bought a new one for my younger kids to get acquainted with the letters before they begin phonics. It goes well with The Letter Factory DVD. I'm not a fan of the non-letter special magnets. They have expanded it a bit since the original and it no longer just sings the Letter Factory song for each letter. It has a few phrases for each letter. I think I preferred the simplicity of the original, but since this is what they currently have, I'll deal with it.

title: Phone Home
text: The volume on this phone is perfect. Not too loud at all. My baby loves it! It is quiet enough not to be super annoying.

title: Fun Set
text: My 15 month old and my 3 year old love this. You can race a car down the hill. Or you can fold it up and put balls in to hammer. The set it wood and is really good quality.

title: T-Rex
text: My boys love this T-Rex. I'd say that I like the Schleich T-Rex better. But this one moves and makes noise, so my boys love it.

title: Overwatch Legos
text: My son loves Legos and loves Overwatch. This was a perfect set for him. He had such a great time putting it together. The set wasn't too complex for him.

title: Knock-Off Giant Yahtzee
text: This is a giant version of Yahtzee. The dice are huge. With rambunctious boys, it turned out to be a very bad idea to give them these and tell them to "toss" them. It was a disaster. The dice are made of solid wood. It comes with a laminated score sheet. I thought it would be an awesome family thing, but I was very wrong.

title: Proper Puppy
text: This little guy is perfect to go with the book! We love Gaston! The story (not included) is so cute and having the little French bulldog makes it magical. I will forever love book character toys above TV character toys.

title: Over watch Legos
text: This is a smaller and quicker set to build. It took my eleven year old about half an hour to build. But it is a lot of fun. The boys absolutely loved it. They are always fans of vehicles. I know nothing about Overwatch, but my boys are big fans.

title: Not As Good As Schleich
text: We usually purchase Schleich figures, but my son saw the snow dragon and had to have him. This guy isn't as detailed as a Schleich figure. I felt like some of the details were a bit sloppy. This is solid white with a few red details. It does glow in the dark. I'm just not impressed with the level of detailing, especially since the price point is so similar to the much better quality Schleich figures. I'm pretty disappointed, but my son is happy with his snow dragon.

title: Great Tiles
text: My kids love these tiles. They work the same as the name brand ones. I really appreciate them including two different triangles. The triangles are always a little more challenging for younger ones to work with and I appreciate them being included to help them work out some more difficult geometric challenges.

title: Half Guitar
text: This little guitar is half of a regular guitar. It has the bottom three strings so it is easier for a kid to play. The Loog app has a tuner, chord charts, and songs for them to learn. Physically, the guitar would fit a child as young as three. However, I think it is developmentally closer to age 5-7. The guitar is adorable. Strings are nylon, like a ukulele.

title: Aquaman
text: This is an excellent action figure of Aquaman. He has on the suit from the new movie, which looks much more true to the original. He is pretty basic, but I really prefer that in action figures.

title: Friendship Bracelets
text: My 9 and 12 year olds are very into crafts. They love making things. They love Rainbow Loom so much, I decided they might like this, too. And I was right. They love making bracelets on this thing. Definitely right up their alley.

title: Batmobile
text: My 7 year old loves Batman! All my boys (3, 5, 7, 9, and 11) love Imaginext sets. This car is a lot of fun. Batman has to have some way to get around. My boys love it. It isn't the original Batmobile. This is a Ninja Batmobile.

title: Batman Imaginext
text: My 7 year old is a Batman fanatic. He is also a big fan of Imaginext sets. He, along with his 5 year old brother and 9 year old brother, can play with these sets for hours. The Ooze Pit gives them another location for Batman to work. If I were only purchasing one set, I'd definitely go for the Bat Cave and not this one. But if they already have a Bat Cave, this is a great next set.

title: Good Quality
text: I needed a couple of these masks for my kids for Halloween. They absolutely loved them. They were surprisingly good quality. So fun. The elastics were a little large on my 5 and 3 year olds, so I tied a small loop in them to make them fit better.

title: Ninjago Legos
text: My 9 and 11 year old boys LOVE this Lego set. They loves Legos. They love Ninjago. This set took them about an hour to build. They love it.

title: Ninjago Legos
text: My 11 and 9 year old boys absolutely LOVE this set. They love Legos. They love Ninjago. So, of course, this set it perfect for them. It is a larger set and took them a little over an hour to complete.

title: Batman Legos
text: This is a smaller LEGO set. My 11 year old built it in about twenty minutes. He loves it. Can't go wrong with LEGOs.

title: Jurassic Park RC
text: My boys love Jurassic Park. This RC vehicle is something they really enjoyed. It doesn't go too very fast, but is fun. The remote is pretty basic and easy to use.

title: Lego Person
text: This LEGO Set isn't like a normal set. It does work with normal Legos but it has a lot of special pieces. My 9 and 11 year olds love it. It has a lot of pieces (over 500) but only takes about half an hour to build. (That is, it takes two LEGO crazy boys half an hour to build.) It is pretty large once completed. A little shorter than a standard action figure, but pretty big by LEGO people standards.

title: Batman Legos
text: This is a fun LEGO Set. My 9 and 11 year old boys love it. The instructions were easy for them to follow. The set was completed in about half an hour or so. So, not a huge or extensive set by any means. Batman fans and LEGO fans will love it.

title: Sequined Unicorn
text: This unicorn is so much fun! The sequin flipping is so relaxing. It is really hard to stop touching it. The unicorn is a great size. It looks really cute on the bed. I'm not entirely sure about the stickers that came with it- I just don't think they enhance the product at all. But the stuffed unicorn is awesome. My tween daughter loves it!

title: Fun!
text: My boys love Imaginext. They also love Jurassic World. This is an awesome set for them. They get all the things they like! It is perfect for my 5 and 7 year olds, though the 3, 9, and 11 year olds definitely get in on the fun, as well.

title: She Likes It
text: My one year old really does like this activity table. It is very cute and has a variety of toys to play with in different ways. You will need batteries if you want it to make music. (Pro tip: if you never put the batteries in, they don't know what they are missing and you don't have to deal with the extra noise.) The music isn't super annoying. I do have a couple issues that I dislike. One is that the corner toys come off easily. And they only fit into one specific corner (each is notched differently) so the kid can take them out, but can't get them back in. The second issue is that the table is so light, it moves as they lean on it. My one year old isn't a walker- she's a cruiser. So, she pulls up on the table to play, but then as she plays and leans on the table, it moves. I have to get it in a corner if I don't want it to run away on her. It slides on both carpet and hard floor. It seems like they could have stuck some grip something on the bottom of the legs to help with that.

title: Great Set
text: This toy is a must have for the little Jurassic World fan. Imaginext sets are so well done. They leave plenty of room for imagination and creativity while giving your child their favorite characters and places! This set is a hit with my kids.

title: Velcro Ball
text: My kids really enjoyed this set. The ball is a little light- I think a tennis ball worked better. But the kids had fun playing catch with these cute little mitts.

title: Bang the Drum
text: This is an adorable little toy. It is wood and plastic. Babies and young toddlers love causation, so this is the perfect little toy for them. Hit the drum and things happen! So exciting for them. The quality sound you'd expect from Baby Einstein toys. (If you aren't familiar, that would be good. The sound is good, the music is playful but not obnoxious.)

title: Super Racers
text: These adorable little cars are a delight to my 3 year old. They are pretty basic, but that is a good thing! It is a little odd that the set includes all heros except for the one villain. I would think it'd either be all heros or it would be a little more of a mix.

title: Sea Life Puppets
text: These are simple terry cloth hand puppets. They are very similar to puppets you'd use as wash clothes in the bath. They are really cute and simple to use.

title: Old Aquaman
text: I like this set. Imaginext is always a winner with my imaginative kids. They love them. However, this is not the newest version of Aquaman- this is an older, brighter version. My kids loved looking up the different versions and comparing- but were initially bummed it wasn't “their” Aquaman.

title: Not Durable Enough
text: This is a weird version over hover pong. You get ping pong balls and try to get them into the cups. It might be fun if the whole thing was made a little better. The perimeter is just cheap suction cups and string. The cups are multiple pieces for some unknown reason. This hung didn't last more than one game. Bummer- because it is fun. But not made to last at all.

title: Ruh-Roh!
text: My kids love Imaginext. Scooby Doo Imaginext is amazing! My kids are 3, 5, 7, 9, And 11- And they all love this set! It really appeals to all of them. They are so funny coming up with mysteries for Scooby to solve!

title: Busted
text: I never got this to work. It is cute. But ours was a complete dud. We tried taking it apart to replace batteries and it was just- more advanced inside than we were prepared for. It should have worked. It didn't.

title: Dino Truck
text: My five year old is obsessed with Jurassic Park. He loves this toy. It hits the boy vehicle obsession and the dinosaur obsession. The Owen figure from his remote control gyrosphere also fits into this vehicle.

title: So Fun
text: This was such a fun activity! You get three dinosaur skeletons and five colors of clay. You cover the skeletons with the clay. It is so simple, but my boys had so much fun. The clay does not dry, so that did prove to be a bit of a problem after the craft was finished. But it was so much fun. You get really awesome dinosaurs. And you can add googly eyes that also come in the box!

title: Huge
text: This is so super soft and so huge! I was not expecting it to be quite so large. My baby loves tackling it. The fabric feels like a micro velour fabric. It squishes so nicely.

title: Letters
text: These cute little elephants are a hit with my 3 and 5 year olds. One is learning his letters, the other is beginning to learn to read. These elephants are good for both! The connection isn't very secure- more like barrel of monkey type connection. They stand up on the table. It is a cute little hands on learning tool.

title: Bat Cav
text: My 5, 7, and 9 year olds love Imaginext. The 3 year old plays with the characters, but not the sets. My 11 year old is “too old”, or so he tells me. This batcave is awesome- if you don't already have an Imaginext batcave. It is so similar to the original Imaginext brave, I cant imagine why you'd need both. Of course, my boys disagreed. They told me it was totally different and two very similar batcave next to each other is totally reasonable. These are the slightly grown up version of Little People sets. And my boys love them.

title: Tub “Stickers”
text: My three year old loves these foam bath toys. You can mix and match the heads and the bodies. They come in a net that you can suction to the tub. They can dry in the net. They stick with just being a little wet. They aren't actual stickers, just foam pieces that “stick” to the tub wall when wet. My three year old would stay in the tub all day for these.

title: So Cute
text: These are so much fun! Each Pop has 2 little plushies and 4 surprises. They are really heavy on the wrapping. So much trash! Both of the plushies in mine smelled like frosted donuts. They smelled like the little white powdered donuts in the little packs. The Pop stand comes inside the package. You also get two clips for your little plushies to put them on a book or your hat or whatever.

title: Net Is Useless
text: This diving set is really cute. The little characters are really cute and their wild "hair" makes it easy to grab under water. However, those little wild "hairs" also make the net pretty useless. The plastic of the "hair" gets caught in the net. You can't really scoop them up because the shape is just too awkward.

title: Cute Set
text: This is a cute set for Tweens. The quality of the contents aren't the best, so if you're hardcore into scrapbooking or stationary, it will be disappointing to you. However, for a tween, it is perfect. Plus they can use the case for storage of current and additional materials. My 12 year old loved it.

title: Overflowing Bucket
text: This is an overflowing bucket set! If you have a kid who likes to dig, this set is definitely going to win them over. My three year old loves this bucket set. The shape off the shovel is really nice for getting big scoops of sand or dirt. The top keeps everything organized in the bucket when you are carrying it around. Great set.

title: Roblox Figures
text: My kids love Roblox. This set is a lot of fun for them. It does have quite a few small pieces, somthis is definitely not for the younger crowd. They are bigger than Lego people, but the essential design seems pretty similar.

title: Raptors!
text: These are so much fun! Get two, so they can “talk” to each other. They are a little big for a small child's finger. Fitting a 5 year old pretty big, but fitting a 10 year old perfectly. They make noises at you, reacting to your touch. Easy on/off switch on the back of the head, so you don't have a talking toy chattering away all night long. The details on these are really nice and they are so much fun!

title: Good Set
text: My boys are Lego fanatics. This set was a little more complicated than other sets they have used. It took them (10 year old and 8 year old)  a little over an hour to build the entire set. It is vehicles and lots of accessory people/animals. They really enjoy this set and were really happy with how it turned out.

title: Broke Immediately
text: My baby loves bunnies. They are her absolute favorite. I was excited for her to try this pull toy. It broke on the third pull. The cord inside the ribbon just let go and the basket just hung without being pulled back up. The bottom basket looks a little strange in person. It is hard to tell it is a basket because the bunny never full reaches the basket. It is always a few inches below it. The fabric is nice. But it was an unfortunate fail.

title: Junk Kit
text: This is the worst science/craft kit we have ever used. I opened the box and felt like I was peering into a junk drawer. You get three balloons. (Hilariously, they had the exact same balloons in a gift bag from a Memorial Day party.) Just white balloons with stars printed on them. You also get a cut off top of a water bottle for a funnel. You use the water bottle funnel to add water beads and glitter (you get a couple tiny packs) to the balloon. Add water. That's it. The filled balloon is your Squoosh-O. They look nothing like the picture on the box. You can't really see the beads or glitter inside the not at all clear balloons. I think you'd be better off DIYing this thing. Balloons, water beads, used water bottle. No need for the kit.

title: Chris Pratt Hamster Ball
text: My boys love this thing. It does come with one Chris Pratt figure. It works like a remote control car, only it is a little like Chris Pratt is a hamster in the wheel. My Jurassic World loving boys love this! My 3, 4, 6, and 8 year olds all love this. It isn't too complicated for my 4 year old. A word of warning: if you bash Chris Pratt into a wall over and over, the ball will break open and be difficult to close.

title: Perfect Stamping Set
text: I absolutely love this set. Years ago, I got into metal stamping. It was really hard and expensive to track down all the bits and pieces. I had gotten rid of all my supplies. Now, my tween was interested in metal stamping jewelry. This set has stamps that are just as good as the expensive ones I had years ago. This set only has the uppercase letters. It includes a small hammer and a metal block to stamp on. There are several pieces of metal to stamp and things you can make. I showed her how to stamp the metal. Hitting it very hard and not moving the stamp around. She was easily able to take it from there and make her own creations. You also get small jewelry pliers to add chains and hoops and things to your metal charms. And it came with a box to hold the stamps. I'm really impressed with the quality of the stamps.

title: Claws.
text: My boys love these claws. They are made of a softer plastic, so they move around. They are held on by two elastic loops that go around the child's wrist like a bracelet. These are a hit with all ages. My 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 year olds all love these claws. The older ones think they are funny to scare people with. The younger ones run around pretending to be raptors. This is a great toy and gets daily use here.

title: Dinosaur Volcano!
text: This volcano set was a lot larger than I anticipated. It is so much fun! The dinosaurs are about standard beanie baby size. The volcano holds all of them easily. My son often adds more Schleich dinosaurs inside the volcano and they all fit. The dinosaurs themselves aren't overly detailed, but they are still a lot of fun. The volcano isn't great for carrying around. It does have a loop on top, but it doesn't make a great bag. But it is fun to play with the dinosaurs in and around the volcano!

title: Not For Kids
text: This game should be rated 17 and up. It is definitely an adult game. I would not recommend it for teenagers at all, even though the age rating says it is for teens and up. If it were a movie, it would be rated R. I think they could have tamed down the sexual aspect of the game and made it simply horror and it would be an interesting game. The packaging is clever. It really looks like a VHS box.

title: DodgeBall
text: These foam balls are perfect for dodgeball! They aren't super bouncy, so they aren't good balls for things like four square or kickball. But they are excellent for pegging each other with! They come with a drawstring bag. They are smaller than a kid sized basketball, so they are easy to grab and throw with one hand over head. They seem pretty durable so far. My five boys are rough and these are holding up to their torture.

title: Fun Game
text: My kids love this game! My 6, 8, 10, and 12 year olds can play it without adult help. Game play is rather quick. It isn't a long and drawn out game. They think it is great fun.

title: Pokémon
text: My boys love this set. They said the instructions were good. The set itself isn't huge. It took my 10 year old a little over half an hour to complete the entire set. My boys love building and the love Pokémon. This set was a definite win with them.

title: Tail Problems
text: My boys are dinosaur lovers. They have LOTS of dinosaur toys. In the world of dinosaur toys, while this is a new one for them and they have none that look like the Indoraptor, this toy just doesn't get much love. For one, the tail comes apart. It comes and you have to "assemble" it, which essentially means you put the tail on. But it is just too easy for his tail to come off. He seems to always been loosing his tail. If they hd made the tail all one piece, this would be a five star toy.

title: Batteries, Paper, and Frills
text:
What is the last thing you want to open and see on game night? "Batteries Not Included." Now you have been warned. Normally, this would be fine since I keep a stock of AA and AAA batteries. But this thing take 3 C batteries. I cannot think of the last time I bought a C battery. Game night postponed.
The Uno cards in the attack games are different from the regular Uno cards. This comes with plenty of cards, but be warned that they are not interchangeable.
The thing that really bugs me about this game is that they made the frills paper. They are card stock frills. How cheap is that? They also like to fall out of their holder.
I'd give it one star, except for one crucial fact. They chose the EXACT RIGHT dinosaur for this game. The dilophosaurus spits venom at its prey. Perfect for spitting UNO cards at you! That was just so very clever of them.

title: T-Rex
text: This very large t-rex made my boys very happy. He makes noise as you walk him around. In my opinion, it has too many moving parts and noises. But I'm a mom. I prefer the stationary Schleich dinosaurs because they don't DO anything and therefore don't annoy me. This is good quality. The boys think this dinosaur is AWESOME because of the noises. He is a lot bigger than the Schleich t-rexes we have. So far, he does seem very sturdy. My boys are not easy on their dinosaurs. My boys are 3, 4, 6, 8, ad 10. They all really like this t-rex.

title: Animal Bracelets
text: These Twisty Petz are too cute! So, it is a beaded animal with a cutesy name. You pull the head and tale and you have a string of beads on a stretchy band. The tale inserts into the head and you can wear it as a bracelet! So cute. To make it back into an animal, you just twist the legs back! I thought that part would be difficult, but the largest bead is the "body", so you just have to twist the next two beads to make the legs on either side. These are really very clever. My 12 year old daughter thinks they are super cute. As far as age, I'd say 3 or 4 through 12 or 13 would like them. They have that exciting mystery pack aspect, as well.

title: Magnet Tin
text: My 2, 4, 6, and 8 year olds love this little magnet tin. The magnets are not the most durable. They come in a paper doll fashion where you have to tear them out. They are on the thin side and can be ripped in half in the hands of a kid. However, my kids love mixing and matching the robot parts. There are far more parts than places to make robots. Of course, they can't just make them on the fridge, they have to dump all the pieces and make them in the tin. This keeps them busy for quite a long time. It is a great quiet activity for a toddler and I have considered stuffing it into my church bag for the 2 and 4 year olds. Very cute. Love the colors.

title: Cheaply Made
